reviews.text:
This clinic is wonderful, we came here with panic and we left here with confidence. Nice friendly people in a whole.

Good food as well.

Thank you !

I had a good experience here. It was in the middle of renovations, so that was disruptive. However, the nurses and therapists were caring and helpful. The doctors were more disconnected. I got the help and diagnosis I needed. I am now attending an outpatient program at the same clinic. It's good to be able to go somewhere familiar.

I attended Albert Road Clinic just yesterday as an outpatient (at the consulting suites). I had been referred to a very senior and eminent psychiatrist there. As I expected, the doctor was extremely capable. He clearly loves his field and truly values his patients. I felt that we got on very well. The outcome of the thorough 1.5-hour interview (consultation) was better than I had anticipated. I have rarely seen better work in my twenty-five years of journeying with these mental-health conditions. All staff whom I encountered were friendly and helpful, particularly the doctor's administrative support, who had put together a comprehensive and informative email to me at the time of referral. For all of these reasons, I will always remember the name Ramsay Health Care.

I have been told by mental health professionals (Psychologist/ CAT team) that I am 'unwell' and need to seek intensive treatment to overcome my destructive and often suicidal thoughts.
Albert Rd clinic was recommended, but after reading these reviews it appears that this clinic will simply exacerbate my problems.
Very sad.

Just appalling. The facilities are dated and it's like being in a cheap hotel for $1,200 a night. You come here to rest but the single rooms are always taken. The nurses won't give you enough medication to sleep "because the doctor hasn't signed it off to that amount"'. Come on nurses - be bold! Let us sleep! Nurses spend more time writing notes than helping patients. A real let down. I didn't see any quality patient care at all. Go somewhere else, maybe the Melbourne clinic?

Wow what an absolutely fabulous team in the COU. My beautiful son was admitted early hours Friday morning with suspected Meningitis to which turned out to be ???.
But in saying that all this, the nursing staff, ward staff and doctors were all just fabulous. I personally can not say thank u enough for all what you did for my son and his girlfriend in their time of need. And the way u made me feel when I finally got there after a quick 5hr drive.

I was bought in by ambulance and upon my discharge my stuff was partially missing from my room when I went for a chest x-ray...I was only gone for 15 minutes maximum and clearly I left it in my bag and returned to my bed in emergency department and my phone and charger have disappeared .. my wallet was still there on the table but my $50 note went missing. I asked to my nurse what happened to my items but she kept on shrugging me off and ignoring me pretending she was busy.. I knew she was stalling time.. I then returned the following day with my partner to emergency to try make a complaint officially but she was working at the front triage counter.. I don’t recall her name but she is a very tall and muscular woman with short shaven hair and glasses... 
I think it is outrageous that no one took me serious and when I went to try and make a complaint in person it was her at the counter.
Slow. Only one in the waiting room and still not even looking like getting in. Awful!
My daughter has broke her leg they were very helpful

The Emergency section is abysmal - you can sit and wait up to 7 hours and have to watch people putting on an act to ensure they get further in front in the line.  Similar in the Albury Hospital ED.  Cannot understand how people can come in first in line but still be there with even very painful infections and there are also about 8 doctors on but no-one sees them for all those hours.  Extremely annoying to watch people with NO urgent need come in and put on acts of "how much in pain or suffering" they are in.  I went in last week and no less than 12 people were permitted to get in before me, yet I had trouble breathing.
Great facility and service. Physiotherapy assessment was first rate.
No support with mental health

I was there 31st July 2017. Vomiting and tummy ached. The emergency Nurse Jenny was very kind to me. Her devoting to patients I am sure is shown to all. Thanks to you Jenny I felt much better the next day.
Fully equipped hospital and nursing home.

I found that this hospital is a great and friendly place except there seems to be less staff on duty and more frustration from the staff that are there. How can a hospital be run  efficiently when you overload the few staff that are on each shift. I certainly hope they are not trying to eventually shut it down from being a hospital  for the locals to stay. Or turn it into just another extension of the Kiewa Valley House. We need a hospital for us. I would have had to go to Wodonga/Albury for my health and to be honest I felt way more comfortable in our local hospital with my GP.

5 star experience in the emergency department at the Anglis when my son broke his arm yesterday. What was a very traumatic time for our son (12 years old) the staff made more bearable for him, very caring and empathetic to his needs. Pain was managed very quickly, x-rays done and casting applied perfectly. Could not fault anything.
Our sincere thanks the doctors, nurses and all staff for their amazing care. We are so lucky to have this facility and these people in our community.

Capable hospital with ED, ICU and Maternity services. Staff usually friendly but always professional. Cafe brand common to all victorian public hospitals but realiable quality coffee with a variety of food options. Close to public transport and major roads.

I was at the Angliss Hospital for a few days, i had two nurses (and the surgical staff) in that time that were lovely and nice, everyone else did not care.
The staff were rude and did not know what was going on as their was no communication with each other. Multiple times i had to tell the doctors/nurses what i had been told what the treatment plan was as they contradicted each other.
If i did not take the initiative to fast myself prior to the surgery it would have been delayed as i had all of 10 minutes from being told that i am going to have surgery to being in theatre, luckily i had not eaten that day just in case i may have had surgery.
One nurse in particular clearly just did not want to be at work, i told her i was in pain and she stated "no your not."
At one stage i worked myself into a state in which i could not calm down as i was in so much pain, the same nurse was alerted and she just walked away.
One of the other staff members came up to me and  was able to calm me down, but she was not a nurse or a doctor and it was not her job.
I will not be returning to this hospital ever, i will make an effort to go to the emergency room at box hill which is a lot further away from me, but at least i will receive adequate care. 
The food was good, and again two nurses and theatre staff were exceptional and i wish i remembered their names as i have no faults for them.
Being also in the medical field i know that some days are hard and super busy, but it does not take a lot to be nice to people and to show some empathy, as well as basic care and first aid.
Upon discharge i was not told what was going on, i told them that i was constantly nauseous and they did not care until i was on the floor next to the bed vomiting that i was told i should go home tomorrow instead. In that time i was given one anti nausea tablet and was sent home with no anti nausea medication.
I went home with a medical certificate for two days (i was at the angliss hospital for more than two days) and i was not told when if their was any work restrictions, if i could drive ect. and had to seek advice from a general practitioner.

I went in recently, a bit hesitant that I wasn't having a procedure done privately instead. I found all staff to be very friendly, warm, extremely professional and genuine with my care. They were very busy but not once as a result of that did I ever feel like I'd been left in the dark or my concerns and questions not answered. I was pleasantly surprised and felt reassured by my whole experience and care. The staff look like they work extremely hard but did not reflect this onto patients. Thank you Angliss. Keep up the good work!

My father in law was admitted to Ward 2 East. He was malnourished and in dire need of medical attention. Nothing has been too much trouble for the staff there. We get phone calls if he has a fall. They are happy to discuss his progress whenever we visit and the meals he is receiving are fantastic. The Speech Pathologist sat with us while he ate in order to work out what types and textures of food he required. The social worker was very young, but extremely efficient. They have made a complex and upsetting experience into something that is now being managed in such a professional manner. When I visited today, my father in law was feeding himself an entire plate of meat and veg, followed by custard. His mood is better and he has clean bedlinen and clothing. Only a week ago, he was barely eating and was bedridden. Can't thank the staff in this ward enough. I cannot think of a single thing to complain about!

I am not sure what people expect public hospital it's for free.
I too have been to public hospital at Austin, never again from emergency the blond lady nurse is so rude and no empathy for no one very sad for you. Emergency was full at reception but inside all beds empty are you for real
They ask you at Austin if you have private cover, if yes you get a bed straight away and seen straight away, but you do definitely get treated differently than public 
I now have private cover and the difference is 100% clean good food quite and the nurses run as so as you buzz, lemonade given 
I guess you get what you pay for !!

I’ve been here to emergency a couple of times, and yes it can take a long time to be seen when your problem is not that urgent. But when I was in need of care for an acute dystonic reaction I was taken in within 10 minutes. The problem was fixed within a timely manner and my nurse, Tasha, was very nice. I didn’t even feel the drip being put in it was done very well. Other times it was a very long wait but staff were still very nice

Really bad experience , 2 months ago  I came here with my kid got allergy had been waiting for 3 hours and now I came here with my wife got the serious condition and still have been waiting almost 6 hours may be will be turning to 8 hours  . I don’t know exactly what they do, if the doctor is busy they can put the patient in the room to get better condition. Not like this as you know The Human Righ

I know what people expect when they go to a public hospital emergency but I found the staff and care provided exceptional when I had to go in at 4:30 on a Friday afternoon.  Big THANK YOU to all of the staff who looked after me.

Staff are negligent and do essentially nothing regarding threats, abuse and or assault. Rights and responsibilities are not respected. Discrimination is commonplace. Not a good place to recover. You will get more sick 'll the longer you remain here. Do not recommend at all. Poor service and hygiene. Avoid.

There are no words that can describe the lack of care given by the staff at this hospital. Oh wait that is why it is call a health service because it is not a Hospital it is a health service. All the locals call it Bairnsdale butchers. As 1 doctor told me , he would NOT take his dog there to be put down. Another sat by my bed crying because she was unable to access the help she felt I needed. 
Be advised, bypass the Bairnsdale butchers and the Sale slaughter house (otherwise known as hospitals) and you will get help and treatment for your ill health.
People are paid a lot of money to run this bush clinic but are always missing in action when a complaint is needed to be made.
The nurses need to be retrained in patient care because they are rude and uncaring. How do I know, because I was once a nurse. 
I would like to have something nice to say but I can't think of 1 positive thing.     GOOD LUCK TO ALL WHO ENTER THROUGH THE DOORS OF THIS REGIONAL  HEALTH SERVICE.
Not happy with service of Emergency.  Reported there with a Fracture.  Doctor not interested.  Sent home with fracture untreated. Would not recommend

Good place i think. At lot of people complain about brhs and say hospitals closer to Melbourne are better but everyone in orbost complains about their hospital and think bairnsdales is so much better. But I just think we should all be grateful we can go to any hospital and get world class healthcare

I don't know where to start with my awful experiences dealing with Bairnsdale hospital. From the time staff told my dying grandfather to stop complaining, the time staff told me to give birth more quietly so I don't make a disturbance or my friends even less fortunate events dealing with the hospital. What can I say? Seems like you're helping bent on killing people .

Easily the absolute worst hospital I have ever been to. Staff were rude and ignorant, I waited over 5 hours my first visit there while experiencing severe mental health issues (and was sat in a public waiting room while shaking and crying that entire 5 hours) only to leave without ANY treatment on my own accord after numerous attempts to make staff aware and wary of the fact I was an increasing risk to myself and others and that I was fearful I would lose control. 
Well I guess after a 5 hour wait, watching people who came in with genuinely minor ailments one by one all go before me to be treated. I did. I did become a danger to others in that house hospital and myself, I ended up yelling at a staff member who wouldn't even listen to me when I was trying to say I was having suicidal thoughts and had started planning to go through with them and I left the hospital in such a state that I believe I should have most certainly been kept and observed at the absolute least before returning to be in the public's eye. 
It was a seriously embarrassing and damaging experience for me and I don't believe I was treated fairly or with any care or respect. 
To put myself (and everyone else at the hospital) in serious danger from an unpredictable and scared person and not in any way speak to them or isolate them in any way in inexcusable. 
What if I had hurt someone? What if I had killed myself? 
Well, two days after that occurance; i tried. I hung myself in the back yard of a home i was staying at over there and was taken right back to this hospital. Where for a SECOND TIME they completely failed me and this time, badly traumatised me for life.  I was pinned to the ground having both my shoulders dislocated by a police officer (whom I warned I had hyper mobility and pleaded with to stop hurting me over and over) while a staff member of the hospital came into the room, strapped me to a bed and COMPLETELY WITHOUT WARNING ME SHOT ME WITH A LARGE DOSE OF KETAMINE. I was not informed that it had even happened nor what substance was shoved into my body and I had a terrifying adverse reaction to it that I can not even put into words still to this day. 
I, shaking and terrified, told the staff about what I had experienced and even made a nurse stand and hold my hand until I could breathe properly again and stopped hallucinating. That was at least a 15 minute to half hour window of time where I was more scared than I had ever been in my entire life. 
I was given TWO MORE shots at the same dosage via needle with out any sort of consent and in fact a threat to pursue legal action if they continued to administer a drug to me that I clearly did not respond to normally or in a good way what so ever. 
I understand I was irate and acting abnormally when I got the first one and excuse that as a poorly handled situation. But, making an unstable and extremely fearful patient, even more fearful and unstable three times over when they became completely complacent after the first instance as not to have to experience it ever again, is sick. It is absolutely disgusting and I still have nightmares on a constant basis. 
When I am financially able, I plan to pursue such matters in court and hopefully get whoever made the awful decisions regarding my "care" at the hospital the hell fired so they don't traumatise any more young adults in crisis! 
If I could give minus stars, I would.
Storm C.T. 21 year old female
Brilliant staff, stress free experiance due to their professionalism, nice and clean aswell
Fast, friendly and Professional.  Been here twice.  Very efficient and they look after you.
Kind, friendly, professional and gently-spoken staff. They made a daunting process very tolerable...and afterwards they gave me a terrific cuppa tea and sandwiches, as the sedative wore off.

LARGE REGIONAL PUBLIC HOSPITAL WHICH OFFERS A WIDE RANGE OF SERVICES
Ballarat Health Services is anchored by the hospital and does well for the resourcing it receives. There have been major building upgrades from the (almost Dickensian) wards of the 1970's to today's much more modern facility. It competes (successfully) with private hospitals in the town and is well connected to universities and training institutions.

Was referred by my GP and after she diagnosed AFIB.  Arrogant Cardiologist dismissed all the detail in the referral letter and redid an ECG even though I told him I was OK at the moment and the AFIB comes and goes.  Returned to my GP and she apologized and organised another bulk bill cardiologist in Bacchus who quickly organised tests and diagnosed a blocked widow maker artery as well.  Surgery completed at another Hospital and on the way to full recovery now.  I just received the appointment letter from the Ballarat base to see them as an outpatient.  You can die on their waiting lists.  Never seen such a total disregard and disrespect shown by a specialist for another health care professional referral.  My advise is go to Melbourne, or if you can, ST John of God in Ballarat.
Beautiful hospital to walk into. Volunteers to greet you as you enter letting you know where you need to go. All staff are happy friendly that i encountered. Explained clearly what was to happen
Very Kind and caring people and hard working staff , I am really grateful for everyone who took care of me during my stay .

If I could give a zero out of 5 that is what I would give. Appalling treatment by the radiologists and emergency department . After the radiologists changed their mri findings twice which resulted in me receiving no specialist review I have now had to seek a second opinion elsewhere at huge cost to myself. It appears that if you are a single female ,over 50 with no family you have no place in this world with this hospital.

Very Kind and caring people and hard working staff , I am really grateful for everyone who took care of me during my stay .

After the radiologists changed their mri findings twice which resulted in me receiving no specialist review I have now had to seek a second opinion elsewhere at huge cost to myself. It appears that if you are a single female ,over 50 with no family you have no place in this world with this hospital.

Staff are always professional & friendly. Hospital always looks clean & staff always are dressed neat & tidy. 
Only complaint is the car park & the cars that park blocking the path way in & out just to park so they don’t have to walk. Fines need to apply when cars park outside the marked parking bays

If I could rate this place with 0 stars I would. Absolutely appalling hospital I wouldn’t even send a dying dog there. The Nurses and Doctors have no idea what they’re doing which almost resulted in the death of my nan. I actually observed a nurse leaving a blind patient on the toilet unsupervised which is a prime example on the care they provide. No information was given to my nan so she didn’t know what was going on, NONE of her past history had been collected (which is illegal may I add) until 2 days after her admission which MY FAMILY had to push them to get AND she never received appropriate care because of a lack of communication with staff. Luckily she pulled through but is now dealing with heart failure, COPD and fluid around her lungs. Upon discharge they provided her with NO support whatsoever, they just sent her on her way home. No oxygen tank or information on where to get one was given, no social worker or district nurses to check up on her while she’s at home, keep in mind she’s a very ill 80 year old lady who cannot drive or even walk without gasping for air. A week after her discharge she thought she would be recieving an at home check up with a district nurse who never showed up, nan called us asking if we could see what was happening with that so we called the hospital and they said they hadn’t organised ANYTHING so my family has to run around to organise this support when it was the hospitals job to contact them. Absolutely disgusted in them and that isn’t even the whole story.
Under funded, under staffed.. no After hours emergency surgeon .. my partner almost died due to this.

I have had a month of post acute care including,  cleaning, equipment hire and about to start physio. My experience with Bass Coast Health was amazing from the start of the processes. Couldn't have done my recovery without their help. Thankyu so much
Freaking crazy wait times even if you and your child are the only ones waiting. EVERY TIME.

I spent three weeks in Beleura at the alcohol rehab program and I found it to be the most worthwhile thing I have done. The staff, nurses and doctors were superb and listen to what you have to say. The food is quite good and the program they have you partake in is a life changer. A very clean and well maintained facility. I highly recommend this hospital in every way. If you have a drinking problem, this is definitely the best place to go.

Recently I had a 5 day stay in Beleura hospital. If you have to be in hospital this is a very good place to be. Every member of staff was pleasant, professional, friendly and helpful - some of them very helpful indeed! Everything from medical care, facilities and food was great!
Wonderful caring &professional staff, clean hospital, good food

I couldn’t compliment the folk highly enough at this hospital - for the brisk and efficient admittance in this morning (Lisa) but especially for the empathy and care shown by the nurses shown on the Balcombe Ward and the surgical nurses in the operating theatre. I bet that’s not in their job description but unsurprisingly this is what I valued the most. What genuine and authentic people in a world generally indifferent to others.
Excelent care and professional, friendly and devoted staff. Thanks!

Ran 4 hours behind schedule the day of my surgery coupled with the protocol of no food or water, obviously rough on the soul, BUT nothing unusual there, I can't name a hospital that ever runs on schedule. The anesthetist explained the procedure to me (wisdom teeth removal under sedation), he was very attentive to my concerns and reassured me that he administers anti-nausea drugs to all of his patients, for general comfort. Now, I am absolutely terrified of medical procedures, but I awoke with very minimal bruising and swelling, nursing staff were lovely and stood by me the entire time. I could tell the procedure was conducted well, and the surgeon did an efficient and affective job. Overall, I'm very happy with the service provided here.
Had my wisdom teeth out in the day surgery here and the nurses were great! Really helpful and made me feel a lot less nervous!
Thank you to the surgeon and all the staff for looking  after my mother for the 2nd time in a year fantastic people. she had shoulder surgery .
Injured my leg in a fall, was great service.
It shouldn't take more than one phone call to cancel an appointment. In this case it took 10. The easiest solution seems to be not to book in the first place!

Good place.
Rehab/dental/foot doctor, 
plus other services health related.
Much recommended.
thank you for looking after my grandmother
Felt confident the whole time that I was being looked after well. Thanks
Extensive range of health services ranging from community health care through to hospital care, accident and emergency. Part of Bendigo Health network that includes Bendigo Hospital.
Good school
No.1 hospital, awesome!

Over many years I have known both “in and out” patients of this Hospital. I have visited it maybe 100 times. I have observed staff and dealt with specialists many times, only to find them thoroughly competent and dedicated people. I have experienced courtesy and excellence in all encounters. Finally,  the facilities are first-rate and clinical cleanliness is outstanding.

I have had to use the ambulance  emergency service 2 times over the past couple of years, and was taken to this hospital. They looked after me impeccably. For someone who has never been admitted to a hospital, I couldn't have asked for better care. Much appreciated.

Awesome, simply awesome. Both Ambulance Victoria and the boys and girls and the cardiac team at the Hospital were totally professional and supportive.
I couldn't have been in better care.

I unexpectedly had to go to Box Hill Hospital emergency for a potential heart related issue. The triage nurse was excellent and quickly diagnosed that I needed to be seen quickly. From there on in for the next five hours, the attention I received from all staff was outstanding. Thank you to all those who looked after me and go me back on track so quickly.

Quite impressive for a Public Hospital. The level of staff professionalism was that of a Private Hospital.

Usually have trouble sleeping in hospitals when I’m not in a private room due to noise from other patients. Was very happy when the staff found some ear plugs for me, allowing me to get some decent sleep.

I have been a patient at Broadmeadows many times. The staff are efficient, personable and punctual. The catering efficient and delicious. The therapists good natured and extremely Professional. The only thing that I didn't like was the air conditioning was too cold for me. (First world problems  :)

I had a great experince luckily. I wouldve gave 5 starts but i just had to wait a while to go into surgery. I want to thank all the staff they were amazing. Special thanks to Amanda the anaesthesist, Rowan (i think his name was) the nurse . Just made my epxerience very comfortable .

My father had a bad fall and the woman in the next bed buzzed the staff and no one came to assist. The woman got out of bed to call someone and a staff member stopped at the door and just moved on. Approximately 15 minutes went by until someone came to help him up. I asked the doctor on the ward and she considered 15 minutes as immediate attention.  I would hate to think that it could have been someone who had just had a heart attack or stroke . Not impressed.

No one go to this hospital my mum came back from it and she had the worst experience ever, she pressed the assistance button and no one came and when they came she said I'll be back 3 hours later and the tea mum said can I have tea and sure after awhile they left it on the table where you can't reach it. Worst hospital go to the boxhill one they take care of you 24/7 and my mum wanted to live at that hospital.
Been here for the past two weeks and love the care .

Lovely friendly staff i felt understood and cared about.
Just wonderful volunteer driver too.
Great place, people there are so nice.
Ok well this place is staffed by top quality people wat can i say it's a very care ing and we'll run place 5 stars plus
Sometimes the service and parking should be a lot better

Caring, friendly knowledgeable doctors and health professionals. Outstanding service. I have visited every week for 4 months now and am seeing improvements in my health that I never thought possible. Thank you.

I had eye surgery yesterday (7.03.19) with  Dr. Stephen Jones staff at hospital Awesome and my special thanks to Nurse Tina was very kind and very helpful the way she treated me i didn't feel like I'm a patient. Good work Tina keep it up.

Mohamed
Very friendly staff and a very good service

Simply amazing experience from start to finish. The staff are so sweet and caring. 

Thank you for looking after me.
My mum Gemma had a cataract removed today the staff from start to finish were amazing mum said they were angels

I very recently had a family member in  palliative care at brighton cabrini. it was a nightmare. almost no communication - we were left in the dark about what they were doing to him. when we asked for a blanket and asked that the patient's personal hygiene be attended to, and that he be fed and be given fluids we were accused of 'upsetting my staff' by the co-ordinator. we were, from that point on, ignored totally by most of the nurses. only a couple of them were kind and helpful. 
while in their care my terminally ill relative was accidentally burnt and fell,  most probably due to a high fever being left untreated. it was horrific!
all up, my advice would be DONT GO ANYWHERE NEAR THIS HOSPITAL!

The physios here are knowledgeable, caring and excellent at what they do. I can walk again after only coming 3 times! They always make sure to assess every possible issue and treat it accordingly. The outpatient receptionist Molly is a pleasure to deal with; she is attentive, reliable and she goes out of her way to make you feel comfortable and welcome. I look forward to coming every week.

Would rather give the Glenhuntly Rd facility a no star rating than any star at all! I am appalled by both the facility itself, the cleanliness and the level of care..... 
I would avoid it at all costs. Completely inadequate!!
Highly recommended.

name: Rehabilitation Service, Hopetoun Street Campus, Elsternwick

reviews.text: This my second stay at Cabrini Hopetoun Rehab in just under 6 years. I chose to return to this Rehab because my previous stay was so unbelievably good. I am extremely disappointed this time. Some of the nursing staff have absolutely no idea as to the reason you are a patient nor are they familiar with prescribed drugs. It seems as if lower qualified nurses are now being employed.  Numerous nurses have told me to remind them when I require certain drugs, I always thought it was supposed to be the other way around. It can take up to 15 minutes for a nurse to show up if you ring the buzzer. The nicest people in the place seem to be the receptionist, some of the people bringing food to patients rooms and the cleaner who is always beaming. The level of care at Cabrini Hopetoun has dropped dramatically and I would suggest looking at other rehab hospitals in the area.

My name  is John Sojka
 Recently I had to undergo open heart surgery 
I was fortunate to  have chosen Cabrini Malvern for my surgery and Cabrini Hopetoun for my Rehab 
The care that I received after the operation In Cabrini hospital was exceptional all the staff and nurses were very attentive and helpful.
This was my third stay in Cabrini Hopetoun and again I found everyone, be they, nurses, physiotherapist , etc etc  to be absolutely caring, nothing was too much for them and it is no small measure that  thanks to these dedicate professionals that  I am able to resume my life 
Once again thank you all
John Sojka
Very professional service and a lovely setting to help my parent recover from surgery.
The physios were patient, gentle and professional. The reception staff (special mention to Molly) are lovely.
Thanks very much Cabrini from your 100% success for Mum. Though there's needs to be more care and patience when communicating with caring relatives. I felt like I was in your way and disrupting you.

I was in a surgical ward for three days and the care I received was exceptional. The staff were warm,  professional and cheerful and no task was too much trouble. Also, the quality and range of the meals was terrific.

This is regarding a staff member .
I crashed my motorcycle and was sitting on the  sidewalk and this staff member from Cabrini was walking to work But she stops and it was raining so she puts her umbrella on me and had a chat with me for 15 minutes. Invited me for a check up or just a cup of tea and also made sure that i was perfectly fine before she left. Great person. Whoever it was, i hope you see this.THANK YOU.
From this i can easily tell about the rest of the people at the hospital.

Great hospital - first time was delivering my daughter and they were so patient with me, and fantastic aftercare. Food was amazing and my husband could come and go as he pleased. Second time was my 1yo soon having a procedure. They found a bed for me see that I was comfortable and they were bry attendant to how my son was recovering post op. Couldn't ask for more! (Parking facilities could be expanded though)
Good private hospital. Parking is quite bad though even for taxis and ambulances. They have a non rebateable fee for attending the Emergency Department.
Good care for patients
A dedicated, empathetic group of health professionals working with sufferers of MND and other CNS diseases.  Cannot thank these people enough.
Average

Staff here are lovely, such a nice warm welcoming and I was on here for work, not as a patient or family member seeing a patient.

Review based on the experiences and night staff working on the 14DEC18.

Nice comfortable and homely facilities for families and friends visiting patients.

South Melbourne's #1 International Reviewer 
#visitvictoriaaustralia
I gave birth at Casey Hospital in January and the staff were amazing! The midwives were supportive and comforting.  I could not of asked for a better delivery.   Thank you for my beautiful baby x

Have been waiting for 4 hours for a doctor to see my son who obtained a cut near his eye after hitting his head on a table. I can't believe how long people should wait for a medical treatment. 1 hour is fine.. but 4 hours???! Casey hospital should have a better triage system and faster response.

I came into emergency with a busted appendix and ended up staying 5 days. The whole experience was handled in the best possible manner I could have expected. I cannot speak highly enough of the wonderful staff and facilities at this hospital.

I read a lot of bad reviews here, but my experience was good. I went to emergency and I was attended within reason time. I was not in agony or very bad, but needed attention. I think I was moved in with the nurse within  2 hours of my arrival,  1 hour later (after pain killers) the doctor came to me and deal with my issue. All nurses were very friendly and helpful when I asked  anything. I think that expectations are what makes the difference.

I had a very positive experience giving birth at this hospital. As soon as I was in labour and admitted into a room, all the midwives were amazing. They listened to me, never forced anything on me and were genuinely caring. They had to get the baby out fast due to a very high fever and they handled the situation so well. The doctors worked fast to get me stitched up as I was losing a lot of blood and I'm very thankful for everything they did. Post birth care was also amazing, they helped me do everything and our baby was very well looked after in Special Care. The maternity ward at this hospital is definitely worth 5 stars. Thank you to all the midwives and doctors that were a part of my birth.
Great country hospital with friendly, helpful and skilled staff who really look after you.
The nurses have an excellent manner and sense of humor they took excellent care of me and everyone else waaaay better than Bendigo
I have experienced the best service from the drs surgery and nursing staff at Castlemaine hospital I would rate this a 10/10 excellent service thanks to all the staff 😊

I had day surgery here on the 9th of November 2018.
The staff where all so lovely and informative. Very attentive to me before and after the surgery. 
I was in much more pain the inticipated and they where more than accommodating, constantly checking in and making sure I was ok.
It is a smaller, older hospital but I found it more homely & friendly then Bendigo Base. 
Thank you to all the friendly staff for making my stay the best experience possible.

After attending a few classes of the pain management I have quickly learnt about chronic pain. I had immediate relief and over a few months I have ceased using Targin (slow release opiate). 

My pains, stresses and outlooks have all done a 180. 

I'm enjoying life more than ever!
Thank you Sue for your reminders, support and advice!
Thank you Joan for your amazing insights and thoughts!
There are others whose names evade me, the dry needling was very helpful

Stop suffering and make friends with this beautiful collection of people!
Wonderful crew.

Unfortunately,  I had a negative experience with Caulfield Hospital - a situation which greatly disappointed me as I remembered the place with much fondness from earlier times. 

The trouble started when my elderly mother was admitted to the Dementia ward.   

From the beginning there was little , if any,  information forthcoming from ward staff  in regard to her general condition and progress. As the days went by, I didn't receive one phone call and  even during personal visits it was a challenge to find out what was happening. Clearly, as her next of kin, primary carer, enduring guardian and medical power of attorney, I had the right to be kept up to date .

Finally, I was summoned to a meeting  and advised that the powers that be at the hospital had decided that my mother should / would be committed to a nursing home.  However, there were a few problems. First of all, she didn't want to go into such a place. Secondly, I wouldn't agree to it. And, most significantly, her GP,  with whom we had regular contact including home visits, stated that such a move wasn't necessary. When I wouldn't comply, Caulfield seemed to retaliate by steadfastly refusing to discuss the subject of when she could leave. In other words, she would be held hostage until I agreed to their demands. A lawyer who was involved with a seniors rights advocacy group, quickly informed me that the hospital did not have the legal power to take such a course of action. In fact, what they were trying to do was a direct violation of patient rights.

We became locked into a stand off situation which dragged on for several weeks during which time my mother became increasingly distressed and disorientated. Every conceivable obstacle, excuse and delaying tactic was thrown in the way to prevent her from leaving .  

When her own doctor was able to establish that there was no medical reason for her to be detained any longer, I made the decision to discharge her . Ward staff then provoked a yelling match in her room which reduced her to tears. 

In a last-ditch effort to impose their will onto us, the hospital then tried to have me removed from the picture as the power of attorney and guardian by making a concerted (but unsuccessful) attempt to discredit my performance as a carer. 

We ended up going to VCAT . An investigation was carried out by the Office of the Public Advocate which included interviewing around a dozen witnesses. The findings of that investigation obviously left the tribunal member with no doubt that the hospital was in the wrong and the case was decided in our favor. Not only did the relevant managers  at Caulfield repeatedly refuse to accept my authority as being my mother's legally appointed decision maker, they also tried to deny both of us our legal rights and completely disregarded our wishes.  But , perhaps most alarmingly,  when the real trouble began they appeared to make a deliberate attempt to cover up their unacceptable conduct.

My advice to other carers who find themselves in a similar situation is to know you rights. Also,  insist that both your own wishes and those of the person you are caring for are respected and don't allow the hospital to forcibly take control of the decision making through a process of bullying and intimidation.  

Even though the hospital may believe that they are acting in the best interests of the patient, trying to institutionalize someone without good reason is a very serious matter.

Perhaps we were just unlucky and ours was a one - off case. Hopefully, others have had much more positive dealings with Caulfield Hospital.

Fabulous staff .caring understanding
.unfortunately its in urgent need if an internal face lift.. It doesn't look like its been updated since it was built. .its so depressingly old shabby. Thankgod we have those nurses there

I have a family member unfortunately there, absolutely appalling! Whoever oversees the hospital here should be ashamed of themselves and I hope karma is served in time!!!. They need to be audited asap. The staff are miserable and incompetent, the place is absolutely filthy and there is no care for the patients. From what I have seen I'd hate to think what I havent seen. 
Stay away from this place!!!

Last night I visited my Ma and wanted to get her pad changed and a PCA handed me a pad and said she was too busy. I said I needed gloves, she got them and I proceeded to toilet my Ma. PCA came back and helped  finally. My Ma's flowers were moved out of Ma's sight range so she has nothing to look at. You get better care in a prison.
Rang AC3 today Lucy said the phone transfers to all patient rooms weren't working. Receptionist and AC2 not aware and told me AC3 could transfer call to cordless phone. Rang AC3 and same fake story of phone transfers out. The only way a patient can keep a positive attitude is if they have contact with their loved ones.
A family member suffers from Migraines. A highly qualified Neurologist at Caulfield hospital, has improved the situation greatly. Thankyou,

name: Central Gippsland Health Service Bike Relay

reviews.text:
I desperately needed this place in an emergency. Long story short I could not speak more highly of them. 
Being from Melbourne and having great private heath cover I’m lucky to be used to Melbourne’s best hospitals. I didn’t expect much from a small, rural public hospital. However I was pleasantly surprised about everything from the food to the facilities. I wish I could thank each staff member by name. For people who work in what must surely be a tiring and stressful job the whole staff could not have been warmer, friendlier, funnier or more helpful. Special shout out to Terrie. 
I rarely bother reviewing anything but this place took great care of me when I really needed it and a made a horrible situation very comfortable and pleasant. I’m very appreciative and wish this was what a standard hospital experience was like. Many thanks

I recently felt extremely unwell on a Saturday afternoon and presented myself to the emergency department. I was immediately examined and admitted to the surgical ward where for the next 4 days I was treated with respect and compassion. The doctors were extremely helpful and my problem was identified and treated. I would like to thank you all you are amazing.

Emergency department wait time is 4-6 hours.   Which is absolutely ridiculous! They need to hire more fully qualified doctors and not be so slow at treating patients as patients are often left in cubicles for hours with still no treatment or they get sent away and get told to go see there gp.

Emergency department needs to improve. I was turned away several times and sent home with a very sick 11 month old before she became a medical emergency “things can turn quickly” simply wasn’t good enough, she should have been treated earlier before it came to that. However doctors, nurses and staff in hospital are lovely, supportive and very helpful

Surgical Ward - incredible and unexpected experience.  Could not believe a Ward at CGH could be so efficient and have a workforce that was the optimum of comradship and teammanship.  From cleaners to Nursing staff to the  surgical registrars and Doctors, everyone went about their duties professionally and cooperatively to provide a high standard of care for the patients.  I was in a 4 bed ward and kept my curtain shut for privacy and I enjoyed the rapport between staff and patients I witnessed and overheard during my 3 day stay.  The care I received was to a very high standard and I feel the speed of my recovery was due to the whole package of care provided.  Congratulations to Gary and your team.

I was very pleased with our experience at Chesterville Day Hospital.  The staff were very caring, kind and helpful and our daughter was so well looked after.  They made her feel completely at ease before and after the operation which was much appreciated.  Everything was explained to us clearly by all the staff there and they were very kind to me as a parent. Special thanks must go to Nurse Anne for her wonderful care and time today.  I highly recommend this hospital and wouldn't hesitate to go there again. Thank you!

I went there for a procedure and all the people were awesome! The receptionist, nurse, and doctor were so nice and wonderful!  Easy parking and very clean.  I would go there again if I needed a day procedure.
Nice ladies there, they took good care for my daughter
Friendly staff. They ensured that my child had a pleasant experience.

Went in for a procedure this morning, no wait time, friendly reception. All the staff for the procedure were extremely friendly, especially the nurse. Everything was explained very well and clearly. Straight in for the procedure, anaesthetist did his job and i woke up an hour later in the waiting room. Coffee and sandwich waiting, home by 10am. Brilliant.
Very pleasant nurses, taking good care of the ill & injured. Thanks for a great job

I went there on a Saturday and visited one of their doctors to help me with my dry eyes...He told me that I needed to visit an optometrist and he could not help me with that problem and just gave me a referal to an optometrist. So before i left, the reception told me to pay 100 dollars for 2 minutes that I visited the doctor and he actually did nothing except giving me the referal...Note:to visit an optometrist you do not need a referal and the gp that visited me knew it. He just gave it to me to pretend that he did something with my problem while the answer to my problem was:you need to see an optometrist.
Anyway they charged me 100 dollars and i will never go there again.
This Hospital has pretty bad review,Hope They look into it.. they need to have bigger sign board for the entrance. Not sure how they treat the patients.
I died

Couldn't have asked for a better surgery experience. Dr Judith Fleming and her team were fantastic surgeons, and the nurses that cared for me were amazing. Big thanks to George, Pauline, Georgia and Carla for their care and support whilst I was there. Can't recommend highly enough.
Awesome midwives,  lovely people. (But you might get some tough love)
Great team of nurses and doctors in day stay and theatre. Very well looked after.

Amazing care by all staff on Sunday.
Dr Greg and his staff were both considerate and comprehensive in there approach and attention given.
Cant speak highly enough of there efforts both on tje day and with following up also.
Thanks team.  You made a tough day bearable.
Went to St. John of God's pathology and Todd there is a gentleman.. and there community service staff are very friendly and helpful.. the community dental service is also good..
Good facilities with pleasant people.  So far, best private hospital I've been to.

Only went in to have 3 moles cut off my back. But was a freaking out about getting put to sleep for 10 mins. The Nurses, staff, surgeon and anaesthetist were so kind, that they made me feel so comfortable and at ease. Can not complain about anything!
Excellent manner and care
Good  stuff
good services , friendly staff , BUT pay for parking !!!! outrages ! its a PUBLIC service !!
Very impressed with the service my father received from Sally, Tim and the team. Totally professional in every way. Great asset to the community. Thank you.

Really poor pathetic services. Nothing gets explained properly to patients.  Pregnant ladies get appointment after 6-7 weeks with not enough information provided about the test they have to go . Long Delays and waits for everyone.
This how they provide better health to their community.
Shame on their services.

Been here a few times and had to wait more than 1.5hrs to be seen on all occassions. What's the point of making an appointment!? And paid car parking is a slap in the face for having to wait so long to be seen.
Recently visited some Arjoo Indian female doctor, didn't explain anything to my wife before doing pregnancy test. One of bad service. And Paid parking for patient's?  are you serious?

Psych section:- appointments are cancelled, doctors don't show up, they do not fill out forms properly for other services- and they do not contact the patient when a doctor cannot be there for an appointment! Appalling

Bloody 2 hours for blood test. Twice ive come here and i have big regrets. Great receptionists but pathology chick who was apparently new staff took her time talking drink and doing whatever other than moving it

I have been to the Cranbourne Centre for a baby hearing test, dental services and many blood tests.  I have always found this centre to give great service.  Especially at the pathology - little wait and great nurses.  Thank you.

Baby did hearing test here, lady in reception has no heart for others! She s got two chances telling me the green book form is not a referral letter. She chose to be silent making me spend more money which I could have avoided! Wish she get same treatment from others!
Really disappointed twice after waiting 2+ hours for my appointment. Not enough doctors. Very unprofessional
It is an actual prison, definately won't return.
Released a vulnerable person at 7pm at night in winter with no travel arrangements. This is a DISGRACE.
I want my mum to be back on the 14th of January so I can see her on my birthday. Dont be rude please.
I appreciate the help. Thank you google.

name: Western Institute of Technology Dandenong Campus

reviews.text: Very impressed with the staff when I attended with my son. We were greeted as we walked in, seen to very quickly and my son was very well cared for.
We haven’t had to visit an emergency department before but we were so impressed with the efficiency & professionalism of the nurses and doctor here. Thank you for you help and compassion.

Visiting from out of town I had a fall and attended Emergency on the 18/8/18 and I would love to say the professional,caring and thorough attention from Dr.Josh was fantastic.Thankyou so much for your comfort,care and reassurance.
Nicky

My experience in the Emergency Dept was exceptional. I could not fault Sam (nurse) & staff on their professionalism and kindness. Their expertise &  consideration was commended by not only the ambulance crew but also the receiving hospital. The 5 star rating is well deserved to Sam and all the nurses involved.

Really great friendly service. Receptionist was really nice and helped me out filling what I need to.
The Dentist was great, told me what was going on every step of the way.
Will definitely be back again!!
Had braces done here and the people were friendly and would fit me in if I was running late.

got booked in for 9:00am. Called said was gonna be a little late because of traffic. Arrived at 9:01am. Was in line for 15minutes. Saw receptionist who didn’t care and looked like she just woke up. Told her that I waited in line. She says well sorry we don’t have enough dentists here today so we can book you in for another day.  Kinda glad I didn’t go here from all the bad reviews. I just booked in to each in ferntreegully. They seemed caring about my problem and is getting me in the same day. Don’t go this place there rude and don’t care what sort of pain your in.

Recently had a complete set of wisdom teeth extracted here under local anesthetic, and the experience was as pleasant as possible, given the situation. I was attended to by the wonderful April, who embodies the qualities of gentleness and patience, and wields great strength inside her tiny powerful fists. The dentists and nurses were very eager to do whatever it took to put me at ease, even complying with almost all of my (somewhat strange I'll admit) requests. All up one of my more positive dental experiences. 
Thank you for making my visit a good one DHSV! Not nearly the nightmare I was preparing for.
This dentist is cheap, especially if you on a concession card and they do a top notch job fixing your teeth. I recommend this dentist if you on a healthcare card or a pensioner

DJERRIWARRH HAS A GREAT REPUTATION AND OFFERS HIGH QUALITY SERVICES IN RURAL LOCATIONS
Good health service with a great reputation for quality and patient care.
It's a public health service and tries hard to support the needs of the communities it serves :)
Could not fault the service and care provided here by maternity unit. Had amazing experience with facility, staff and doctors.
Could not fault dr Mecarty and staff they were wonderfull

We had a difficult birth for our first baby, just one of those unexpected things, but the entire team at Bacchus Marsh hospital were absolutely amazing! My baby and I were cared for, informed and made to feel safe with every option discussed in detail, each step of the way. We had our own room and my husband could stay, making the nights 100% easier. They helped with breastfeeding all throughout the day & night and nothing was ever too hard. We were never made to feel like we were asking silly questions or were inadequate if our bubba wouldn’t settle, as with some other hospitals, they would just kindly offer advice and direction. If I could give them 100 out of 5 I would, they are all just kind, caring professionals. Definitely recommend!!

Cancer surgeon male gives the term quacks the true meaning  apparently i didnt have any form of cancer by he  just looking at me he just wanted to big note himself   $150  later well i did end up having skin cancer .. quack dont even deserve one star

Discharge on Christmas day. Thank you to all the wonderful staff at Donvale rehab hospital. Great team work. I had a total knee replacement and a rough journey but the staff made sure I was as comfortable as possible. They reassured me when I needed it and encouraged me.
Physiotherapists are excellent. Nurses very responsive and very caring. 
So many services to make rehab a comprehensive service. 
Everyone was happy and worked with a smile.
Would recommend Donvale to anyone needing rehab.
My only criticism is that vegetarian food is very limited 
Thank you Donvale Rehabilitation hospital

Having just spent 10 days in Donvale after a total knee replacement, I cannot recommend my experience there highly enough. In each of the departments with which I had contact, the staff were pleasant, capable, positive in outlook and caring. They include, Admin, Catering (the food was excellent), Cleaning, Porters, Visiting Medical Officers, and especially the Occupational Therapy, Physiotherapy and by no means least the Nursing Staff in Aumann Ward.

If you are looking for a Benchmark rehabilitation facility Donvale is it. I Am having my other knee replaced in the near future and will unhesitatingly go to Donvale. Well Done Donvale People.

Some great staff but old rooms were terrible as was the food (by far the worst hospital food ever; menu was from the 1970s; choices were limited-couldn't even provide toast at breakfast; most food was overcooked and stodgy). Bed linen was dirty. No weekend rehab. Raised concerns with management but there was no follow up...
Exceptional Care, all the staff are caring and supportive. Highly recommend Donvale.

I would like to acknowledge and thank the fantastic staff who cared for me following my total knee replacement in February this year.  Every single nurse was so kind and so professional in their care of me.  A special thanks also to my OT Chantelle, my Dietitians, my physios Libby and Zoe,  my doctors Ron and Sean, all the Allied Health Assistants, and kitchen/domestic staff.  You made a difficult time bearable and I am 'over the moon' with how well my knee is working.  Thankyou from the bottom of my heart. (Room 41)

Most nurses are exceptional and Drs truly professional understanding and a great with pain management...
The establishment is old but ppl make up  for it. ..
Very good centre, with wide range of therapies offered by very experienced people.
If you're in pain and want to die then go to this disgusting place. The nurses shouldn't be nurses, they treat the people like crap and dont care for them like they should. Disgusting place.

The treatment or lack of treatment given to my husband was a disgrace by the attending dr,now they are 
Treating us now to pay.no wonder alot of people wont bother going to the ararat hospital,better off going straight to ballarat ,they will send you there anyway.
When my little brother was sick we brought him here.  Unfortunately they gave him fluids while I was having a good time while he was quiet :(
Great hospital friendly staff.

After a recent experience at the Emergency Department of the Echuca Hospital, I cannot speak more highly of the efficiency and professionalism of the staff. Both nurses and the female doctor who attended to my husband on November 7th were great. The hospital was also very clean and the volunteer lady was wonderful to us. Well done Echuca for such a good hospital.

The hospital newly updated part is beautiful and they took great care of my grandmother. They need more money and donations and volunteer's because they still need to send people to bendigo or Melbourne for some things. There primary care staff and doctors are great and they bulk bill. Super nice ladies,  behind reception.

4 hrs to find out if my daughter has a broken arm. No pain relief offered.  Despite the place being crazy busy, not enough staff or doctors for the amount of people waiting. 

I struggle to see the logic in spending millions of dollars building an amazing new facility, and not enough people to run it 

Disgraceful

Emergency department waiting times are over 2 hours. Emergency department is obviously where someone would go with a sense of urgency to a health related problem or concern. Waiting times are ridiculous and pathetic

Had a seizure at my work in may of 2017. I was diagnosed with Epilepsy after that at 41yo. Every single nurse, doctor, paramedic involved directly and indirectly with my care went above and beyond the call. I don't remember anything for the next two days but ive been told by family that everyone was thorough, professional, sympathetic, diligent, kind, and absoloutly amazing with myself, my family and every aspect of my care and recovery. I've also had a few day surgery's here and the nurses are second to none. The care you recieve at ERH is the BEST in Victoria if not Australia. A HUGE thank you from myself and my children and my family. Hopefully I will get to repay your professionalism and kind nature one day. 💐🌹💖
The Cliveden is a boutique hospital. The meals are outstanding too. My compliments to the chef.
A nice hospital in East Melbourne. The staff and surgeons are wonderful. I have been operated on by Dr Nick Christelis here and he is great.

No parking for drop off making it easy to get a costly parking ticket 
A silly place to locate a Hospital in an old building.
Great care of course.
I have been admitted to this hospital twice. A beautiful old building. Staff and doctors were great and very caring. Hard to find parking. a great café located opposite the hospital.
Had an amazing experience at Cliveden. Staff were professional, friendly and all around wonderful. Food was good too! :)

i had to come here when i broke both my kneecaps. the service was amazing and i was looked after by the best nurse ever. and when i say a nurse is good you know she's good i've been to 17 hospitals and had over 100 nurses. anyway they said they had to put me down but it was still pretty good

We attend the Medical Suites several times a year. Wondering if it might be possible to have a few more seats outside the main entrance for people waiting for taxi pickups. Both my son and daughter have physical disabilities so need to wait inside where they can sit down . It can become a bit crowded with pickups and drop offs so it's beneficial for everyone if we can get into the taxi and away as soon as possible.

I came in Thursday at 12.15  they placed my name tags on at 8 pm because I asked five times when i was directed to my bed I asked the nurse for a wet face washer, she replied you’re Mobile so you can do it yourself.
I have had a drip put on with antibiotics without any one asking my name. I am not sure if they short staff, but absolutely anything you need you have to ask for at least 4 times,
Today is the operation day, the nurse just came in to confirm my details before I go in she had completely wrong address, wish me luck to come out alive from this place. The good thing about it is the surgeon ( I have no idea why he works here)

Admission at 1.30 for day surgery. didn't have surgery till 5.00 didn't leave till 7.00. would of Been nice to be quicker. all the staff very friendly and polite, made you feel relaxed. They were pretty efficient though as soon as I got through the waiting room. Just the 3 hour wait was very frustrating.

I have had many operations and procedures in 3 of the Epworth Hospital. The Epworth eastern nursing staff are excellent as are the surgeons and physicians. In Gastroenterology, they are leaders in this field by conducting precision operations with excellent post operative care. 
You feel cared fo body and soul at the Epworth Hospitals.                           Only one crticism is the Admin seem to push the nurses to the limit with fingerprinting all day and night which keeps paients awake. It is like they do not trust the nursing staff. Admin seem to focus on being corporate box tickers with fake smiles as in my place of employment. I hope it does not effect the friendly and caring culture of a great health facility.

Thank you to the wonderful dinner lady Rosalyn who returned my mum's credit card after I left it on her lunch tray and it was taken back to the kitchen. Your honest and integrity is very much appreciated. Epworth are lucky to have such a wonderful woman as their staff.
Lovely generous food. Nursing care leaves lot to be desired.

Absolutely poor & pathetic! I am not sure how they  call themselves a hospital, let alone a private one?

Don't bother going there,unless you want to loose your pride& dignity and end up with a broken spirit.

I've had the worst experience ever in this place,where I spent time from 6th of February till the 19th.

I recently been transferred to this hospital from another great one,where I've had a hysterectomy & removal of the mesh in that area.
 Unfortunately  I had a secondary complication, a blockage in the bowel which required me being transferred here based on the bowel surgeon 's request, because that's where he  operates.

Firstly, let me thank the team of two surgeons,, the physician,the digestive health doctor&the two dietitians, who dropped in every day to check on me, they virtually saved my life, after being fed through machines, tubes, antibiotics, drips ETC...This is where it stops. Unfortunately,I've hit a brick wall dealing with nurses on daily basis!

They're  so inconsistent& don't handover files properly.

There were two which were caring& knowledgeable& don't mind giving patients the care they need and deserve.thank you Tim& Kim, in my opinion you  were the cream of the crop.

The second category is, about six others which didn't mind doing their job pleasantly.

The third category were the hand ballers, they always say: I'll come back, but they never do, they leave it to the next shift to handle!

The fourth& weakest link were the basic one's  , who adopt the attitude of: I don't know or, we don't have that ! This gives them the minimal work.HELLO...What happened to asking someone else if you don't know?

For those of you who understand that when you've just had two traumas together& being attached to to machines,YOU NEED HELP!

All these medications, sends you to the toilet more often! On my first night , I asked the nurse if I could have some wipes to clean myself after having many accidents? The answer was: we don't have them. I had no option but to grab some Dettol wipes from my bag and used them , on an area which had too many external stitches till I had blisters& started bleeding from my pelvic floor area.

Also some would know after a hysterectomy, you're not supposed to push heavy equipment many times over, from your bedroom to your bathroom. I called the nurse twice in a hurry for some help, she made a point to ask: why do you go to the toilet often?Nothing to stop you from pulling the cord from the wall and go by yourself.( Note, the cord was about a meter above my head). They obviously, don't bother to read your files and see what sort of help you do need?
The next time I needed to go to the toilet, I had no option but to sit & cry for one hour with a soiled and wet pants, because I was too scared to press the buzzer.

Tim, the night shift nurse was passing in the corridor& heard me crying, he came in & asked what's wrong?I told him, he went and got some wipes & gel to treat the area. It was readily available behind the nurses station apparently.

The next morning I had Kim,  It was God's sent to me. she helped me shower& treated me herself, I told her that I was running out of undies& don't know what to do? she went and got me some disposables .

another time they, left me for two hours screaming with pain ,didn't bother   ringing the doctors to check!

 she could've given me panadol  through the line,  or morphine injection had she checked the file properly?
 I had to ring the surgeon myself.
later one came,  they told him that I was complaining because I was hungry. Good liers too!
Also the food monitor was the worst I've ever come across too, despite requests from the dietitians for her to come up, she kept sending  what she wants.
All the staff from x ray, food services, cleaners& wheel chair transport, very helpful.
I invite the complaints manager to get in touch with me& discuss this further, also I will be reporting this to my health insurance, that's Unacceptable!
I had to ask for the pick line to be removed on discharge! 

look forward to hear from you
thanks

Suzy Dahouk

Cannot thank staff here enough. Doctors, nurses, students from Deakin uni at the time of my stay for a laparoscopic gynae surgery. You’re all so lovely and best hospital experience I’ve ever had (there’s been many!) will never go anywhere else. Thank you so much. Also fantastic with dietary needs thank you.
Went in for a day procedure, the staff were amazing. best 6 hours in  a hospital ever.

Fantastic experience with extremely loving and caring staff and a amazing doctors and paediatricians. I had a c-sec delivery here as I couldn't have a normal birth owing to childhood conditions. The staff was extremely supportive and I truly had the best doctor possible. Would like to come back here again for my second child!

I spent 5 days at epworth for a c section for my twins. The staff were an amazing help for a new mother, we felt so looked after and my boys couldn’t have been in better hands. The nurses made a scary experience so much easier to deal with (especially amongst many beautiful people Jen, Kelly & Raquel) . The food was tasty, the rooms were lovely and we were so glad and felt so lucky to be in this hospital. Thank you
I stayed at this hospital for a few days. No where to park. Nothing to eat. I had to go to McDonald's. I recommend not using this hospital at all.

My husband was there at Epworth for 3 days and cost me $200 in parking and it's a horrible experience. No way to park on the main road or side streets. We should have gone to St. Vincent's across the road. I do not recommend this hospital at all.
Without a doubt the worst hospital in Australia.

I may not have been a patient (definitely will be as ill need knee ops) but i did my acute nursing placement  here. I was an RN years back and this hospital would have to be the best ive ever spent time in. Staff were knowledgeable,  professional, helpful and incredibly friendly. I've never seen such exceptional team work. Excellent hospital!!!

I have recently completed my second stay in Epworth Geelong rehab . What a fantastic place to recouperate if it wasn’t for the pain you would think you were on a holiday in a lovely hotel . The staff.    Nurses ,doctor, physios ,cleaners ,ward manager  in fact every one you come in contact always has a beautiful smile and go out of there way to make your stay as good as can be .All I can say is a very big THANK. YOU to each and every one   Best food ever makes the stay even better
Fantastic staff, very caring, kind and efficient, went the extra mile to help you feel looked after. Areas I saw were all spotless, felt very safe, that I was in good hands.
Wonderful caring staff they were marvellous the doctor could not have been nicer as she did nit know me at all. My stay was unexpected but i would not hesitate to recommend this hospital .
Beautiful hospital going above and beyond for their patients especially the Geelong Maternity Group (working within the Epworth) and those working on the maternity ward.

Had a breast reduction here. 
The nurses were so caring and amazing, they kept me on top of my pain management and they had a great sense of humour also! 
Highly recommend!

Good hospital with caring nurses and great doctors. So why only 4 stars? I was booked in for a surgery with overnight stay but ended up spending the night in a corner of the recovery room. I did have some privacy but was not the most peaceful place to spend the night after surgery

Again the nurses on duty cared for me well and did the best with this setup. I hope in future they manage this better

I cannot speak highly enough of the staff and the quality of care I received at this hospital.. 

The aftercare nurses exceeded my expectations and we’re only too happy to help.. 

I had great room with a great view, very comfy bed and the room was so peaceful - staff really wanted to make sure you were genuinely okay. 

I wanted to say a big Thankyou to the recovery nurses - you really made my experience so pleasant although I was in a lot of pain we still had time to joke and I really felt at home.

Food was absolutely amazing.. I really didn’t want to leave! 

Thankyou for your excellent care you gave me.. You do a fantastic job and you should be proud of yourselves x 

Your star patient - Cassandra!

I had abdominoplasty in this hospital because I have hernias,etc.It was a tough decision and I would really say that it was an ordeal for me after the operation because it was a major operation ,with the big scar,swelling,and tightness. But all the staff were so lovely and patient with me including Dr Edmund Ek,the plastic surgeon. 
I would like to thank all the nurses especially those in ward 6, namely Joan,BJ,Maria ,Esther, Amelia, Su and Julie who have  been so kind and caring to me . Please send this review to the staff.Thank you.Sock ,Room1
They have some issues with continuity of care but generally are very good.

“Patient Rounding” = disturbances every hour during the day and every two hours at night. 
Explain to me. 
How is that conducive to patient recovery?
What happened to rest and recover. 
You are the Mormons of the hospital wards ‼️
And you don’t even bother to knock. You just burst your way in.
Received excellent care as a patient, highly recommend it.

One of the worst hospital in Melbourne..
The stuffs are so ignorant and rude. Don't tell me I'm wrong. I was there for few weeks and that's what I saw and how I was treated. 
Never going back to Epworth.

Not impressed, referral sent 10th April and they keep dilly dallying telling me nonsense excuses go and stick your referral Epworth I will be going elsewhere,  my mental health is suffering and there is no excuse for these delays, I will be going elsewhere.
Tempted to give 5stars. Experienced, kind, supportive and conscientious nursing staff. I would return there with no hesitation.

I read a negative comment about an intaker worker, however, last year both my daughter and I Spoke to two intake workers, both of whom were lovely and helpful. In fact about the same time the negative comment was made. Sometimes it’s the patient that maybe unwell and unpleasant that creates his own bad experience. Agree with a point raised there is no need to line up for meds like cattle as done at other facilities. The food is fine, it’s not a restaurant it’s a hospital. Being disturbed by cleaners and other staff is annoying, but that occurs in every hospital. I Agree during the day not much guidance nor plans for activities. The staff were generally great and supportive when I had stayed sometime ago. I now attend another area and have no issues. I know a number of people who have been here for various reasons and all found it excellent.

Had a very negative experience, huge concerns re safety and negligence. I sent feedback 3 weeks ago and haven't had any reply. My next step is to contact the Victorian Health Care Complaints Commissioner.

The rehabilitation intake worker, Rebecca is the rudest, most inflammatory, unprofessional and uncooperative person, who should not be doing that job. It is recommended that her tenure be assessed and someone with more obvious compassion should be assigned to the role instead. This IS  hospital of healing after all. Apart from that, it is just another mega money making business, whose core values of greed should immediately direct you to another facility.

Not an enjoyable place whatsoever. Staff are rude and uninviting, I hope I never have to return. 

The nursing ratio here is 8 patients to one nurse, which is an extreme overload. Nurses are unapproachable, they are in desperate need of a culture change at this facility.

I overheard staff speaking badly about other patients, and they leave patient files laying around, breach of confidentiality for sure!

Being a patient at many different hospitals the staff in the Bethesda ward at Epworth Richmond are the worst ive come across.  Simple requests seem to be such an unconvenience to them and you have to keep requesting the same thing usually an hour after the first time to actually be looked after. Medical records are kept in the hall where anyone can view them and they aren't secure and confidential.  The ward is dirty and old and the cleaners say they have cleaned but yet there was dirty linen left for two days on the floor. In a one week stay the sheets were changed once even though they were dirty before that. The room was never vacuumed during my stay. The food was always missing something from the order. The staff were complaining about patients in the hallway oblivious to the fact that they could be heard by those patients. Overall a very disappointing stay but after speaking to others this is how most people find their stay.

Attended outpatient unit yesterday 4 Feb '19.  there is street parking just outside and you can pay with pay-waive or apple pay, the machine takes your registration number so you don't need a ticket. There is a neat coffee shop round the corner if you arrive too early.  I saw my cardiologist and he is excellent, it's great when doctors listen and are on the same page as you.

Just been discharged yesterday 20 December 2018 after having a cardiac  angioplasty. The nurses really look after me, the room was great, the food is excellent and Sarah from County Cork was exceptional. Thank you for the care and compassion your staff showed. 5/5. Merry Christmas to all. 

 More than 4 years ago. I don't wanna say I loved it... it's a hospital but nice and pleasant establishment.

In general, I'm happy with the hospital and trust them usually, but recently had not nice experience of my husband urologist, who was professional and knowledgeable, but too protocol based, not going into details and individual picture. Most of old school doctors I've seen are excellent though

Hi ,I spent 3 nights 4 days in lee ward 4t floor, in the  neurology section, I was admitted with a possible stroke,but was diagnosed with migraine Aura,
during my stay the nurses were compassionate friendly and professional  ,my Neurologist was exceptional a true gentleman,and always made me feel at ease,and wanted to find what was causing my problems,I wish to thank you all,for such a great job at my time off need,
the Neurologist found my cause,and prescribed medication 

Rod Cameron |

Best hospital 🏥 in the world. I was extremely well looked after. The nurses where AMAZING the food was better than restaurant quality. Love it. Keep up the good work. I lost my BMW car keys thou. Hopefully they find them
What a fantastic hospital. Nursing staff, doctors, everyone that works at this hospital is amazing. Thank you Epworth Richmond for the care you give me when I attend this wonderful hospital.

2 weeks ago, I would have recommended this hospital as one that is supportive and caring and a great place to get well. However there have been recent changes that have not been in the best interests of patients and are very bureaucratic. It has been disappointing to watch a place designed for healing deteriorate due to politics and bureaucracy and not only would I cut my stay short because of this, I would no longer recommend this hospital to others.

good place for some respite and do basic cbt,info short sessions (overview breif) but not much otherwise only a counsiler on weekends and during week not much to do unless you are do the groups but that is not always the best for all they need to learn that not everyone fits into a mould be are different

Honest review here. I spent sometime in this clinic and it has its pros and cons. I will start with the positives: it's a nice small clinic, most of the staff are really friendly. 2 nurses in particular are probably the most kindest caring psych nurses I have ever met. They have a 7 day program which is good so there is something everyday. The psychiatrists are good - well mine anyway, but I found it weird they have no female psychiatrists? Well none I was aware of anyway as I asked on admission. The groups are quite good but I feel they need a bit more variety as everyone is different. Food is good, make it there themselves. Out of the private psych hospitals in Melbourne this is probably the nicest, and It would be the one I recommend of all private hospitals. It's quite family like, a beautiful therapy dog and you can bring pets to visit!! 
The negatives ( I don't want this to discourage people... I am kind of hoping the management may read this and look at it as things they need to review) at times they can be really short staffed which makes it hard for patients and the staff. Sometimes I felt the nurses could be more engaging with the patients..
