I understand it's voluntary treatment and it is up to the patient to seek help and say what they need, but sometimes a very depressed or anxious patient may find this difficult - I just feel the staff could be a little more encouraging and just take a bit of time and patience and perserverance to chat, I sometimes thought this was due to them being short staffed and they always had something else to be doing (ie meds, obs, admissions, notes) but sometimes you would walk past the nurse station and they would just be chatting to each other. They have a lot of agency nurses too which can make it difficult you feel every day you are reintroducing yourself and your problems. I felt the focus was a bit on making money not being 100% committed to helping patients - hence the short staffing. I noticed once there was a sign in the office for the night staff and it said "most importantly spend quality time with patients" - I don't think I ever once had a night nurse spend time with me - only ever checked me every so often in the night. I remember there was a young girl there who was really shy and anxious and she never seemed to improve much while I was there and I always thought was this because she was too shy to ask for help so the staff just kind of left her. This I think is what I mean by staff could be more engaging and encouraging - if there were enough of them. 
After being in a few psych wards I really feel that this place could be fantastic if they had more staff and it was a bit more organised- a full time psychologist with experience in a range of psychiatric illnesses and the staff and management were more patient orientated - I don't mean that in a nasty way, I just always had a feeling while I was there that the staff were mostly just there to get paid and the management was more concerned about money. 
I know it is a new place, but the unit was never full, probably only ever half full. In my opinion if they spent more money now getting it up and going really well with well equiped staff and a great therapy program then it would be hands down the most fantastic place, get great reviews and more people would know about it and seek admission there and they would be full all the time = making good profit probably. 
Oh and you really need to fix the hot water and washing machine!!!!
Nevertheless, I will recommend this place to anyone I speak to that is seeking help. I whole heartedly thank the team there for help with my recovery.
Take care
At one stage this was a private hospital. My mother was admitted here for her eyes and they treated her very well. Nowadays it's a clinic assisting patients with mental problems
Ok

We have come here twice now and I have to say we are pleased in general. The facilities are great, with state of the art equipments. The doctor we had was probably exceptional. The attention to detail and focus could not be faulted. 
There are also areas the hospital could improve on. We noticed all the Male doctors tend to walk in on the mum without knocking the door, even tho she might be breast feeding.

Had gynaecological surgery here, stayed overnight and was very impressed. Staff were great, very attentive and took excellent care of me. Had a nice room to myself and it was surprisingly quiet and peaceful, I expected a lot more beeping and bright lights in a hospital. Maybe it’s because it is also a maternity hospital, but loved the matter of fact attitude of the nurses with things like helping me get dressed or go to the toilet. Whereas at another private hospital I was left to get dressed by myself after having just had a laparoscopy and come out of anaesthetic. Don’t know if they were trying to give me privacy, but what I really wanted was help! Great job Frances Perry House.
Have had the most wonderful experiences with the staff here. It was here that I had two of the most positive hospital experiences you could have. Highly recommend.

Recently I just had a baby girl by caesar, difficute to get out of bed, asked the night nursery look after my baby so I get recovery, can't believe the nurse wake me up to feed the baby by formula, don't you know I won't able to do it? And now I have to pay addition cost to ask my husband stay so I won't get worth, The night casual staff useless, Won't go to this hopital again
great staying here.   fantastic meal daily.   Dr Weiqing.     nurse.  Sam Emma  Gabriel and some others. they teach us a lot.

The nurses were absolutely fantastic whilst caring for my wife over her 3 week stay.
It made life considerably less stressful for our family for which I am very appreciative!

Have just come in and have had a great experience. Still waiting for my X-ray but the doctor and nurses have been great today.

I have a rare invisible illness called EDS and doctors and nurses don’t usually know what it is, don’t usually believe me and think I’m seeking pain meds. The doctors and nurses today believed me, trusted me and are treating me like a human being, which has never happened to me before. Thank you Frankston Hospital!

I was in agony with a toothache some days ago and was advised to go here, to their emergency dental department. I came across Richard, the Dentist and Tracey the Dental Nurse. Both were truly professional. They talked me through my options, which eventuated in an extraction.

They told me what they were doing, what to expect and drip fed me information on the procedure as they performed the surgery. It was, if it is indeed possible, the most pleasant dental experience I have ever had. They were really fantastic. I didn't feel a thing and it didn't cost me a penny. If this is what the public health service is offering, then they should be congratulated.

Thanks to both Richard and Tracey from the bottom of my heart. I could have got down and kissed your feet. 

You were marvelous and I remain very, very grateful.

This review goes for the front desk only. Absolutely hopeless, rude, unprofessional and the bottom of the barrel overall.
Starting with Sue, and the other two (which I will update with their names asap). 

Ladies if you're unable to work in such an environment, do all the patients a favour and stick to housekeeping.

Nurses, doctors and the other staff are helpful and professional.

reviews.author_name: that one person who deep fries a mango
reviews.text:
I had a huge knee reco from ann accident performed by Sam. Everything was a 10/10! I can't recommend this hospital more highly. I look forward to my hip replacement very soon.
Susan Jarvis.

Racist female Australian working at Dorevitch pathology. She will blatantly lie to you and not tell the truth. Other staff members are probably much nicer and more honest than her. Dishonest people do not deserve to be working in the medical field.

Rooms and facilities outstanding. Physiotherapy daily was productive and improved recovery. Staff were attentive happy and caring. Having no Dr. on site causes huge time delays in medication needs which was only but significant drawback.
Had a colonoscopy at this hospital. Staff were friendly, efficient and overall experience was excellent. Dr Hodge inspires confidence. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend.

I have had all of my cancer treatments at Frankston Private Hospital since early 2013. Throughout all of my chemotherapy and radiation treatments, I have had nothing but the best care & attention at all times. The nursing staff are dedicated to you & do a fantastic job of making your stay there as comfortable as possible and they always have smiles on their faces 😊 The same can be said for the reception staff at Peninsula and Southeast Oncology and the specialists involved in my situation. I'm alive today as a result of their prognosis & subsequent treatments. 
It truly is a one stop shop as I have all of my MRI, CT and PET scans there also at MIA Radiology.
Perfect!  Staff excellent!  Care excellent!

name: Gippsland Southern Health Service Korumburra Hospital

reviews.text: Great hospital.
Operates as a private hospital with no 24 hr emergency doctor at the premises

Hi was in the process of having a missed miscarriage, leongatha hospital and their staff were absolutely fantastic in this time, as soon as I arrived with contractions they immediately orginised pain relief, they made my stay in hospital as comfortable as it could be in a time Like that, and where there for me every step of the way. They went above and beyond and also found a funeral director who was happy to cremate my bub free of charge. Even after leaving hospital they followed up with me the next day to ensure I was OK, and there was no complications.

Ambulance picked me up and saved my life (literally had to stabilise me three times).

As this is public let's say I had a choice which hospital. I chose Leongatha as opposed to Wonthaggi. The reason being because the Ambulance officers were based at Leongatha.

However arriving at Leongatha hospital was quite a different story.

Now once the paramedics left I was put into a private room (not a problem).

Then I was told minutes later that "I should not be here, because I wasn't from this area" and staff members were ridiculing the paramedics who had left for their next job right outside my room!!! Within earshot. Very disappointing.
Super friendly staff, maternity ward is amazing.
Great hospital, well mannered staff.

Not impressed took $500 before colonoscopy then $272 from my health insurance. There for 2.5 hrs and had to ring twice over 4 weeks for results from melb pathology. My doctor was concerned about time lapse. Don’t go there people
Great establishment, friendly staff for appointments.
Good day surgery but pricey.

Very friendly, caring nurses. Quiet environment. Very clean and tidy. Been there 3 times now, and happy to go there again if the need were to arise. You can do a lot of waiting, though, depending on when you're scheduled to have your procedure done.

From a previous negative experience at another private hospital, I booked in at Glenferrie for a shoulder procedure.  I'm so glad I did!  Went above my expectations.  A small beautiful hospital with amazing, caring and attentive staff.  Highly recommend.

I also loved this place from the moment l walked in.  The nurses & all other staff are absolutely amazing, they truly care, and go out of their way to be helpful. Even the meals were quite nice, and I'm a fussy eater. Thank you to all the staff for making my stay so comfortable,  warm and friendly. I appreciate you all.

A small lovely hospital with amazing caring staff. My overnight stay felt more like i was in a hotel than a hospital. The nurses were absolutely lovely, and made me feel so comfortable. Thank you so much

The nurses are fantabulous . From arrival, to recovery, to back in my room they couldn't do enough. Bricks and mortar are just that, although the place is very pretty and modern, it's the staff that make the difference.
Had an excellent stay if only short but staff very attentive highly recommended special mention to nurse Toula

Great Rehab with the majority of the staff lovely. Nice Kiosk/outdoor seating to get out to for the patients/residents from the houses 1 or 2. Think they should have security on site 24/7 & not on call thou. All the staff were very positive in helping me get back to my family. Nice hydrotherapy pool & a good outpatient program.

amazingly caring staff, a dedicated physio team all of whom were salubrious and most beneficial in my ongoing but speedy recovery A sincere heartfelt thanks to all who cared for me during my stay July/August/September 2018 you guys rock!

It's sad to see Older Australians who grew up Only eating White Bread, been told that there is Only brown bread for them ! If the problem is Fibre,
then Woolies sell a $2 , High Fibre White Bread. in fact, it has More Fibre than lots of other "healthy" brown breads.
I'm sure the 80 year old Lady, with whom i was sharing Breakfast with this morning , deserves to eat, what she has eaten All her Life.
Top rehab people have a lotta respect @good food

I have nothing but praise for the doctors and nurses of GV Health (Shepparton). Their dedication and expertise is second to none. I felt I was in good hands from admission to discharge and I would like to express my sincere thanks to you  all.
I was in at the Goulburn valley hospital Friday as I fell ill very quickly the staff in emergency was so helpful and wonderful even though they were under the pump and flat out thank you all so much
Some staff members are amazing at what they do and you can tell they really love what they do while a handful of other staff members really seem like they don’t want to be there and are quite rude.

I had the best of care from everyone who works there. I only stayed one night but I was well looked after. Thank you to all the staff involved who help you along the way. Your hard work is not in vain! Thank you and bless you all ❤️
A great team who looked after me here 2 days ago after I had dislocated my knee for the 2nd time
The hostel looked after my mother and they were great
Friendly

I experienced amazing care during my overnight stay for an operation. From caring nurses/staff to great food I cannot reccomend highly enough. A newly renovated premises had me thinking i was in a private hospital 😊
No beating around the bush, great help and services. The are very caring.
Trying to make an appointment at the specialist clinic, difficult, have been of the phone merry go round for 30 minutes then got cut off. Poor customer service

The doc didn't want to take a away a suspected skin cancer spot. Instead she asked a lot of questions about my family and private things. Perhaps she didn't feel confidence doing a small surgery? She also told an apprentice to burn another spot not suspected cancer but she sprayed to little to have the wanted affect. Are apprentices really allowed to treat patients?
Excellent care
Where are the opening hours hiding?  Also for Glen Waverley the website icon gives you attendant care.  What's that all about then?
It’s a very easy Centre to deal with great happy people

If it wasn't for the nurses - Liz, Vicky, Yvonne, Dianna, Kuwan and Sarah (sorry if I misspelled your names) -  and their obvious passion and care for their work, I'd go lower. 
Communication and care factor in all other aspects from initial recommendation to being dishcharged - I couldn't even tell if I was properly discharged tbh when I was given a hand written letter by a student physio in the corridor - and no surgeon or dr even followed up with me after my surgery to let me know what had happened despite the surgeon (who's name I don't recall getting since he was not the person I was told would be performing my surgery) who stopped by when I woke up to say he'd be by in the morning to discharge me and let me know. Ended up staying overnight, that was fine. 9am came, initial time given to me for discharge time once it was.confirmed I'd be in overnight, then 10am comes and the nurse tells me she's sorry but they've said they won't make it until sometime between 11am-130pm now. Ok. 
3pm comes along, no ones knows what's going on, lots of checking with no outcome, someone walks in and is surprised I've not been seen yet (no idea who this person is) but they also make the off handed comment that they're not sure where they are or what they're doing but they're trying to find her. Who are you trying to find? Who am I waiting for? Keep in mind, I'm not allowed to leave my bed -it's been over 24hrs at this stage-  even with my crutches until this person has come to see me except to be pushed by someone else to the toilet. 
But again, none of that would have been as much of an issue if someone would've just thought it might be worth keeping the other patients who have organised people to pick them up updated.

The Heidelberg Repatriation Hospital is a horror show. Third world conditions. Neglectful, ignorant staff who don't see their patients as human beings. No one should ever have to rescue their loved one from a hospital.

This is the second time I wait at the dermatology unit for 5 hours. I had a 3 pm appointment and at 3:15pm I impatiently went to ask how long the wait will be. I was shocked to find out that I had 14 people in front of me indicating a 5-6 hour wait. Very disappointing for Australian standards.
Great hospital, fantastic staff very thorough
Fantastic, attentive team. I've just completed surgery via the public health system and was treated like royalty. You are in good hands with the Austin. Thanks everyone.
Efficient, pleasant service. Less than a week wait for a procedural appointment.

Before I write this review - I want to open up by saying that this is not a review reflecting on my experience there; but rather my experience trying to book an appointment. For all I know, the staff at the clinic are amazing. But I write this in the belief that something must be done with their reception service. 

I have been a long suffering a medical condition to which my doctor had referred me to get an endoscopy procedure as a way to rule out possible serious health conditions. 

He had recommended this place to me, so I was desperate to try and book an appointment to find out what was wrong. Unfortunately, every time I called, I was put on hold by a woman who rudely spoke to me. I tried calling multiple times because I urgently wanted an appointment to deal with my chronic condition. The first time, she put me on hold for nearly an hour and then just hung up. The second and third time she put me on hold and then just hung up immediately as I was waiting.

And then the last time she put me on hold for 25 minutes and then hung up. 

When I had finally gotten hold of her, I had to rapidly say I needed an urgent appointment getting an endoscopy and it was only then she put me on hold again, made me wait a long time and then bothered to speak to me. And when she spoke to me, she spoke so rudely. I tried to explain that I had other medical appointments to attend to and I could not attend the dates that she offered but she spoke to me with such callousness, insensitivity and coldness, I ended up booking with another Endoscopy Centre. She spoke with such carelessness for my predicament and my struggles, I really hope others do not have to endure the pain and sadness I felt when just trying to book an appointment and dealing with a chronic medical condition..

I was tempted to reveal her name, but I really hope that the clinic would see this and contact me to discuss further this issue. I am extremely disappointed and I hope that they do not treat people with debilitating illness like this casually.

I've had two surgeries here and both were really great experiences. The nurses are all so lovely and very nice !! The reception Liz is also really friendly too great staff. Highly recommend this place
Attended the Sydenham centre yesterday, a very positive experience with such caring staff.  Highly recommend this facility.

I waited for 4 hours just to be attended by the doctor to do an endoscopy and colonoscopy. Doctors and nurses are fine but the wait times is unbelievable 5 minutes turned into 1 hour easily. Very disappointed with this place i normally do this in sydenham and not an issue at all.

It has been a wonderful experience right from reception to nurses. Everybody smiles at the centre, that's awesome.
Informative, high on communication and exrmely clean centre. 
Thanks Hobsons Bay Endoscopy
Excellent place, amazing team, wish that I could rate them with 10 stars.
Great nursing staff and specialists, the whole team couldn't be anymore helpful
Excellent staff a problem free experience
Excellent experience at the emergency. Fresh, clean facilities and attentive staff. From walking in the door to diagnosis in under an hour excellent service.
Went to emergency a few days ago.  Excellent service - seen to very promptly and politely by all staff I needed to see.  Highly recommended.
Incredible nurses, upbeat admin staff and amazing facilities. The handover procedure the nurses complete between shifts is incredibly personal and helps feel in good hands. Thank you

Thank you to all the wonderful staff who cared for my 15 month old daughter who was admitted to Homesglen for her grommet surgery recently. She received outstanding care from every single nurse during her stay making her and I feel as comfortable as possible. I couldn’t recommend Homesglen more highly.

Excellent hospital. Friendly and responsibly staff, warm environment. Everyone was easy to get along with, and best of all there was no hidden information from us in regards to our family member's issue and treatment. Everything was conversed really well, other than a miscommunication between a few staff which was resolved quickly. Service was great, a very short waiting time in emergency, informative services. Food was good, other than due to a language barrier not everything was always brought up. The hospital is nice and clean, very pleasant to stay in!

My prayers that they will be able to make a permanent solution on the condition of one of their patient. This was because of the wrong administration of medicine by one of their Very Brilliant Nurse! Someone very important to me was now suffering and potentially fatal because of this. I can't help but control my reaction for I still have faith in this hospital, and still waiting for results before moving on ! ! ! 

Still, I'm wishing all the best to Jessie McPherson Hospital! I'm lifting everything to God ! ! !

For a private hospital, the room and food provided were underwhelming in my experience. Haven’t said that, I highly recommend this hospital for their services. All doctors and nurses are so caring and lovely. I was looked after by Dr. Ramin & Dr. Ruadhan, nurses Georgia, Tristan, Ivka, Erin, Brigitte...in ward 31 North. Everyone have been so caring, kind and courteous. I felt so well looked after. Very thankful and appreciative of everything they’ve done for me.

Possibly worse patient experience I’ve had.  Nurses have no idea what happening from one minute to next. It’s more of an antiquated public hospital than a Private with shared rooms.  This may be a nice place to have a child but certainly not to recover from major surgery and pain management. Would have reconsidered my surgery options had I been aware of the poor ward care.

My first son was born in this hospital and to yet to be dad's out there then I recommend that you don't use this hospital and consider others - the fact that the Monash NICU unit is nearby then please don't use that as a factor for choosing this hospital, the nearby Cabrini also has a NICU and my second son was born in Cabrini and the care was impeccable. 

While I won't fault the care that "some" of the nurses gave, one nurse in particular was more interested in getting home than the care of my first son. 

I will admit I was wet behind the ears and was heavily reliant on the midwifes for guidance but isn't that what the midwifes are for - they are supposed to be the experts, leaving a new-born baby in a cold operating theatre recovery unit for 40 mins is just madness ( Hindsight is a wonderful thing hence why I right this review to aid other future parents ).

However the midwifes lack of attention or care to my son actually resulted in him getting moderate hypothermia, she was more interested in the checklist of tasks to complete so she could go home than actually ensuring my sons well being, to the point that when she handed over to the next midwife and did a runner, the next midwife immediately cancelled all further tests and put my son under heat lamps for hours, called the NICU and reserved a space, fortunately he responded, I feel so annoyed to this day in trusting that midwife as looking back there was so many times where I could have said "wait a minute you need to do something now" - so please read up about baby hypothermia, "the warm chain" and other complications and be brave and speak immediately as this lot don't seem to care or know about this to the point that my son was put into a situation that you would expect in third world countries not in Australia.

In addition when I wrote a letter of complaint I got the usual corporate fob of letter that you expect when you complain about a broken washing machine, i.e. we take all complaints seriously, bla bla bla, we have fed this back to the team for improvement and lessons learnt......I mean really - they could kill babies and they feel a letter like that is sufficient.

In addition the hospital did additional booking for Caesareans due to special numbers in the day/month and any layman could see the place was full if not over full - When I raised this as a factor of the poor care in my letter, I got the response "We meet the minimum requirement of care"...….I was shocked "you don't go private to get the minimum level of care" so in my view it was a clear case of money before care

......I could go on for hours about how annoyed I get about trusting that nurse and this hospital.....so I say to all future customers / parents to be - have a hard look around and don't let the proximity of the Monash NICU persuade you to chose this hospital - there are other hospitals with NICU's and better care.

Unfortunately I've been admitted to Jessie McPherson Private Hospital 3 times since May. In saying that, I was very fortunate to be surrounded by very caring and professional staff that were also very friendly.

I have been in a lot of hospitals as a patient and this was certainly one of the best I've been admitted to in every way.

I must also mention that the food was excellent and nothing like 'hospital food' at all!

I went to the Day Surgery 3 weeks ago and they were really nice and accommodating. The nurses were really nice and got the job done well and fast. Unfortunately I had to go back to hospital for an emergency surgery 3 days ago and again, they were really amazing. On top of everything. Took care of me and made me feel very comfortable the whole stay. The food was nice, especially being vegan, sometimes they just have no clue but they created some delicious stuff.It made me truly appreciate what they do everyday for all their patients. Thanking the team there. Amazing people

When I first got to emergency they were quickly on to my issue and attentive to my needs.  Doctor looked at me and decided I should be admitted.  It then took them 9 hours to take me up to a bed!  All the while they were saying that there was a bed shortage and they were trying to move people around to find a spot.  Well when they finally took me to the 2nd floor, I got a 2 bed room and directly across the hallway was a 4 bed room, completely empty!

The only good thing about this place is the food.  Shower/toilet rooms could not be locked and they were cluttered with mobile toilet seat things.  
Nurses were basically robots working to a defined schedule, so they would wake me in the middle of the night to give me one tablet.  One nurse would not dim down the hallway lights at night and left the ward doors wide open, so that made sleeping very hard.  And they would not consider patient comfort by allowing people to talk loudly all the time, often during the night, when walking past wards.

Overall experience was OK but not the standard I expect from a private hospital.
Brilliant emergency ward, the friendliest and helpful caring staff we have ever had in a hospital
Most amazing nurses and hospital staff. Thank you so much for the care you gave me.

My husband attended emergency dept at 1am on Sunday morning. Was treated very efficiently by nurse Marcella. Attended again today and had friendly and efficient service from Lucinda (reception) Nora and Dr Chen. All made another visit to emergency at John Fawkner very reassuring.

Completely exceeded my expectations. Reception and staff were absolutely amazing. I was scheduled for a colonoscopy and was treated by Dr. Taggart and honestly was terrified!! He was such an experienced doctor and kind and answered all my questions. The procedure was very quick, was looked after so well. I would recommend this place to everyone, one of the best experiences I have ever had. keep it up guys you are beyond amazing!
Lovely staff. Very friendly. Made a bad day bearable. Little expensive but worth every dollar.
All good, everything considered a good start to the day.
Very rude and unprofessional receptionists.

I had recently started using the resources within the Specialist Pain Clinic & find the Doctor's & Specialists to be very thorough & attentive. 
The Customer Service Receptionist's are very patient with all enquires & so helpful. Look forward to continuing with my rehabilitation which I feel very positive that I will develop life long changes to help my situation.

How can a gov funded health centre surrounded by farms, isolated from any train stations or retail district, which also has acres of spare land, justify the ridiculously high parking fees, and offer a complex that majority still lives in the 1950's, with one renovated section? Hospital food is usually bad, but should not resemble dog food.. places like this possibly make vulnerable patients more ill.. i will give some staff credit for their efforts, but overall very dissapointing.

The staff are wonderful...the original building could do with some renovations.. Outside toilets..6 patients in one room toilet shower across the hallway...why is it in this very old embarrassing state ...why is the gov not helping. Its depressing I've seen rehabs in better conditions in a third world country.. The staff are just amazing

I have received absolutely pathetic service so far. An 8 hour seminar before youre allowed into the service, and appointments are booked 3 months apart. At my last appointment I was given a booking slip with my appointment times written on it. They were wrong but it didnt matter anyway because both doctors cancelled on me. That didnt matter either because I was offered an appointment on the same day, an hour later, which makes me wonder why I'm waiting 3 months between appointments. Theyve done absolutely nothing for me. My private physio and GP have done worlds more for me. Dont actually waste your time.

Parking rates are shocking for a govt. funded facility. Pharmacy charges are 50% to 75% more than what you'd pay at local pharmacy. Who says they are not a money making concern!
Can't even get a free cup of tea from the PSA when visiting my uncle there! Absolutely shocking....Maybe it's the PSA making her own rules.
Very satisfied with the care received here. Very pleasant nursing staff for the most part. Food was always fine.

A family member was admitted to Knox Private for a regular check up and the experience was very unpleasant - the person admitted was an insulin dependant diabetic (also has memory problems)- the nurse did not think it was necessary to ensure food was available before injecting insulin.  The food delivery people "forgot" to deliver his meal and when I questioned the nurse  where his food was very casually  she brought sandwiches from the fridge to the patient. The patient could have gone into a hypoglycemic episode or even worse a coma if I wasn't there to alert them.  I would give no star to this hospital if possible. (overall the patient's blood sugar level was elevated throughout his stay in the hospital for some unknown reason).

Been there 3 times in the last 12 years - The specialists doctors are great there, but some of the recent arrivals of nurses from overseas (Australia's mother country) are the worst - they tell you off if you want an extra blanket or  tell you to unhook the plasma needle from the stand yourself (ok if they show you how once) to go to the toilet or if you wish to stay an extra night (they tell me I am only a  day operation patient - I thought that was up to the doctors to decide & if you are a private patient you have to pay anyway - Dr told me later, that I could have stayed another day,if I feel unwell after the operation).  Generally they are the rudest lot there.  Just been to public/government hospitals and found them much better including the local nurses there.
I found all the staff to be deceiving and rude, just wanted the money in my opinion. Didn’t give a damn I was a veteran or in Pain. Not to mention the lack of dignity experienced.
I received fantastic care by Dr Ed Wong and everyone in theatre as well as all of the team on Kenloch. Thank you.
Phenomenal, insightful staff with life changing advice cleverly structured for tired, stressed parents.
Absolutely genuine people in the whole early parenting unit team. Best sleep school.

Had health scare last night called 000 ambulance came at around 10.00Pm previous week same except sent to Melbourne this time given previous history taken to Kyneton hospital met by Jenny in emergency cannot believe what what this person did for me in the next six hours before l finally went off to sleep, kept checking on me contacted local doctor rang wife and updated on situation gave ongoing advice and continually monitored situation. Left in the morning before l woke up so couldn't thank her for the treatment we are so lucky to have such dedicated people in Kyneton. All other staff were unbelievable thanks to all
Great hospital, nice staff, clean and efficient.
Before, throughout and after my surgery the staff and nurses were friendly and very attentive. I usually hate being in hospitals but was surprised to actually enjoy my day and night stay at Kyneton.

Start of a clinical assessment with a first time mother - a vulnerable person who had attended your hospital for help - should NOT be a 7 minute lecture about being a bad mother for not attending hospital earlier. It only serves to make her feel shame and guilt. Was it not obvious that she needed support, and that is why she was at your hospital? Why does this building exist when so many people in the community have nothing but bad things to say about it. If you're reading this review en route to this hospital: do yourself the favor and drive south on the freeway to Sunshine, RMH, Royal Women's, etc. A visit to the Kyneton Hospital is an unnecessary delay in the treatment you're looking for.
Modern and clean, nice staff.

Wasted my time, never going there again. Appointment at 10:15, was there 5 min earlier, 2 people came a while after me and still got seen by the gp before me. I waited for 35 minutes past the appointment time, I go to the receptionist and she says, sorry I'll cancel the appointment for you. No discussions. If I could give it -5 stars, I would. Never again.

Never in my life have I been treated with such disrespect by multiple gp's. Not only that I was given factually inaccurate medical information regarding medication and had days wasted by them running me around with false assurances.
-edit: The reception staff are nice.

If I could give a minus review I would! Absolutely disgusting!!! We waited an hour and a half past appointment time only to be told it's cash only. When we said oh we saw a sign saying card accepted the doctor aggressively said don't argue and shook his hands. He also really aggressively tapped my partner's head where needed to be examined to the point I heard the contact on the hit on his skull and my partner had to pull away in pain. Very terrible service awful mannered doctor!! If you want to be treated well don't see dr boon hong. So the waiting room was disgusting! Some kind of yellow splatter on the hand sanitizer and wall. Such poor hygiene...

I’ve come here before previously and the practice has been ok overall. However, today I had an appointment at 1:00 pm, arrived at 12:50 and still have had to wait to see the doctor for over an hour and see patients that we’re waiting after me go in with the doctor supposed to see me. Not even a sorry when I approached the reception to ask what was going on. I had other commitments, arrived on time and me loosing my time was completely disregarded. Unacceptable and unprofessional.  Also, very disappointed that for a long time they have not had a female doctor available. Very disappointed with my experience today.

If you need blood tests or immunisations for University placement this is the place to go.

I spent 6 months going back a forth with my current medical institution including unnecessary vaccinations before giving up and coming to the LaTrobe University Medical Centre instead. 

Nurse Judi fixed up my vaccinations and forms in 2 days and was able to submit straight away. Very happy with the reception staff and doctors too!

You have to wonder how many people review this place since it is our only local hospital so you can't say anything too crazy.  While I appreciate the support I got from the doctors and nurses last December when I presented as a heart attack patient I did find one of the reception staff to be a right Hitler! I had to go home to get my Nevro charger and then come back for transfer to Melbourne and the attitude of the woman I faced when I had to be readmitted, she needs a heart check as she clearly didn't have one.     I was in Latrobe almost 12 hours I think before i was eventually transferred to Melbourne where they found a 99% blocked LAD.  12 hours!

A&E is possibly the most incompetenet A&E in OZ, understaffed, but filled with trainees doing all the work, and doing it poorly. The actual hospital staff on the other hand are brilliant, but if you're going into A&E, don't expect to be helped accurately.

I presented at the emergency dept with a broken ankle. There were four people waiting when I arrived. Five hours later I was attended to. I, was sitting with an obviously BROKEN ankle, HAVING HAD THE X-RAYS SENT FROM MOE.
Two years ago I presented at LRH via ambulance suffering from pneumonia and a cardiac arrest. Some idiot doctor rang my brother in Melb and informed him that I was in a coma and if anybody wanted to see me again, they should get to LRH as soon as possible, since they were going to turn the life support off. My brother rang the LRH and asked to speak to a senior doctor. Within 15 min I was in a helicopter on my way to the Alfred. I stayed there in ICU for 8 days, then in thoracic ward for a further ten days, then rehab for another 7 days. If my brother had listened to the idiot, I would now be DEAD!
New area is absolutely amazing, the staff were very caring and made us feel at home.

If I could give a 0 out of 5 I would. I am absolutely livid how useless and awful this hospital is, the way they treated my partner is disgusting. None of the doctors would take his condition seriously, he went in with a huge swollen leg with a rash that has turned into an open wound, and they booted him out in that condition with no way of getting home. There is something obviously wrong with his leg and quite evidently infected, and every GP we had seen told him that he should be in hospital because his condition is beyond normal treatment, yet the hospital didn't seem to care whatsoever! One of the doctors told him that if he stayed in hospital, the bugs there would worsen his condition and they'd have to chop his leg off?? What is he even supposed to do with his condition at home! It's worsening every passing moment and it's beyond normal medications/help. Shame on this hospital.

Such a wonderful place! Lovely facilities and terrific staff. We are here today with my 3 year old for an overnight stay and they organised a private room with 2 beds so I can stay with her. The nurses are so great with kids and friendly!

Love the staff absolutely  wonderful .Catering staff very helpful.The worst part of my 7 days was the food.Same menu for a month i believe,food is horrible was reduced  to sandwiches,ice cream.All food was spices nothing like steak and vegs or plain food.No shop to buy anything either need to pull up up their socks quite a few people where complaing.Hence why im writing this review.
Staff fantastic

Dollars before patients! Was called the morning of my daughter's operation to be told they were having trouble with the Health Insurance number for her. So they were going to delay until they can confirm she is covered. Will avoid going here in the future!

Clean and tidy, cheerful staff but they still kept my three children waiting despite specifically organising the first three appointments of the day. Why are medical “professionals”  universally unable to keep appointments like the general population?
I had surgery here it was adenoids and turbinates removed good experience but it would be good if they had a cafe there.
Thank you to Simon and the team in the emergency department for looking after us Sunday. The girls were very upset and scared when they arrived but left with big smiles on their faces.

In facilitating my speedy recovery, I just want to thank the entire staff for their dedication. I am highly impressed with the respect and dignity with which the medical staff treated me during my stay.

Friendly AND  professional - 3 nurses (all blokes, btw) and a doc (Libby) . Rang my chemist and home hospital to identify my medication needs ahead of ransferr to Geelong Hospital, saving time. Given I was suffering a spot of bother I was not only impressed but extremely appreciative...
Very efficient and caring.👍🤕
Best care on the coast!
Good GP doctor to visit
Allways very good
When only the best will do
It's mainly an aged care facility but does have urgent care centre. If you need more than basic treatment you will be moved to a larger centre
Well looked after

name: Mallee Track Health & Community Service [Sea Lake]

reviews.text: I can't describe in words the amazing work done at Malvern Rehab. For all those who look for a holiday, I suggest going to Bali or Thailand or wherever you want to have a holiday. If you want to find and fix the hole in your soul, I recommend going to Malvern... the nursing staff and counselling staff are firm and strict, but so empathetic, so non-judgemental and kind, they helped me dig up my piled up pain and issues from my childhood and want to live my life and not escape from it... I highly recommend it!!! Going to MPH was the best I have done in my life so far... :) Thank you MPH

Have had two admissions here in the past few months. The rigid structure and combination of group therapy and 1:1 councelling is what I’ve needed to take the next steps with my recovery. Staff are all friendly and accommodating. Facility is fairly well kept although some of the cleaning leaves a little to be desired. The therapists all have their own style which I believe is quit complimentary. The psychiatrist  is very effective. At a time when I needed a safe place to go that could help me get on track, Malvern Private was there. I know several people who have gone to Malvern and stayed clean/sober since. I hope I will become one of them.

I am now almost 4 years clean and sober thanks to both Malvern Private and WHOS in Sydney. 

The one star reviews are clearly written by ex-patients still caught in the self-pitying grips of addiction. To be honest they were probably drunk/high and feeling sorry for themselves when they wrote the reviews (the types who overdose, go to prison, get the AIDS or suicide instead of getting clean/sober). 

We all walk into these rehabs as a self-pitying and self-obsessed victim who thinks they know how a rehab should operate and what’s best for them...

Just so people know, the only 5 star review given here is posted by a staff member who works there.

Also to note that I got an unsolicited text message from them near TWO YEARS after the fact with zero option of opting out of further communication from them.
Not at all what it is made out to be. I've been advised that Melbourne Private in Richmond is a far better, far more successful facility. This place is a joke.

Best experience ever as far as health care goes...
Friendly, happy staff who all seem to actually enjoy their place of work and seem to be constantly smiling.
I cannot recommend this place highly enough.
Staff are magnificent and I was well looked after as well as kept well  informed.
Many thanks.
Tom Sunderland kept me waiting for 40 minutes for an appointment. No updates, no apology. Such arrogant indifference means I won't be going back.

NOT EVEN WORTH A STAR!
DISCRACEFUL! 
My partner had to insert our little girls nasal gastric tube HERSELF as your nurse after 3 attempts couldn't, FYI - My partner has had NO medical training what so ever and only offered to fit the tube herself as your nurse (who also said she can do it) couldn't get the tube in right and was causing a huge amount of distress to our little 9 month old girl and my partner! Surprisingly your nurse accepted the offer???? We called your hospital prior to traveling up your way and was advised fitting a NGT would be no issue and your team was capable. REALLY? Further more my partner said you will be sending a bill out to us! My partner called me in tears crying her eyes out due to your nurses incompetence and having to insert the tube herself, of which she should never have had to do! Any parent/person who cares about their/a child will understand why we are so upset, to have your 9 month  old baby screaming her little lungs out is heart breaking enough let alone having to do a basic medical procedure your self on your own child. Shame on you. You will be hearing more about this in the future after we seek professional advice. You will have our details on file as my partner and our 9 month old girl where there today the 29/12/16.

Absolutely disgusted at the negligence my partner suffered. He came in with an agonising full body rash after being sent there by a pharmacist.
We waited there for four hours while he shook with pain despite only one other patient being in the waiting room.
We were eventually seen by Dennis who proceeded to look at his hands (not the rest of the rash on his body) grab them without asking (causing pain) and dismiss everything said by my partner and myself.
He told him this was eczema and to put antiseptic on it and take a steroid (prednisolone) and sent him home.
Later that evening he was crying and shaking from pain and now cannot use his hands.
I had to remind the doctor of the side affects between the medications my partner was on as he did not even bother to read the notes the nurse had taken.
Utterly disgusted.
Nearest Hospital from Bonnie Doon if bitten by a snake.
Friendly professional knowledgeable staff.

Has an ambulance, midwife and a surgery theatre.
This district hospital means people can receive urgent medical attention without travelling a far distance

Arrived at emergency by personal transport (not via ambulance). Was treated well at reception. Admitted to emergency and the staff there, as with any hospital, were busy but provided excellent care. Admitted to the hospital where, again, the treating staff were excellent. Regular verbal and physical checks to ensure all was well. The treating nurses always kept up-to-date with outcomes of tests and doctor's discussion and kept us in-the-loop. Shift hand-overs appeared to provide the necessary information to the incoming nurses; and the incoming nurses did a check on their patients ASAP. If this was a restaurant review, I would say "happily go again". The hospital treated the patient well, with respect, and provided great care.
They have fabulous nurses and doctors. My son stayed in emergency and most nurses there were good hearted and caring the patients. Thanks so much.

First time I've ever needed to go into hospital in my whole life through the emergency department. The staff were so friendly and very accommodating never once did I feel I was a burden, even though I felt I didn't deserve a bed they still made me feel like I mattered an was treated with much respect.

A huge thank you to all the doctor's and nurses who took care of me. Even to the reception thank you for the caring nature it has been hugely appreciated.

Please do something about your parking. I was already in the area an hour before my appointment and in that hour there was literally NOWHERE to park at all! Public car park that was meant for patients and visitors were taken up by the hospital’s own staff. Staff were not helpful either when I rang to say that I’m running late - lectured me about being on time and that I should have planned my parking ahead. Pathetic.
Friendly and accommodating staff, but I'm still waiting here. I hear my kids have graduated high school. They were in primary school when I came in.

The urgent care centre here is truly frightening. My wife presented at 8.00 am in the morning with a suspected broken wrist. No examination, just 2 Panadol for pain relief and left to sit in the waiting room for almost 6 hours. No cuppa, no refreshment of any sort offered and no care. Finally got an xray which confirmed a fracture and no treatment offered. Was not allowed to see a doctor as we are not locals and was consigned to a nurse practioner who contradicted the radiologist. The staff here just don't care, several times we were told we could go somewhere else if we like and if I hear the term "ah you're not a local one more time" I'm going to go nuts.
Amazing ! From the moment I arrived to leaving, the care provided was outstanding ! Thank you to all the beautiful staff who took care of me x Nurses Tahlia and Jennelle , thank you x
really great hospital to do a university assignment on. saved my grades. solid 11/10.

Emergency room very poor performance! Son had vomited blood and they were so busy having a chat they didnt even think to call the doctor on call for over 40 mins!!! Wasnt until we threatened to leave they did something.  Disgusting service for so called 'emergency department' you are bloody well here to do a job not chat about your weekend.
All staff friendly, very helpful with enquires. Highly recommended.
what wonderful, professional caring staff. I couldn't have asked for better service. A pleasure to have been a patient there.
Great staff
Prefer LRH
Good hospital
路线出现问题，在去到医院吗的时候是有正门口进入的，但在地图上没有显示

First day was sad.  My daughter cry loudly in the room.  we back to our room and felt quality and regret to bring her here. 
Second day is life changing.   sleep addiction.  
I hope this review will encourage all parents who had concern. 
I booked.  changed.   cancel for three times.  its worth to go and learn. 
the results is excellent.  all staff here is very helpful and well trained. experienced . they know how to handle tough baby.  but you have to trust them. 
follow the routine.  all works well.  
life changing.

We went to the early parenting center on Feb 1st with my baby for the 5 day residential program. The program was alright, there was a lot of information shared. After the program, they offer telephone support for 6 weeks. In spite of leaving multiple voice messages,  no one returned my calls. And never called me after the 6 weeks as was promised in the program. So 2 stars coz i never received support afterwards.
Excellent hospital. Quality staff. Very good to the patients.

I was at Masada late yesterday for day surgery. I want to name the staff who were so kind and  lovely. It started at reception but unfortunately not sure of her name sorry . Then it was Lisa, Sally, Maggie and Manny. Not forgetting the amazing Dr Cox and surgeon Dean Samaras. I was impressed by all so thank you very much
Francesca

Have always gone public, but decided to choose private this time. From start to finish the entire process with Masada was so badly organised. Was told to come in for surgery at 7 am but was not taken in until close to 11 as i was the last one on the list. Had to explain pre-surgical discssions i had with my surgeon, and anetheist over and over to different medical staff. This is not something you wanna do when trying to recover post-theatre. Then being ripped off for medications after asking about pricing to in order to deicde whether to get a prescription or to take the meds via Masada. Completely dissapointed in what i received as a full fee paying patient.

My son has endured one of the most soul destroying sessions with one member of this establishments team.  This psychiatrist, has treated my son and his condition with utmost disdain , and directed more attention to the cake they were eating during the session.To further add to the shambles of a consultation, they didnt appear to read any previous Doctor and psychiatric notes emailed ahead of the appointment , & treated him like a drug addict and finished off by yelling at my son and saying "THEY COULDNT HELP HIM BECAUSE THERE IS  NOTHING CLINICALLY WRONG WITH HIM" ! even though he  has an existing diagnosis, but they failed to either read or acknowledge this!
Have dealt with Dr.Reddy for over 12 months and he has been very professional in his approach. Doesn't always resort to medication, fully supports counselling/therapy. Excellent team highly recommend

Avoid Dr Reddy.  When I tried to discuss my emotional struggles with him (a very vulnerable thing to do) he looked fed-up and even disgusted. He also blamed me for the lack of progress that we had made over a few sessions, and overcharged for the privilege (I paid $180 for 20 mins). A hugely disappointing experience—I would urge you to find someone who really cares and is interested in helping you.

I have been going here for almost a year and seeing Dr. Reddy, and I really recommend this place to anyone who is struggling with their mental health. Dr. Reddy is a professional who genuinely cares about your mental health and would do anything for your recovery. He listens to my struggles and helps me overcome them. I have never been disappointed, not even once. The receptionists are always kind and nice. They are also flexible to changing and busy schedules.

name: Melbourne Oral and Facial Surgery-Kevin Ruljancich

reviews.text: Bit ordinary for the money. Ultimately it’s about quality of care and I can’t fault that but you would expect the aesthetics to be a little nicer.
Fantastic hospital, staff are exceptional on all levels, my most recent stay was not the first and my treatment every time is above and beyond so thank you to everyone on the neuroscience level

I stayed here for 4 days during September 2018. I was in the Neurosciences ward (Level 8) The staff from all walks of life (Vietnam, Philippines, Malaysia, India, Ireland, Bali, a kiwi and a couple of Aussies, were very helpful and kind.
 The food was healthy and tasty,  and the menu sufficient.
 The Doctors were very busy but always found time to check on their patients.
I would have given the Hospital 5 stars, however, there  was no coffee with either lunch or dinner, or even after dinner (cost cutting I guess) so I marked it down one star. The nurses would make you a coffee, usually if you asked. Otherwise, an enjoyable stay.
A good hospital with facilities in walking distance, eg chemist, café, florist. staff were caring and helpful

Had a MRI  was hurt in the the  tunnel  
Got  a call  to say was looked at  and all was ok      oh  actually   I was hurt dont care about  the  machine   oh and it  cost  me  $290  to limp out of there  not  happy

Had 2 teeth pulled & appointments to check everything first. All free, hardly waited & the staff were friendly & professional. Reception were above & beyond lovely, & staff (students & otherwise) were thorough & easy to understand. Highly recommend!
Good place didn't have to wait seen a nurse then a doctor both spent time and had good advice highly recommend
Ring you 30 minutes before an appointment and tell you that its canceled. What happens if I do not answer the phone. Poor service all round. Stear clear if you want good service!!

Went there today no one was there waiting still took 30min for a nurse to see me. Then saw the worst doctor who didn’t even examine me just said I can’t help you there’s nothing I can do at this urgent care Go to a real hospital.

I have been involved with chronic back pain for more two years and got some help from the physiotherapy section at this centre. However, I am still in  tribble pain, I have got 30% improvement, they are professional and amazing people, thanks a lot.

We have had an amazing experience at the O'Connell centre with our almost 9 month old bubba who was having trouble sleeping.
Staff enabled my husband and I to set our own goals and work towards achieving them. I never felt pressured to use any method that I didn't feel comfortable with, I felt encouraged to be responsive to my daughter and learnt how to respond appropriately.
Just like the real world, the team are a different mix of personalities. Annie was our favourite midwife as we loved her relaxed approach. It's a safe, fun environment and we feel very privileged to have been offered a place so quickly.
Would highly recommend to others in despair! We feel much more positive about the change - it will hopefully continue!

Did not work.  A terrible week  all for nothing

If you look up Racket in the dictionary there must be a picture of this place. They get paid by the government wether it works or not. In our case not.  Our son seems more stressed, and is not sleeping any longer than when we entered the school.  Basically after 3 weeks we are back to step 1.  

Also as a father I felt 100% left out.  In my two visits I had a total of about 5 minutes speaking to someone.  It was a bunch of "Ra, Ra" bs about how I would notice XYZ as long as I just ignore the crying.    

Bottom line is this: The week was super stressful for my entire family. After 3 weeks back, no difference or improvement, most likely a regression. If you are a Dad....expect a cold shoulder.

I was unsure at first about 5 days here as I’d heard and read mixed reviews about sleep schools. A baby’s well being is a subject so close to the mother’s heart, I understand now why there is such polarity in opinions. It is hard to change habits such as co-sleeping when there are tears involved but watching my child’s progress from crying in her own cot at the start of the week to beginning to self settle tearlessly by the end of the week, I was relieved and grateful.

It was an emotional experience and hard to hear a fair bit of crying by my baby and others in nearby rooms. But by the end of the week there were a lot fewer tears. I wouldn’t have been able to handle the tears at home as I’d always intervene right away but with support it’s worth it as the babies settle into their new routine and learn to self settle. A nurse pointed out that learning to be less anxious on your own without mom or dad being immediately available, is a skill children carry with them all through life such as on the first day of childcare or school. Learning this skill with mom or dad nearby in a supportive environment makes sense. 

I recommend it for those ready to give their babies the independence of a sleep routine and who may need it to get more sleep themselves. The staff were so supportive, knowledgeable and caring. The environment was comfortable and spacious with lots of toys, books and activities for the babies. There are resources for parents also including talks and counselling plus a BBQ for the dads. There were only 5 families in our section as the younger and slightly older babies are in separate areas, so it was easy to bond with the other moms without feeling crowded. There is no free wi-fi or TV but it made me focus on spending more quality time with my daughter, which was great. A big thank you to the staff here as I genuinely believe they do their best and from the heart to help the families who visit.

We have gone to this for place with hope that they will help us settle our baby and have left so disappointed! They use control crying method although they call it response method. When you leave child behind closed doors to cry for you and you come in after few minutes and gradually increase time intervals, that is called controlled crying whatever label this establishment wants to place on it.
One of nurses was grossly unprofessional and have used information to basically blame mum for child sleeping issues. Very disappointed, this place is not what they promote it to be!

WARNING! 96hrs of slamming doors, other children screaming openly in communal hallways, sometimes barely edible food and a particularly tragic member of staff who humiliated herself with grossly unprofessional conduct. Our child is now traumatised. For your sake and the sake of your child ***STAY AWAY FROM THIS ESTABLISHMENT***

This hospital is 2 stars at best. Unfortunately due to unexpected last minute complications I was transferred to this hospital from private. The clinic appointments were horrible & consumed so much of my life in the final weeks of pregnancy causing extra stress. I waited up to 4 HOURS one week for a routine appointment, then got an extremely rude female doctor who acted like she was doing me the biggest favour in the world by seeing me before a few other patients. You never get to see the same doctor either & have to constantly repeat & clarify everything written in your file. The midwives in the fetal monitoring unit were pleasant and often more helpful then the obstetric doctors. The birthing suite itself was the most decent part of this hospital and the midwives were outstanding in this area of the hospital. The maternity ward afterwards however was full, confusing to navigate through & noisy 24/7. I couldn’t wait to get out of the ward so I could go home to silence and actually get some sleep. I left a day early & now understand why people often want to leave public hospitals so soon after giving birth. All in all there were good and bad aspects but not somewhere I’d recommend as first choice if you have options. I also cannot forget to mention that the parking cost was exorbitant.

They always late 2 hours for your appointments but if you come 10 minutes late for your appointment you will face relegation. There is only 1 or 2 of the Midwifes are good, and the rest are either corrupted or plain racists. The Midwifes they only give 40% of their productivity to some races and they give 110% to their favorite race.

From the moment I fell pregnant, with all my hospital appointments and check ups this hospital was fantastic. Being my first child I was really nervous, the mercy hospital and all the staff that helped me give birth to my daughter were outstanding, I was blessed and felt extremely lucky to have been looked after as well as I was. I ended up having a ceasarean and all the women in the room with me cared for me extremely well I felt so comfortable and knew I was in the best hands. So too all you beautiful women who worked on me I want to thank you all so much. These women actually care and they have so much passion for the incredible work they do. I hope you all are recognised and appreciated by all for all that you do. My experience was wonderful and I would highly recommend that the mercy hospital is the best to all women. Thank you. 
Ruth and rose a very special thank you to you too.

Just had my first baby.

Experience we had there was no less than private hospital.
I have never been to private hospital and I didn’t want to go either. 
Mercy has such a great staff members. 
Every midwife they have in their birth suites they are taught to deal with really good care.
Massive shoutout for Georgia  & Rachael.
Rachel is someone I was seeing throughout the time on my regular appointments. They both were no less than my family.
Really appreciate both of your help & also great thanks to Mercy hospital for keeping their standard this high. 
Hopefully come back in few years time and find you there.
If I happen to come past mercy will stop by and say Hi to you all.
Better than private hospital . All staff are amazing !
Just had out first baby here. Midwifery dept was outstanding couldn't be more helpful. Big thanks to all staff :)

Never mind the 5 hour wait for a head injury. You'd be infected by something else by the time you left. The floor, bathrooms and chairs were FILTHY. When I was eventually taken into triage I was told to sit on a chair full of someone else blood. 
The staff are also very unfriendly and useless. We were warned by the locals that this hospital was awful, never did I believe that it would be as bad as what it actually is.

Dont get sick and dont have an accident in this town. Despite having ambulance cover we were told we had to drive 25 minutes to get here (I am writing this in the waiting room) two ambulances were parked in the driveway when we arrived. We have been waiting for what is now 3 hours having watched a procession of people in arguably worse condition then my fiance leave frustrated and unattended. The waiting room has blood and dirt on the floor. The toilets haven't been cleaned with paper and bandages on the floor. The staff couldnt care less and are more suited to being prison wardens. I have experienced better service in Cuba, Sri Lanka, Laos & Thailand. Perhaps the worst hospital in Australia. You would be hard pressed to find an equally useless operation.

Whatever you do, dont go here! Staff do not care what so ever, rudest people i have ever met. Hung up on the phone, very very rood, better of driving to the next hospital to get treated. This hospital should be seriously shut down or staff should be replaced!! Pathetic and beyond dissapointed

never been passed from one person to another so many times in my life, possible to talk to 4 different people in one day and get different opinions and advice, there is way to many people passing paper work around to actually get a proper outcome. please please feel free to contact me,, and i am not even the patient, my mother is.  Sadly this is the only Hospital we have in the area. Privatised ,,so more about the money i think.

Its about a year and a bit since we had a baby at this wonderful hospital. Our anxiety was calmly and professionally handled by the wonderful midwives at Mitcham Hospital, right from the time we were admitted to till the time we were discharged. Midwives were available to consult at any time of the day or night and though each had a variety of techniques to help, they were all happy to do so and taught us both a lot on how to take care of our little bub. Everytime we drive past the Hospital, we have a smile on our faces and express our gratitude through a silent thank you. God Bless. Cheers.

I could not advocate more for the Mitcham Early Parenting Centre.
My son, Spencer the night before sleep school we rocked him to sleep from 12am until 4am and my wife were at our wits end.
The team were fantastic - Joy assisted with all intake and support, and the team helped us every step of the journey.
Our son now comfortably self settles and is a whole new little boy, I could not be happier. 
If you're having doubts, the Mitcham were a massive support and help to us and I hope they are for you too

Have had both my girls delivered here, one Feb 2017 and one Nov 2018. Although neither births were great, the midwives were really lovely and reassuring. The after care is amazing, the food is great, I would definitely recommend, I’m not sure where these bad reviews are coming from as both my experiences in terms of care were fantastic. There were a couple of midwives that were not so great I will admit as they didn’t seem to be very supportive during contractions and left it mainly to myself and partner to deal with until I needed real serious pain relief, but majority of them are so lovely and helpful and are all very knowledgeable and reliable. I will also admit the parking is ridiculous ..

Cancelled my appointment because they said they could not contact me despite me calling the day prior to confirm it.The first time I called at 2:10pm the answering machine said they were closed even though their hours are from 2pm -5pm. Then when I called around 4:15 they had removed my appointment. I have now had to reschedule another appointment with a specialist because I need a referral from here. This is terrible service and they have wasted my time. Patients' health matters and yet the reception here clearly doesn't care.

Felt everything was ok until I ask for a medical certificate.  The nurse in on duty at the time mentioned she could not give it to me.  I wasn't aware its different from hospital to hospital.  I accepted her answer until the nurse blamed me for not asking the doctor before the surgery.  At that time i could only think about the surgery.  This is the best way to alienate your patients before discharging them.

Caring staff, extremely helpful and kind. World class facilities and extremely clean. Would definitely go here whenever possible if I had a choice. The staff helped me through my time in hospital and my wife also went here and she loved it. The parking was a little bit expensive but worth the expense for the staff.

My family were very impressed by the quality of the service and the professionalism of all the staff. Every aspect of our care was managed diligently to the highest standard. No corners were cut to ensure that an accurate diagnosis was made for a frightening set of symptoms. This is all in the context of a waiting room that was packed with patients. We can’t thank the doctors, nurses and team enough for the dedication of the staff. Bravo! We thank you!

Emergency department was okay, but treatment at the private hospital arm was "patch her up and get her out" for my mum. She recently had her second admission for severe anemia, yet diagnosed and sent off with the same treatment as last time. If you don't change anything, how can you expect a different outcome? I can now run around the community trying to get her better (we still don't know what caused it), and hopefully she doesn't end up in hospital in six months time. If she does, it won't be yours.

Maternity was great when our daughter was born here.  But Emergency is definitely understaffed.  On two occasions, my wife needed medical attention over the weekend as our GP was not available.  Both times we waited over 3 hours to see a doctor and left without any peace of mind.

Pretty good overall. My dad had a surgery here. But it amazes me when I see a number of people smoking within the compound, each time I paid my dad a visit. Especially near the children's ward. Isn't that illegal?

Caring staff, extremely helpful and kind. World class facilities and extremely clean. Would definitely go here whenever possible if I had a choice. The staff helped me through my time in hospital and my wife also went here and she loved it. The parking was a little bit expensive but worth the expense for the staff.

Emergency dept/urgent care - exceptional care provided by very friendly and professional staff

With a sick 3 yo child at 11pm on the folky weekend the staff at MHS could not have been more helpful, great care for our boy and us! The two follow up calls in the following days to check on his health were very much appreciated. Thanks team Moyne Health!
Great   very modern

My experience at the M V Private Hospital was one to remember (and I'm 82).
Both the Hospital staff, and the Gym men and ladies were absolutely terrific!!!
Polite and helpful in every way!
A special thanks to the RN, who sat me in a wheelchair and took me for a tour of the grounds and escorted me to my pickup vehicle on my discharge.
A lovely lady and a credit to the facility!
Unfortunately I have 8 surgical procedures in the Northshore Private Hospital in Sydney and rate MVPH it's equal!
Continue with the great work and a Merry Christmas to you.
Royce Curtis 23/10 to 01/11
Easy to find but no parking in the grounds its a bit of a walk which is bad for my back.
Easy access. Friendly staff, convenient parking.

Will not recommend anyone here... My father in law came to this centre recommended here by his dr. the nurse called Gracie who looked after him was absolutely rude and did not care for his wellbeing at all. Did not give him a sip of water even though he wasn't on any restrictions.  Left him for long period of times without even checking up on him, and talked down to him because he could not speak english well.!

I've had the unpleasant experience in having to stay in this excellent integrated rehabilitation centre. It has an excellent hydrotherapy pool, integrated holistic approach to your rehabilitation requirements. The Manor, which is the old hospital is wonderful. There are inside rooms and outside rooms. The outside rooms are great, being that you open the door and walk outside to fresh air. It's what's needed in today's hospital world, fresh air. Yes it's dated, grumpy receptionists, once passed these people you're in and great.

I was recommended this facility by my surgeon who is an excellent doctor and who has impeccable patient care.

I had a call from Helen who 'sold' me on the facility and set my expectation that Dr. Lim would manage my post-op pain and then come up with a pain management plan to help me get off the prescription narcotics rapidly, which I have been taking on and off for about 12 months.

I arrived at the facility on Thursday late afternoon. I settled in with an open mind. Come Friday I spoke to the nurses (repeatedly), physio and OT wondering when I would be seeing Dr. Lim (my treating doctor), not an unreasonable request. 

I found out Friday evening that Dr. Lim would not be seeing me. He would most likely visit me sometime on Monday or Tuesday, 4-5 days after being admitted. Once I heard this I asked for an immediate discharge. This is verging on neglect and this type of behavior should be reported to AHPRA, complete lack of patient care.

Dr. Lim never made any effort to visit me once, despite allegedly being at the facility during my 28 hours stay. I expect that my treating doctor to come visit me once at least once within a 28 hour period, and if not, at least have the courtesy to give me a call and let me know he will tend to me shortly.

I did see the 'GP' who stepped into my room at 7 am the first morning for 2 minutes. He was gone before I could even speak to him, he told me to speak to Dr. Lim.

I often expressed concerns about the levels of pain medications and wanting a pain management plan to reduce my narcotic intake. I was told that Dr. Lim would have to manage that, someone who I had no access to.

The level of care by the nursing staff was of the highest standard, however, the level of care by the doctors is verging on neglect.

I am a private patient, paying top money for service. Room 33 that I was allocated felt like I was in a prison. I was placed out the back, away from human contact, the room, despite recently renovated it was very unwelcoming. The bathroom facilities are substandard for a private facility my guess from the 70's to early 80's.

I had to share a bathroom, which is not ideal but acceptable. The other patient was a pig, I'm sorry but I have no other word to best describe him. He would consistently leave fecal matter in the toilet for me to flush and left a fecal stain towel in the shower recess, where I was to shower. Outright disgusting and unhygienic.

After requesting a discharge, I was meet my the head nurse, at the time she was pleasant and trying to defuse the situation at hand. She was adamant that I should stay one more night and that she will get in contact with Dr. Lim. 

I politely requested to leave, to which I was faced with objections by the head nurse that it was not possible, as no doctor was on the facility to discharge me and that they had no access to the pharmacy, which my medications I bought into the facility where kept. So, I had to stay.

I didn't respond well to this and after a short firm discussion, asking if I was being kept here forcibly against my will, she managed to find a way to obtain my medications which took about 2 hours. It was clear the staff had no idea how to handle such a request.

Since leaving, I have managed to reduce my narcotic pain safely by half over the weekend, while balancing and managing my withdrawal symptoms (I'm not new to this). I'm seeing my local GP today who will assist me in designing a pain management plan and seeing the practice nurse tending to my surgical wound.  

I'm getting far better care from my local GP than what was provided by this facility at a fraction of the cost.

I would not recommend this facility to anyone. 

If you do plan on staying, I strongly suggest you visit the bedroom and bathroom you will be allocated to see if it's up to your standard (avoid room 33). I would also make sure that you meet the 'doctor' who will be caring for you before your visit to rehab. 

To be fair, the main wing, which is a shared facility looks great, the outdoor rooms I would avoid. Nursing, Physio and OT are great.

Rate and review

The North Eastern Rehabilitation Center is the best possible experience and service for Rehabilitation and alot of other services. I have been suffering with this pain from a transport accident that happened 20yrs ago and was under Dr Terry Lim when i needed help with my rehabilitation when the accident happened 20yrs ago at the old hospital Olympia House. I have had constant pain for a number of years now and im currently in the new center.
North Eastern Rehabilitation center in Ivanhoe. And the care i have received from the staff and Dr Lim is first class and the facilties and the help i am getting.  I cant thank them all more than enough for making my life worth living again from the pain im in and making my rehabilitation back home so much easier and liveable again. The staff are so caring i cant thank them enough for all their help so far. Other than to say its the best place i have been to that makes my life worth living again and helping me through some of the very hard times in dealing with my pain i have had for the last 20years. Thank you to Dr Lim and all his staff for getting my life back on track once again. The friendly nurses and the staff have made my stay so better and the kindness and the care has made my recovery so much easier and they are so understanding with everything.
I would recommend this hospital its a 5 star rating from me and thank you to there lovely staff and helping my recovery once again ty.

I would recommend this facility to anybody needing help with any Rehabilitation. 

North Eastern Rehabilitation center 134 Ford st Ivanhoe
Bit of a dump. Needs modernizing

Great hospital, all staff were very friendly, caring and professional. They took great care of me. Once admitted things were moving along at a good pace, everything was explained clearly to me. Great job.
Bit of a wait in emergency, which cant be helped. How lucky are we to live in a country were our medical needs are met for free, no one misses out. 😁
4 hours waiting to change a dressing. And still waiting.

I couldn’t be happier with the treatment I received. I went to emergency on 14/5/18 at 2am with extreme pain related to an infection. I was admitted almost instantly and received painkillers shortly after. I was treated with so much care and compassion. My concerns, symptoms and pain were all taken seriously and treated so quickly. Within a couple of hours my infection had been treated and my pain was gone. I was kept in while the appropriate specialists were called and everything was arranged for me to go home. The nurses and doctors I was treated by were absolutely amazing. Thankyou so much Wangaratta Hospital!
Made phone call to check if someone admitted, reception lady could not be more polite or helpful!  Really appreciate the assistance, from lady working at 12.15pm Friday 23/03/2018, thank you.
Better then shepparton, but very judgement.
