I happened to visit this hospital few times because of my family. everytime uts very clean and tidy. staff here is very friendly and welcoming. they do not give you hard time instead try to help you in every possible way. 
visited pediatric department it was nice and doctors are good. 
visited maternity baby care department. it was quite nice and clean and staff here was very friendly 

the only thing is paid parking. I think 1st hour should be free and must be charged starting from 2nd hour.

Stayed there for 3 nights after surgery. Surgeon was great. The nurses and other staff were also very caring and attentive. The only complaints I have are to do with the lack of anything to do during my stay. 

First of all, most of my time was spent in bed on a CPM exercise machine. So basically 12 hours doing nothing but managing my pain and watching the tv above my bed. Unfortunately it could only get half a dozen channels of local tv (7 9 10 etc) I would have thought a private hospital would have provided something better. Even for an additional fee I would have been happy to pay for foxtel or Netflix etc. Which brings me to my second issue. 

I'd just come from a stay at The Avenue and St John of God hospitals. Both of those only have terrestrial tv. At both places I used my phone to stream Netflix etc and naturally thought I'd do the same here. No chance. The phone reception at Northpark Hospital is at best atrocious. I tried making a number of calls and every one of them was disconnected or failed to connect. No phone calls. No browsing. No emails and certainly no streaming. They need to install some signal booster or other hardware to help rectify this. They won't though. It's all about the money and they won't spend any unless they absolutely have to.

One final issue. The air conditioning. I shared a room with one other gentleman and there were a couple of very hot days. The room was hot and stuffy. I asked for the a/c to be turned on and, because the split system unit was above the other patients head, they had to get his approval before turning it on. Even then it made no difference to my side of the room because his dividing curtains were drawn. He soon got too cold and asked for it to be turned off. I had to ask for a cold pack to help cool me down. A very poor state of affairs to be honest. And not something I would expect to see in a private hospital.

Oh, and the food is pretty average. Especially compared with the other two venues. If I could describe this hospital in one word, I'd say Cheap. And I don't mean in a cost sense.
Very bad service on reception and rude. First experience for me in Australia as an international student when I noticed such unprofessional way to treating patients.

Had a poor experience with reception that was likely due to misunderstandings which I can forgive, but I wish the waiting area would have more comfortable seats or supply pillows. I was seated next to an elderly woman in the waiting room and she claimed she had an unpleasant experience with the hospital before and that the hospital had heard her claims. Unfortunately, she had yet another poor experience there. She was waiting for over an hour and a half seated in an uncomfortable chair. I asked for a pillow for her at the reception but they said they had none. I understand that the long waiting periods of hospitals cannot be changed, but considering the purpose of hospitals is to alleviate the pain of patients, shouldn't they consider more comfortable seating in their waiting rooms so as to not cause further pain to their patients? A large proportion of patients occupying the waiting room were elderly people, likely with back issues and experiencing soreness, yet the hospital has failed to cater to their needs. I understand that it is difficult to fully ensure the patients experience is a pleasurable one, but it just hurt me to see that elderly woman being failed by the hospital once more, and I know that the solution this issue is relatively simple. Please supply pillows, or consider placing a few comfortable chairs in the waiting rooms for those with back issues and/or other complications that require more comfortable seating.
Thank you.

Compared to 1 private hospital and 5 major public hospitals I have been to Northpark is the worst in terms of patient care, pain and antibiotic management, and communication. My child had to wait 25 minutes for pain relief as nurse could not find his medicine chart.  Medicines  were regulary never given on time.   Bed sheets not changed regularly, even when my son vomited on his sheets.  Antibiotics was out of stock and therefore they delayed giving it to my child for 24 hours and this was never communicated to me.   The 1 star is for the newness of the hospital.
Great people work here.

Long waits, People being put in before you (when you clearly have the appointment time and turned up 15 mins early), with nasty professionals and distasteful locals this clinic will leave you amazed and amused yet somewhat dissatisfied.
excellent health service very professional
Very efficient staff and the locum we see.m today was bery good eceellanteficsl l owlefge
Bullies and incompetents. A dangerous place.
Good health service for the surrounding community

This is my 6th time trying to link with Orygen because of my psychs referral. When being called about making the appointment the woman asked "if I really need their services." 

No lady, I'm here for tea, coffee and a social catchup. 

Any other time I've tried to get appointments with this company there has been no followup whatsoever and they even called my (ex)partner behind my back to try and discuss my health with him instead of me. 

Do not recommend, the only reason I'm using this service is on the recommendation of health professionals who have no experience with Orygen whatsoever

Some what over whelming at first....but we are all here for help!!!! The staff are amazing in all areas.  Very caring, listen without judgement and reassuring. Didnt feel abandoned and left knowing we have support for as long as we need.  Highly recommended and thankyou ...

I've had my two years with Orygen. The inpatient unit was very supportive and caring of my needs and staff were there to talk to if I needed. I miss three staff the most if Chloe, Hannah or Kim see this HI!! Haha miss u lots
From Connie S

Inpatient care unit is absolutely pathetic. Don't let anyone tell you that they're there to help, they're not. Majority of the staff are incredibly rude, speak down to you and don't listen to anything you say. The doctors must have found their qualification in a Corn Flakes box, and will dismiss anything you say regarding your opinions on treatment. This place is quite literally just a place to go if you want to end up in a worse state than what you were originally in. Medications shoved down your throat so they don't have to deal with you 24/7, and god help you if you reject any medication. Another patient also went into my room and destroyed my personal property,  to which they did nothing about. 

Also to parents reading these reviews, don't expect anything to be communicated to you. They lie and tell you that your kid is fine. They don't even check. I would NEVER recommend this place to anyone. You're better off staying at home and calling lifeline or something. At least they'll actually listen to you instead of giving you a tablet to sleep so they don't have to deal with you.

DO NOT GO HERE. EVER. Most horrible and depressing place I’ve ever been. The rooms look like cells, and the staff are much worse. They tried to take me here against my will, and when I finally did go on my own accord the man who assessed me was sadistic and borderline creepy. He asked EXTREMELY CREEPY and unprofessional questions. How this place is still running is beyond me. DO NOT GO HERE OR TAKE YOUR CHILDREN HERE EVER. 

The staff are extremely incompetent and take pleasure in assaulting patients. I wish I remembered the doctors name so I could report him. Truly messed up stuff. Should be shut down.
Very friendly and excellent staff with no waiting time at all

I spent four days there first in emergency, then in the ward. Staff are very professional and helpful. This is a very well run hospital. Everything is new, and it all works. I had a private room which was spacious and comfortable. This is an organisation with a very positive culture. I have no hesitation in recommending it very strongly. 

(Update February 2019) Had another visit as a day patient. They were very careful on discharge, taking care that I was actually ready to go home. Instead of dumping me on the pavement, they admitted me to a ward for a few hours and took the time to get it right.

Short waiting times in the emergency department, very clean, organised and professional health facility.

All the staff are professional, empathetic and courteous. Even if it's an out of pocket expense for some, it may we well worth it. 👌

I had my baby here, and all I can say is the midwives were absolute heros. The level of care I received was second to none, and I will certainly return if I'm lucky enough to have another child. Thank you so much!!

I have spent the last few days in PPH and I felt so honoured by the friendly and professional manner in which I was treated by all of the Nurses, the Medical Teams, the Volunteers and the Food/Beverage people!

Being at an emergency ward is never a wanted experience. However, when a visit was necessitated, we decided to attend Peninsula Private Hospital as I was aware that there was an emergency ward there. 

The staff were friendly and prompt. We were seen and discharged within hour. Only thing to be aware of from our experience is that there is an out of pocket expense of $285 for the visit. This was expected from earlier research and was explained on arrival.

I would say we’ll be back soon, but with an emergency ward, we hope to never be back. That said, this was a positive experience for us.

I am sad to have to be doing this, because I know everyone involved with  pm are doing the best that they can during the worst time of one's life. Sometimes the opposite thankfully. However recently my 80 yo mother in law, had a cancer removed from her face. I am completely outraged, firstly, we weren't aware that the surgery was even being done until after it was completed. So no one was with her on the day,  then she is sent on her way,  once she arrived home, she put a cold pack on it as she was told to and it bled a lot. An ambulance was called and they took her back into pm where they had to remove and redo the stitches. Mother in law is praising them enormously, which I   agree with. I just feel that we should have been made aware of what and when procedures would be. I feel like there is a lack of care towards the elderly sometimes. This saddened me.

I have had such fabulous results by attending PETER MAC HOSPITAL since 2011.
The staff are so friendly from the minute you walk in the door, they are there to greet you and take care of you. 
When you phone, you are greeted from such pleasant staff.

I had bowl cancer, which spread to different parts of my body, thanks to the doctors and staff, after following all THEIR advise and not trying all other promises from the outside world, today I stand proud, with such minor spots in the liver, which is under control from their treatment.
I am a Proud Discovery Partner of PETER MAC.
You too should become a member,
a small donation, or even a monthly donation would be greatly appreciated, talk with the staff today.

I don't mean to put a dampener on the love fest, because I experience incredible joy at the knowledge that so many of you are still with us. But I feel a need to point out the terrible fate of the incurables. of which I am one. It is on your first visit you are told you are incurable. They are the doomed, we will die there. The doctors are sort of in a surreal rush to be the first to give us the bad news, as though they get a thrill in their moment of playing god, a bit of ghoulish delight. But very distressing for someone to smirk when discussing how long you've got to live What has happened to humanity. I have noticed that all of the doctors are young. Why is that? You'd think it would be the sort of skill set that would benefit from a bit of experience. The funding structure needs to b exposed. A cancer cancer should be kind to its incurables.
Fantastic new facility. Nurses, doctors and surgeons looked after my cousin very well and she has fully recovered! The nurses and doctors are amazing.

Our experience with doctors and nurses here is great when you get to see them. However, never forget this is a public hospital. Admin staff (when you can get hold of them) can be very by the book and sometimes downright rude, without considering patient need. We all know why you're looking at this hospital, and it has a decent level of speciality care, but please make sure you have a decent GP or private specialist who will look out for your interests and get through their bureaucracy. Your quality of life is worth it.
i love it & my dad Dr. Yasser diab works there!😀
Ten out of ten for  the Portland Hospital nothing but respect to staff who go beyond for patients and  the cleaning staff 10/10 too. If your sick this is the place to be,

HORRIBLE DENTAL SERVICE!
ABSOLUTELY THE WORST! 
WOULD NOT RECOMMEND! 
LATE! 
CHANGE APPOINTMENTS! (MORE THAN ONCE)
Had an appointment at 12.15pm they called us up asking to come in at 11.25 to then find out there on break until. 11:30
12:10PM STILL WAITING!
THEY JUST SCREW YOU OVER!

Had a 20 week ultrasound. 

The lady giving the ultrasound was absolutely lovely. She explained everything and was endlessly patient with my two toddlers and fed up husband (not to mention the unborn baby that was determined not to work with her). She was absolutely lovely. 

Although... 

The staff didn't tell me how much it would cost over the phone when I booked, or that payment was demanded up front. Was left with 7 dollars for the rest of the week because of this mistake. 

I also forgot to grab my ultrasound pictures. I rang up and enquired the next day and a rather rude receptionist told me it wasn't policy to give pictures, and acted as if I'd told her she had to have teeth pulled when I asked if she could still get my baby pictures. She was short. Cut me off while I was still speaking. 

This was my 7th ultrasound, my third child, and I have never ever had to ask for the pictures of my child, or been told anything about it not being policy. They have always just handed them to me. 

Wasn't impressed with reception, but still very impressed with the ultrasound tech.
You took very good care of my great grandma. may she rest in peace.

I would highly recommend to any parent that needs help with baby sleeping. Staff are extremely supportive and knowledgeable. A 5 day stay had a huge positive impact on our family.. from being totally sleep deprived to a baby enjoying  her own cot and sleeps through the night!

Loved all staff besides one learnt how to become a better mum. I made some awsome friends along the way and had alot of laughs. The food was really good and all though i found it hard to get into "playskool" mode at times the overall expierience was great. Thanks so much guys for your help u were great..love Jess..aka "the giraffe that never shuts up" xxx
Loved all the staff really good services
Love this place can't recommended highly enough. Food was amazing staff were extremely helpful. Love love love qec
The support an information that you gain from just a few days is invaluable. I can't thank your team enough ❤️

As a registered nurse, I was hugely disappointed in the standards of care provided for my father by this hospital. From medical to allied health,  nursing care to environmental & catering services, our family's experience fell well short of expectations. Poor communication & non-existant discharge planning, then upon readmission,having to battle to get basics like facewashers to cool my father's fever, a drink..I could go on. Another Healthscope hospital disappointment. Never again!

i will keep this short. would you go to a hospital that denied a dying mans wish to go home and pass away. This hospital doctor staff had no effort to help me take him home. all there energy was to convince me to let him pass in the hospital. this hospital hasno sense of humanity. My father passed away and we got no commincationfrom the doctor

This hospital is terrible! My mum has tried to ask questions to the staff - but no answers from any of them. they seem only to presser my mum to buy the products they are pushing AT the highest price possible (and i checked a few chemists). They only show my mum the bill AFTER she has paid for it!! Only treating my mother as a source of money - disgusting behavior.
Friendly and helpful staff and comfortable. Only thing is not much parking.

Went for mammogram and ultrasound 3/5/18, the lady (the chief) who did mammogram was rude, no explanation, I was screaming my head off, painfully as I have sore Breasts & lumps. Rushing off to get done. No sympathy whatsoever, said to wait for ultrasound then left me in the room on my own. I was crying even during the ultrasound because of the pain and shocked. My review is they rude and heartless. I don’t recommend to anybody.
We need a good doctors and The best tools,
Good health services
The emergency staff are thoughtful, compassionate and thorough. Thanks for such amazing care. The staff here are an asset to the community.
Terrible worst hospital ever never go here made us wait all night to send me to Frankston hospital and my face was swallon

Extremely helpful and caring staff.  Felt like we were being treated by cousins that owned the hospital :)   Great knowledge, compassionate and the teddy bears made by volunteers really made my toddlers very happy.  Highly recommend.

Hopeless in experienced staff ....family member had pressure on brain after spinal cord surgery....would not listen manager a bully....  Insisted she went back to Alfred Hospital were a shunt was put in brain....very sick girl. They did not have experience and were belligerent......hopeless .....they treated us with contempt...hopeless
The pharmacist Meropi was rude and unprofessional.
Fantastic facilities! I had an iron infusion and was looked after by such friendly staff.

What a lovely place. You are made to feel so ‘at home’ by the nursing staff, who are so friendly and obliging. 
Everything was well explained for my gastroscope and I felt very relaxed. Personalized service with a genuine smile from all the staff. Thank you team.

Absolutely 5 Star! Very modern ! Very new! 
Dr Thuy Dinh is truely amazing. I have been seeing him for procedures for 5 years and the facilities are just fabulous. 
Everything is always so efficient from the moment of checking in; until the very end! 
I wouldn’t go anywhere else! 
Thank you to all the staff for constantly looking after me.

Very friendly and 
 Helpful staff 
Brand new buildings 
And a Great cup of tea 
Highly recommended 
Dr Dinh has been very thorough especially with my family history of bowel cancer

I was first referred to Dr. Thy Dinh by my doctor over 6 years ago.  I remember my first visit with him he sat with me and told me my prognosis.  I saw him a few times yearly now I see him 3 yearly visits.
Before your procedure he will speak to you and make you feel safe and comfortable.  When you come out of anesthetic/procedure he talks to you again about what he has done this also puts your mind at ease straight away.   Both my husband and I attend Dr Dinh for colonoscopy's. I  feel very comfortable and safe with him and know I am in good hands. His staff are very polite and make you feel at ease.  I wish him well in his new premise in Rosebud.  Thank you Dr. Dinh

We are so blessed in Melbourne to have one of the best children’s hospitals in the world. All the staff, Doctors and nurses, are so caring, wise and professional, I could not have asked for better care for my son. 

Every one has so much compassion, and lightheartedness, they really help to make it the best possible experience for both the children and the carers, out of what is usually, unfortunately, a very bad experience. 

Your well observed efforts are always appreciated and will never be forgotten.

Update; have not had to go there for a while, but I still only hear good things about the Children’s hospital.

I think their  system is based on priority and they deal the cases on severity. I would request the authorities to kindly have more doctors at the emergency and do provide the patient and cares and approximate waiting time. The overall service people and environment is healthy and would recommend it thank you

Its the best hospital in all of Vic. I ajve been in there lots of times and always the best. The staff are nice and caring. The doctors are always good with patients. Very clean hospital. And great hospitality for mums and dads and visitors

The Best hospital in the world, we would like to thank for Doctors, staff and nurses for offering 'kiddies Sanctuary". Keep up the exceptional standards, with love, CEO & Founder Elizabeth, Elite Women Real Estate:-)

Apart from being one of the world's most important hospitals, it is second to none with technology, amenities and most importantly the kind, and extremely helpful, efficient and very caring doctors, nurses and specialists, and please let's not forget ALL the magnificent volunteers who day after day come in without any complaints to care for our families when we unfortunately can't be there. I really really want to take this opportunity to thank all of the team members for there love and dedicated support when my nephew was in there for near on to a year. I can never thank you all enough for all your help and support when our young man had the fight of his life. Thank you so much

Had a complicated risky surgery here and couldn't be more happier with the result! The doctors and nurses are professional they know what they are doing just wish they could do with a bit more convincing and reassurance that patients will come out ok,overall   went great. The nurses produced great service.  My advice out there trust the people here they know what they are doing, very professional, go ahead with surgery you are in really good hands and it will save your life

I think this is an excellent hospital. If you compare to the Northern Hospital this place is like a holiday on a lovely island. I have had a pretty good experience at this hospital at least you dont sit in the emergency for ten hours

If you love your life then don't get here. The ward doctor will be sipping his tea for 6 hrs even after your repeated attempts to meet him. Once you take a decision to leave against medical advice he will pop by behind you to collect the paperwork. Caught him red handed as I was hiding in the alley to see what they do after I leave. I was refused a discharge summary but they finally agreed to give it instantly when I went and said hi doctor I had been waiting for you since so long and came back to collect something that I left in the room. DONT GO HERE they will make you wait without a doctor until you die.

Visiting my mum who had life saving brain treatment here, I am both wowed and comforted by the excellent services provided here. Each nurse and doctor we have spoken with has been compassionate and informative, with excellent bedside manners and professional approach to both patient and visitor. I'm so grateful to this hospital for saving my mum and allowing me to be with her during this tough time. Thank you.
My Grandmother is currently here for a head injury and we’ll done to the nurses and doctors. They give constant informative status updates to the family and genuinely care. That’s all we ask.

name: The Royal Melbourne Hospital - Royal Park Campus

reviews.text:
Many thanks to the doctors, nurses & carers that work here & helped care for one of my family members during his last months. 
The staff here are compassionate, understanding and very professional.
worst clinic ever doctors and therapist are dreadful! NOT HELPFUL WHAT SO EVER
Thanks for helping my son when he had his ankle sprain.  For the first time he did not cry being next to a doctor or a nurse.
Thank you for existing. Keep up the good work everyone.

big lump 
legs

I had my first visit there today i was shocked to see what condition the rehabilitation hospital is in. I was only a visitor and my opinion is the room's are very depressing the place doesn't look like it had any maintenance on it for years, i actually have gone home depressed thinking of the patients and stsff that have to be there. Austin hospital and the Labor Government need to spend lot's of money to fix this depressing place.
The nurses are fantastic and caring also my speech therapist was the best and last but not least Angi i can't thank you enough for what done for me ill be forever grateful.
Nurses mistreat patients. Facebook, newspapers and TV is what they know and do. As an example, Ajay reading the newspaper comfortably and Stephen watching TV.

I was fitted with and trained for a prosthetic leg, above knee amputation at Royal Talbot Rehab Centre. 

I could not have received better care. Friendly, helpful and well trained staff. Great medical and support crew. In house physio is the best, as is the in house occupational therapy. They have it all in the one complex. Good place. Lucky if you get in there. 

Thank you Royal Talbot!

This place is fantastic and has been so important in my rehabilitation.

I had a overzealous personal trainer absolutely ruin my back causing muscular and nerve issues. 

The staff at royal Talbot plus the facilities have given me the help I've needed to get moving again and help minimise my pain. I'm now only using minimal pain killers and anti inflammatory tablets.

The staff, nurses and docs at the day surgery were absolutely amazing and took great care of me. The nursing staff was compassionate, made me feel at ease and explained everything that was happening. A big shout out to my anaesthetist Jack and the anaesthetic nurse who were just awesome, thank you so much!

Just had a procedure this morning and I would just like to thank all the wonderful staff who helped me during one of the most difficult times of my life. The staff were all lovely and kind - from the reception, to the EPAS clinic and to the Day Surgery Unit. The doctors and nurses who talked to me were all very reassuring and comforting. I’m very anxious to do the procedure but because they explained so well, made me feel that I’m in safe hands and were very empathetic, my fears and doubts went down the drain. The staff are not the only gem in this hospital but the hospital in itself as well. It is very clean and has good facilities. Thank you kindly and for making my hospital experience a breeze.

My family's experience of this place is that they provided the life saving treatment efficiently quickly. After I've read these other reviews, and I think: number 1. If you have a non emergency problem, go see a Pharmacy, or a GP or a clinic near you. If you have an emergency illness or injury, come here. number 2. It's free! Great healthcare, and it's absolutely free! You waited a while, so what, it's free! you had to wait, so what, No matter how bad you think it was, it was incredible value for money. Suck it up and value what you had.

This is ridiculous hospital that I’ve ever been to.
We went to the emergency at 11:30pm, and been told to be wait at the waiting area. 9 patients came after us were all been called in to see the doctor. After 3hours long wait the reception told us just go home and come back tomorrow because there is only one doctor working at the moment and we are not that emergency!
You can’t just made the judgment to the patient that the situation is emergency or not without letting the doctor have check on it. This is really ridiculous and horrible decision that made by a nurse that sitting at the reception!
As a hospital, I feel real shame about what you did to the patients! this is quite a horrible place that bring your partner to the doctor when she got bleeding.

Ps: After 4 hours, they keep sending other patients in and let us waiting. I finally left with my partner cause she couldn’t stop bleeding.
Just wanna ask, you guys keep sending other patients in is that because we are Asian and other patients are Aussie? 
This is so ridiculous!!
Excellent standards of care. Both of our children were born here and we were impressed with staff and services both times. Keep up the great work guys! and massive thanks too!

Lovely receptionist who is extremely helpful. Emergency department staff do a great job looking after you while you wait for a dr. Specialist who visit are amazing too. Cleaning staff are brilliant building is always ckean and tidy. All staff are friendly happy to say hi and have a chat with you. 10/10 to staff who chat with my asd child it makes his day
Marilyn & staff are absolutely lovely

It is one of the best hospitals that have good as well as the experienced doctor. I must say that these doctors are the real experts. It is the perfect hospital that is equipped with all modern facilities.
Lovely friendly staff. Beautiful clean hospital.
Its great to have a hospital n nursing home combined also all the facilities that u get at Horsham Hospital there is no need for all to travel unless u need to visit a specialist

My hubby burnt his hand and although there was a wait, we understand that that can happen. All the staff were so very lovely from reception to the doctors, and at 3am in the morning the doctors/nurses were all in happy spirits. Considering the situation, I enjoyed the experience. Thank you!

An excellent hospital, especially for it's small size. The maternity department staff are incredible. Some of the most compassionate and caring people. The care from the midwives during the birth of our baby girl was exceptional, they are so dedicated and the level of care exceeded our expectations by far. The same can be said for the theater staff. Definitely will have our next here :)

Was referred here by my GP for some tests. I was amazed at how short the wait time was in the emergency department and how caring and efficient every member of staff was towards me. I'm guessing this is how hospitals used to be...small, quiet and efficient. Thank you to all of the staff who took care of me.
Made to wait over two hours for a small child to even be looked at.  Nurse at front of emergency was extremely rude and offered no help at all.  Worse health care i have experienced

I have done my hysteroscopy here, i was bleeding for a year  so doctor told me to go for surgery i have gone for surgery and they have removed small polyps as well ,recheck i went after 2 month that time again i was bleeding for a month.whice ever doctor i met she said u wil be alright  soon ur bleeding will stop but still today my bleeding is not stopped, still no solution for my problem and i m not able to get pregnant  now i m traveling back to my own country to meet a doctor.

Wow. The staff at the emergency room were very nice and they did all they could to ease my pain. They made me smile even with pain and that helped me alot. Thanks alot for all your help Karen and Jodi the two emergency room nurses.
Looking at the beautiful memorial garden. Nice shaded space.

From emergency to the ward I could have not had better treatment
This hospital has the most caring and professional staff
Many thanks

To whom it may concern
I wish to express my deepest appreciation to all staff and gratitude for their dedication professionalism.

So once again thank you all and keep up the good work.
Mark Soove room 5.
I loved the staff all nursing and my dr Rohan his amazing they were so understanding and really cared about how I felt

My mum in this hospital great surgeon mr critchley only good thungs to say about this amazing doctor fabulous nurses welcoming staff who made mum experience in hospital so must better taking stress worry away from dad who never been away from mum in 55yrs.very professional ppl who treat all patients like there only ones there . not just number in some cases in another you get forgotten about. 10/10

Surgical & nursing staff friendly & dedicated. 
Entire experience 10 /10.

Review is for Dr Alan Gallogly who appears to filter and remove negative reviews from his RateMD page:

He wouldn’t diagnose or assess me. He thought I had severe OCD. To be fair, when I first saw him, I thought too. But isn’t that the job of a psychiatrist? To accurately (to the best of their abilities) assess and diagnose the patient’s condition BEFORE treatment? Ended up being given a medication specifically for the above but had severe side effects resulting in admission to hospital for a second time. Turned out, I didn’t have OCD at all.  This was confirmed by a clinical psychologist who has over 30 years of experience and 2 other psychiatrists. Both agreed that I didn’t suffer from it, but was itself a symptom of my Aspergers, which by the way, he doubted I had.
 
For my first appointment, he was 50 minutes late and only gave a weak apology. During that time, he did not make much effort to try to get to know me. Instead, he requested that I asked my GP to fax him a copy of a previous psychiatrist’s report and used that to get to know me instead. That report from the previous psychiatrist was 4 years old and most of it didn’t apply to me anymore during that visit. Regardless, he only questioned me for a mere 15 minutes before coming to a “diagnosis”, which turned out to be incorrect upon further consultation with other psychiatrists and clinical psychologists. 

 Throughout the many months of seeing him, including in hospital, he keeps saying he’ll “leave no stones unturned” and that I needed “intense CBT”. None of that happened, only the inpatient “psychotherapist” who talked to me about music and other non-related topics when we ran out of stuff to discuss during our sessions. Referred me to Windermere and told me to go to group when I clearly found it not helpful at all after attending dozens of sessions. Dr G didn’t do any CBT at all with me but left it to Dr Farnbach, whose one on one with me just lasted less than 5 minutes a time as he’s not my official doctor. Everytime I see him, it’s rush this rush that. There was no time to say or speak up. To be fair, it isn’t Dr Farnbach’s fault as he wasn’t my psychiatrist and volunteered to help with ERP (a type of CBT) but isn’t that the job of Dr Gallogly? Zero CBT done by Dr G as an inpatient and outpatient in the 6 or more months of seeing him.

During my 2nd hospital visit, he seemed absent minded and forgetful. So much so that he forgot to write me a script for a medication which is of heavy dependence upon my discharge. Luckily, my GP agreed to write it. Otherwise, I would have been without it for the Christmas and New Year period. Following that, in the new year, his receptionist called to cancel an upcoming appointment due to him falling sick and promised she’ll call me back to reschedule. This never happened. 

The so called psychotherapist that he recommended was expensive, offered no Medicare rebates whatsoever and conducted our session in a tiny and cramped unit, with walls as thin as paper. The placement of a single chair outside her room as a makeshift waiting area was also another concern. Anyone could hear us talking whilst sitting outside, or as a matter of fact, even in the adjacent cramped toilet.
Health treatments don't work very well
Average health care provided. Need to lift their game.

I can not believe this is a private hospital.It certainly has gone down in the last few years care is below average rooms not clean and nobody really seems to care especially to the elderly.Southeastern  use to have a good name but they have certainly let there care and cleanliness slide.

Went to the hospital for rehab after knee surgery and had a very positive experience. 
The nurses were caring and very friendly but professional and the physio staff got me moving again and provided  excellent follow up care. 
The menu and food options were very good and the food was tasty and met my needs as a gluten free diet was needed.
I will definately chose this facility again if i need to
Good hospital for a small town, looked after dad really well

Thanks to the amazing staff at Camperdown hospital for caring for both my parents through serious and challenging illnesses  within weeks of each other. I spent a lot of time there over three months. The nurses were welcoming and caring and did an outstanding job of caring for my parents. The district nurses are amazing too. Thanks I’ll never forget you.

Went in for a simple procedure on 13/4/18. From admission to discharge, the staff were absolutly lovely. Very pleasent nurses who made my short stay easier. Nothing was too much for them and they appeared to enjoy their jobs. Well done girls and Camperdown Hospital. I will be opting for this Hospital for any future procedures. Nicole Ruddle

I was in Warrnambool hospital after suffering a vertigo attack, the staff in the Emergency Department were absolutely fantastic in their treatment and the way they showed caring and patience when dealing with not only me but the other patients. I would like to give a special mention to Dr. Rob Reynolds and nurse Paije (don't know her last name ) for all their help and understanding while I was there.

I was there to visit a friend, but have nothing but high praise for South West Health care. I have been an impatient there 5 times in the past 2 years and have received first class care from a great team of Nurses and other medical staff. We are blessed to have such a wonderful Hospital in Warrnambool.

In the last 10 years, I've had to have the same surgery 6 times in 6 different hospitals, this last time in the care of Warrnambool Base Hospital was the best experience I've had in a hospital. Great facilities, staff, communication and equipment. Absolutely fantastic.

Absolutely the worst experience in the ER 
Rude, verbally abusive, uncaring, not giving correct information.
To many nurses not knowing what the hell there doing. 
To many nurses coming in and out telling you one thing and then another telling you something different absolutely unbelievable and they are so bloody stupid.
One nurse told me my boyfriend may never be able to walk again. Going off at me like it was my fault he hit his head and he could of died.
 Saying how busy they where even though they were all standing around scratching the ass and laughing in the corner being idiots. She then told my boyfriend that he shouldn’t have been in there and that there were more serious patients than him. Absolutely disgusting behaviour from a nurse.
The ER needs better nurses that know what there doing and only one nurse per patient was absolutely unbelievable on how many come in out and none of them new what they were doing.

What a wonderful establishment.   My husband required emergency bowel surgery and every aspect was handled swiftly and so professionally with the most wonderful health care.  Our thanks to all the staff.   This should be the standard on which our health care system is based.  WELL DONE WARMAMBOOL BASE HOSPITAL.

In early November 2017 I was unfortunate enough to have had a stroke. Following a number of weeks in St Vincent’s I was transferred to St George’s hospital for rehabilitation.  I was terrified but determined to get well again. The staff (Admin, Support, Nursing and the Doctors) were amazing. They helped me become comfortable and got me on my way to recovery. Everyday for months they cared, provided for my needs and worked hard to assist my recovery. Every single one of the Staff members overflowed with knowledge and kindness, and lead me to a point whereby I could speak, think and walk again sufficiently to cope on my own. They arranged for ongoing programs I could benefit from following my departure from hospital even though I was heading interstate to be with family. I owe these people a great deal of gratitude and can’t speak highly enough of their skill and commitment.  Thank you so very much. You are all genuine and caring people and deserve the very best in life for the great job you do.  
My very sincere thank you and best wishes. 
Les.

I hope people are aware that St George's Ellerslie unit or transition care place that people are talking about is actually run entirely separate from the rest of the hospital eg their medication service is actually not done internally by their own pharmacy apparently but rather contracted to external Chemist warehouse.  People's experience in that part of the hospital should not be extrapolated.

My grandma was unfortunate enough to break her arm just before Christmas last year. After 4 weeks in hospital because she couldn't move  by herself she was asked to move to St George's. Appalling service!  They didn't help her to the bathroom meaning she just went on her bed and sat it in for days before they would change the sheets. After being in there for another 4 weeks in there and a request each day for a shower they did not give her one!  Many lies about "being too busy" but when my mum and I would visit they would just be on their phones around the front desk gossiping about what they did on the weekend. This is not a hospital at all!  No help trying to help her recover strength in her arm nor getting her up and walking around like the Epworth Hospital. My grandma is a hilarious and  crazy woman who doesn't shut up, this hospital make her miserable, no more classic Greek jokes and so quiet. After 4 weeks we couldn't stand her lying there withering away anymore so we took her to our own home to take care of her... after a week of my family helping her (shower every day, help to the bathroom and proper food!) she went back to her old self in a weeks time!  A ridiculous amount of money wasted on this place for absolutely no help!

My mother was transferred to the GEM ward after being discharged from St Vincent's with an infection. She suffers from alzheimers too and had acute delirium. She also understands very little English.Although she couldn't participate in rehab due to her drowsy state, she was left bed ridden. A physio chair that had been provided was taken away and nobody knew where it was. She was left sitting in a chair all day with her feet dangling in mid air and with no foot stool. I was told this was ok by the  nurses despite my concerns .This eventually left her legs severely swollen and is now recovering by having them elevated. I had to point out the swelling because nobody seemed to notice. Eating and drinking was a nightmare and I had to attend to this myself. She only had two proper showers in the 3 weeks she was there by two lovely nurses. I don't even recall staff changing any bed linen either. Her vitals were down one night after a medical episode. The doctor decided to call me on my mobile while I'm at the hospital to tell me my mum was dying as she drove herself there but only to arrive and tell me she was OK now. Had no compassion at all and the place felt so impersonal.I still feel traumatised by this event.We need a  different system in place for those living with dementia and  suffering from other illness. The hospital system is ill equipped to deal with these specialized cases. My mother's condition went from bad to worse. I did not want her moved into their transition ward where I was told at St Vincent's will assist in her recovery. The place was narrow, small, dark and gloomy and hardly ideal for somebody with delirium to recover in. She has now moved into an aged care facility instead.

My Mother stayed at the Ellerslie unit for 12 weeks. Many of the Nursing staff and certain senior staff members lacked Compassion for Family members and Certain mature staff where extremly rude to me. Unfrotunately not a very good experience. They truly need to higher better staff and not just anyone.

name: St John of God Ballarat Hospital

reviews.text:
The worst experience in a hospital I've had... Expected better in a Private sector ,  sent home 2 days after major surgery because they close the short term wing for the weekend so don't have to get staff to cover
The Discharge Coordinator is the rudest woman,  a Bully!!
Nearly 1 yr on I'm still upset thinking about it!!!
Horrible people that only care about money. I won't give more details.
Currently taking care of my dear friend after open heart surgery. Cannot find any fault. Friendly staff. Extremely clean. Spacious rooms. Many thanks to all staff.
Day surgery today for my son. Lovely staff everywhere today from when he was admitted to discharge.  Mr Niall McConchies staff in his rooms were wonderful too!!- Thankyou all Simone☺

We had our baby there, most staff are great. The night duty staff where rude and didn't have a lot of knowledge about Babies and Breast feeding. Luckily we were with Balkarat IVF they had a say in who looked after us and tried to get us the better staff. BALLARAT IVF 12/10  the hospital are under a lot of stress and seemed like under staffed. Majority of times when I needed a nurse there was a code blue. 
I don't think nurses should be working 2 services at once. They are very busy but I think high dependency need there staff and maternity there ow  nurses.

name: St John of God Bendigo Hospital

reviews.text:
Leaves the public hospital 🏥 for dead 💀 
Great facility. 
Great people 👨  👩 
Has heated pool 🏊 
Has a gym 🏋🏼‍♀️ 
Doctors 🥼 
Hospital 🏥  🚑 🤧😷🤮💉💊🔬🛌📮☮️✝️🚭🏧🚾♿️🅿️🇦🇺
FREE INTERNET ✅🤗

My dad was undergoing treatment here for his cancer and it’s been a really positive experience for him. All the staff were exceptionally talented and kind. 
If your in need of help, this is the best local hospital.
It is the best hospital that I have ever seen. Here doctors treat the patients with love and care. I have no words to say but seriously I want to recommend this hospital to cancer patients.
Staff at this hospital treat you better than your own family they are wonderful people I would recommend them anytime
Fabulous staff looked after me. Couldn't have asked for more.

name: St John Of God Berwick Hospital

reviews.text: I had time in surgical and rehab wards. The staff on rehab were fabulous! This includes the food services staff and the wonderful physio team, as well as the nursing staff. I had afew problems on surgical ward with my physical health but the nurses did their best to sort things out for me. All in all, I would recommend this hospital for treatment.

I recently had a total hip replacement here and I can honestly say that it has been the best hospital I have stayed in.

From the phone call a week before, through admissions, the surgery and recovery it was all excellent.

The staff were very caring and wouldn’t hesitate to do that little extra to make you more comfortable.

Food was actually very good and the servings were generous.

I would definitely recommend this hospital over any of the other hospitals I have stayed in located on the city.

I had day surgery at your hospital yesterday and i would have to say that the care and attention i was given was second to none. From reception, booking in, nurses, doctors, anesthetist, orderlies everyone. I can't thank you enough. Congratulations on an exceptionally well organized hospital.

Word of advice - get a Über over here do not even bother driving. 

There is hardly any carparks here and the ones available are extremely hard to get to. 
But when you get in you'll be extremely confused getting to you doctor or specialist since almost everything in the building is either not labeled or is labeled incorrectly. 

It seems the architect forced too much on aesthetics and very little (to none at all) on functionality/practicality.
Big thank you to everyone here at hospital.The treatment and care second to none.Truly amazing thank you

name: St John of God Frankston Rehabilitation Hospital
St John of God Geelong Hospital

reviews.text: I have attended St John Of God Hospital since 2000 8 times from ED visits to Surgery and each time the staff and services provided have been first class. They are efficent, professional, caring and provide an extremely high level of care. I trust them and would recommend them to any seeking medical treatment. I just wish their ED was 24/7.

I had to go here for a MRI, and I got there early, so they started the procedure early instead of me waiting. They were so helpful and were reassuring considering I was very anxious about being in a hospital. The signage was very good, I made my way around to the imaging department easily without getting lost.
I was given confusing information, and simple operation was stuffed up. Nurse kept disappearing, hospital never followed up on me. Compared to Geelong Hospital - way substandard.

I would like to thank all the caring wonderful staff at this hospital. My mum has just stayed here and l have to say how grateful and appreciative l am to all the nurses , doctor and all who cared for my mum.  The staff really care and l couldnt have asked for better care. Thank you so much..
Caring and supportive staff with good facilities.

name: St John of God Pinelodge Clinic

reviews.text:
The first - and clearly, the best experience I have had in my life (when it came to quitting substance abuse). I was an opiate/opioid addict for 18 months, and in February 2018, I found Pinelodge. The services are top-notch, the staff go out of their way to be friendly and welcoming and the food; MY GOD, THE FOOD. Patrick, the head chef at Pinelodge... he is an artist and should receive daily back rubs and high fives for making ‘Hospital Food’ gourmet.

This centre is really for people who don’t need to be ‘spoon-fed’ or ‘coerced’ into recovery, but truly a means to find your own way. Brilliant programs, lovely people, a true community. Not for the weak willed. Anyone who does not truly have control over their cravings should consider somewhere more... strict.

I recommend this to friends and family, and anyone suffering from the terrible disease of addiction. 80 days clean today; and counting! 

25/12/2018 EDIT : 319 days clean, thanks to Pinelodge! On my first go!

Fantastic facility, was quite nervous in my first admission as I’d never been admitted before to a hospital for my mental health issues. The nurses in the Norfolk ward are nothing but respectful, gentle and genuinely caring. A lot of effort goes into planning groups and the food is magnificent. The other patients also made for great company, and it was impossible not to feel supported. Had many staff members including the front reception go above and beyond to support me whether it was with financial issues or in regards to my mental health care planning. Furthermore, I cannot rave enough about the fantastic DBT program and therapists who work at Pinelodge. This program has helped me learn more about myself, and feel the most healthy and happy that I have in many years. It saddens me to have read such negative reviews, and I can see that the hospital has gone to great lengths to improve itself, even adding in a “sensory room” in the Norfolk ward. Even during Christmas time, staff were inclusive of all patients in decorating the ward and it made what would be such a difficult time for most patients a pleasant one. Well worth your money and your time, I’m most grateful for the wonderful care and support I’ve received and I owe so much to this wonderful hospital.
Amazing food! The nurses were so lovely and respectful and the patients were amazing! Coming back for outpatient dbt program!

l can't thank Pinelodge enough from Chef,kitchen,staff,cleaner's but most of all the nurse's. Been in here a few times the nurses go out of there way to get to know you. Spend time understanding your background while your in and family.
Even when my partner came in to visit they took there time talking to her to get to know her to see if there is anything they could do to make it easier when she visited me which shows you that we are just not another patient. With out there care l wouldnt know where l would be as l continue my slow road to getting better. Special big thank you to the nurses upstairs l can't thank you enough making it feel more comfortable and relaxed during my stays making me come out of my shell.  You are fantastic at what you do. If there is a negative it is the mattress in the rooms are hard waking up during the night because of it.
Hopefully management can pass this message on to staff. 
Thank you.
Mick.

Went to the consulting suite to see Dr. Kanishka Muruththettuwegama (or Dr. Muru for short).  While he started off with a caring manner, as the session went on, he did not address any of my concerns and began dismissing my situation. Previous doctors I've seen have worked with me to find solutions but Dr. Muru did not, and I will not be going back there again.

Admin staff were lovely though.

name: St John of God Warrnambool Hospital

reviews.text:
I want to commend the dedicated care and attention I received this week from the staff - nursing, hotel services and environmental - in your hospital. Efficient and friendly, they are all to be congratulated. I can't thank them enough. 
Fiona - RM 10

My experience with this hospital is one of the best experiences. Here, the medical staff is well-trained as well as experienced. I am completely satisfied with the services that I receive from this hospital.

I can't speak highly enough about the care provided me on my last three visits to SJOG in Warrnambool.  Having experienced Melbourne hospitals in the past, it is a true delight to experience the difference this country hospital provides.  The nursing staff are truely professional at all times, and the medics provide excellent care.  Always clean, welcoming and as restful as a hospital can be.  Thank you!
My mother has just had a week in rehab at SJOG Warrnambool. The staff are to be commended for the care they give. Nat is lovely to patients at St John's as are all the nursing staff.
Good place

Absolutely outstanding hospital. The nurses and doctors are extremely knowledgeable, skilled, friendly and patient. Thank you to all the staff that have helped my husband and me over the months of surgery and treatment. We're endlessly thankful. Your expertise, kind hearts, humorous stories and open ears have made all the pain so much easier to endure. We've felt like we're in best hands and are entirely taken care of. Best hospital food, too. Highly recommended.

Great hospital. Very efficient Emergency Department. Highly trained staff throughout the hospital. Always caring with a helpful attitud and great transport options including highly effective patient transport services to all their other facilities.

I think our health system is in a pretty bad state when we have to rely on inexperienced young doctors to perform biopsies that require a very high level of skill and knowledge. Such doctors should not be allowed to perform complex procedures until they have mastered simpler procedures and have learnt all they can from an experienced person.

Dear Receptionist,

You all are there to help people and not just keep transferring the call, as you want to get rid of the person.

Has been calling 5 times to book myself for Harmony test and been transferred to atleast 8 people who have never heard of the test.

I had a receptionist telling me "What the hell is that" when i asked to transfer to correct department for the harmony test.

The other big joke was i told them "i had done my ultrasound at the Private Hospital underground, the lady tells me its been closed down for ages,like seriously i did the test few weeks before.

The people who call you might not know the exact department and all.You are there to help them.

Best hospital , Thanks to doctors of St Vincent hospital for giving me new life. I admitted to the hospital on 9th March 2019 with serous condition in my stomach. Doctors and nurses cared me well with medicine. Everyone is responsible here. Food given by kichen staff is well prepared and served. Hospital is neat and clean. So again I wana thanks to everyone working hand here.

name: St Vincent's Private Hospital, Melbourne ,East Melbourne

reviews.text:
I found this hospital to be better than good. All the staff that I encountered from reception, to nursing. to theater staff were communicative and cheerful and efficient. 
When I needed pain relief the nurse responded quite quickly. That's all one needs.
My room was very pleasant with a window to see the sky. 
I can't comment on the food because my stay was short, my operation was late and I was fasting for the anesthetic, but if you are particular about food there is a really good cafe on the ground floor where I was able to have a first class coffee and croissant while waiting to be picked up.

Thank you to the maternity ward at st vincents private for supporting us on the 2nd birth of our Child. Thanking in particular Eileen alexander and Scottish Girl Katie.. thank you beautiful ladies for your care and support

I stayed here overnight. The food was really bad, I was asked to fill out a breakfast menu for the next day before my surgery, and next morning a staff member quickly came and said you have not filled a breakfast menu so you are getting a standard breakfast menu. Before I manage to say something she left the tray. The dinner roll was stale and the only think I could it was the cornflakes. The dinner was bland and tasteless.
For the money you pay you’d expect edible food.

I went on for some major gynecological surgery on the 30th May. From the wonderful nurses and staff in the admissions ward right through to the staff in the recovery area, I have nothing but high praise.

I was quite sick on the first night, but the night nurses were wonderful despite having to be woken hourly for observation. I love how the newer nurses are encouraged to do procedures under the watchful eye of the more experienced nurses. I had catheters inserted and removed along with gynecological packing and I never felt any terrible pain or discomfort.

On the second night, I got two nurses who I refer to as the "ninja nurses" because they were so quiet and efficient. Hot packs for my back pain were supplied due to my bad experience with morphine. The nursing staff are all tidy, efficient and friendly.

The food was OK, but I wasn't expecting gourmet.  The staff who deliver it are cheerful. Even the cleaners were friendly.

I never had a single person just barge into my room. Everyone knocks and waits until you say it's OK to come in. 

Sometimes you get what you pay for. This is one of those instances. It was worth having private health cover to get such excellent service.

Such a great hospital. I came over from NZ & had explant surgery here last thursday & spent 1 night. It was a really nice experience. I had such lovely nurses looking after me & i felt so comfortable here. I had a city view from my window which was nice to look out & see the lights. Food was nice. Cant fault the service here, it was fabulous.

If you ever need to visit a hospital for surgery this is the one you want to go to. Friendly staff fantastic nurses and everyone just wants to assist you. I had my own room which was extremely comfortable and they made my scary operation enjoyable.
St. Vincents is actually a really good hospital, but in regards to one of the staff members that work there changed my mind. This staff member acted very UNPROFESSIONAL and very RUDE.

Lift situation intolerable. 1 lift out of action leaving 2 lifts for public & patients. About a 30min journey through time to get from ground to level 5, managing a toddler & baby. I didn't mind being asked to leave for a patient, but I did mind being left for a long time outside ICU with a code grey around the corner (irate person audible) & no stair access. Staff apologetic re pt priority & no public stairs, & said they would have to escort us if there was a fire. Standing with my 2 young boys & husband (approx 13 of us in total waiting outside ICU), I did not feel our safety was a priority for St Vincents Private.

I had to use a toilet and check my wound as it was a bit painful,I just had a major surgery and got discharged a day ago.While I was in there this staff named 'Selvie' comes up to my husband waiting outside the toilet for me and VERY RUDELY tells him we are not suppose to use that toilet.
That particular toilet had a sign 'unisex' and 'staff' on written on it and it is located near a lift easy accessible to anyone.
My husband didn't fuss about it but did found it very offending and embarrassing. 
This person could have been a bit more considered and not so rude with so much attitude.
After all its a 'private hospital' and we don't pay thousands of dollars to be treated like this! St Vincent private needs talk to this staff member as her attitude was absolutely  appalling.
Felt like at home,nurses were absolutely beautiful and looked after me as best as they could.
Nice little hospital with friendly and helpful staff. Felt well supported and looked after. It is small so there is no cafe or pharmacy etc.

Less than impressed with the care provided at this hospital. The nurses were unprofessional, inattentive and left my partner in 8/10 pain for hours and did not listen to his concerns. He was back on the ward by 10.30 post op and they didn't even order him lunch, he had to ask 3 times for sandwiches as all they gave him was dry crackers. Eventually got the sandwiches 3 hours post-op. The hospital is old and run down. The food wasn't great. The pm nurse left her shift without even handing over to the night duty. My partner waited for over 30 minutes with his buzzer going to just get a drink of water and a urine container. Absolutely shocking, as a registered nurse myself I am appalled that this facility is even still in business. Private healthcare they say, I know for a fact he would have been 10x better off in the public sector. At least they have DRs on site.

So far so good! Sitting waiting for my son to appear from surgery. Despite the renovations and the check in as busy as can be, the staff were on top of it all, prompt as possible and I did not feel at any time that we did not know what was going to happen next so communication was great. Jenny, anaesthetic nurse, check in and all we met so far wonderful. Guest wifi works well. Not sure if there is a caf for waiting family however lobby has wifi, TV, coffee machine and has just had a good reno so looks clean and as comfy as you would expect a hospital could be. Hopefully the recovery and home care communication will be just as good. Thanks St V's Kew for looking after my 23 year old baby boy!
Staff may be OK but Communication was appalling. Felt like the Invisible Man.
Small and cozy! The nurses made my experience a lot easier and nicer. Lovely staff and very patient!

My wife had a surgery on the 5th of March and everyone in the hospital were wonderful.Starting from the reception to the aftercare nurses they were very caring and friendly.And as we were trying to leave our car battery was dead,but the wonderful nurse that was with my wife(sorry can't remember the name) arranged  one of the service staff members to come and jump start our car for us.The next day my wife received a call from the hospital to check up on how she was doing.Overall from  doctors to everyone else in the hospital we are very grateful.Thank you.

I could not have asked for a better team than theirs during the critical time of my life. My husband and I felt well looked after and the service was excellent in the emergency section. Keep up the amazing work that you all do!
$50 fee for seeing doctor at Emergency
Fabulous, friendly, efficient and caring staff. If you have a choice of hospitals, choose these guys.

Hospital run by registrars and few people with very high experience. Having a nightmarish encounter where my baby girl was kept for more than a week for an infection that her body could naturally fight. She was stabbed many times by inexperienced staff who couldn’t find her nerve before they had to bring the senior  Consulant. If you have the extra money, use it for private health. Don’t go public because they use you or your baby as if you are a lab rat to train fresh out of uni graduates.

Had a colonoscopy done at Sunshine hospital. Amazing service and care given by one and all right from the time of admission to discharge.  Truly appreciate  all the good work and the dedication. God bless you all for your service.
I dont know why some u not happy well still hospital great compare in your country. These staff there amazing they go extra miles to help patient. Thank you all.

I would have preferred to give this hospital zero stars, I have a family member currently in this hospital and the treatment of patients needs to be investigated.  The nurses DO NOT follow instructions from the doctors, 2 days ago a port was suppose to be removed, we are now in the third day and still the port has not been removed.  Drugs are dispensed like a candy store, the elderly are being neglected by the nurses and rough handled, they did a Royal commission on aged care, they also need to do one in hospitals, communication is a failure, nurses not doing what they have been asked to do,  they would spend more time on there phones then assisting patients.....there will be a lot more deaths in this hospital if they are not overhauled......what a disgraceful hospital, don't put your family or friends in there, until this hospital has been investigated!

Emergency peadiatrics are absolutely amazing here. Been a few times with my kids and I have to say, they have been amazing every time. Most recently my 1year old had a croup/asthma attack. They entertained her and settled her while she was in distress. They made her feel so comfortable and welcome she didn’t want to leave. Super professional and genuine care for the children.

name: Swan Hill District Health - Aged Care Facility

reviews.text: Great servic

Passing through lovely Swan Hill on a road trip when my husband needed treatment for a reasonably minor but very uncomfortable issue with the skin on his back.  He visited their emergency unit in the morning and was assessed, operated on and out by 5pm same day.  Lovely, caring staff ... very grateful for their care and attention.

This is an organisation with some very lovely staff as well as some very rude and disrespectful staff. I have had yet another very disappointing experience in this hospital and it is just not good enough.

The staff are obliging and helpful. Doctors in most places seem to have difficulty getting past the fact that most (most people) people present for good  reasons and aren't making anything up, and tend to dismiss things out of hand to readily. But the care is good, staff is pleasant.
As Deb said they seriously need to lift their game.
Absolutely disgraced with the disrespectful behaviours of the staff at the emergency department

I ended up in the ED at the Alfred and spent a night in the Short Stay Unit. The ED was busy but I did not have to wait too long for a bed, review by a Doctor(s) or the tests I had. I was kept well informed at all times and every single Nurse I encountered in my almost 24 hour stay was wonderful. I also had a great pair of paramedics in my initial assessment who made me feel as calm as possible in my first ambulance ride. It is beyond me why anyone would abuse Paramedics,  Doctors or Nurses. I am supremely grateful for the medical and general care I received.

Thank you to the paramedics, the nurses and doctors attending me and saving me from great distress. I felt safe, respected and very cared for. Relatives phoning from interstate also were glowing in their reports of the friendly accessible staff. They hadn't expected that from a huge Melbourne hospital. Thank you so much.

I had a complex infection, ended up in 3 wards, 2 major operations and was there for 2 months. The staff were respectful and always made me comfortable and they saved my life. However the follow. up post op appointments where completely unprofessional and disorganized.

Not overly impressed with my experience in ED. Was openly told there were no beds and was asked why i had gone to hospital that day in a tone that was unwelcoming. I had attended on advice of GP after pneumonia diagnosis. Was sent home only to end up back at a GP on a Sunday getting an emergency drip of anti biotics, something the Alfred told me I didn't need. GP was horrified when I repeated the experience.
First time going into the ED, friendly and helpful staffs. Doesn’t have to wait long, given the right care and respect. The Alfred hospital deserves the 5 stars! Well done!

One of the best service ever
I did stay for one day and the team was great

From Reception to Recovery room, i found everyone to be Very lovely, friendly and Professional staff.
I highly recommend this Hospital, and I would like to extend a Big "Thank You" to my Recovery Nurse 'Cass' or 'Kass', who was absolutely wonderful on Tuesday Afternoon 27th Nov.

An excellent hospital run by well trained staff with excellent skills,and all tasks carried out always with the welfare of patientsforemist in their minds.
My third visit .No hesitation to n reckon mending your hospital.

Good morning .could you please pass onto the right department.. I just left my visit there.Firstly Mr David Sheppard he was my surgeon and I can't believe how comfortable i felt when he was telling me what to expect being my 1st surgery. He was nothing short of brilliant in all aspects . Then there are the nurses who looked after me. Di looked after me in the afternoon and she explained in detail what I had to do and she was so pleasant to talk to. My fiance is a personal carer for the elderly and even she said how lovely she was. Also to Emma who looked after me in the morning along with her student but I didn't get her name. I honestly felt like i wasnt even in hospital but a hotel  the room was super clean and for my 1st experience in a hospital was so awesome, not that I'm hoping to return 😂 once again thank you too all that helped me ohhh and a big shout out to the kitchen that food was unbelievably good. Certainly not hospital quality but way above. I will be sharing my experience with everyone.  Kind regards Robert Smith
The nurse are absolutely amazing, The facility is beautiful and the food is pretty good. Cant ask for a better hospital!
Best hospital friendly staff always make you feel comfortable high recommend

Had a relative there 18 months ago--------excellent she is back there March 2018,  would recomend.

Sadly our mother past away at 92, staff were just fabulous in every respect, [including understanding and support for the family]

Self funded paid in full over 3grand for nasal surgery and they tried to rip me off twice, first time they tried to charge me for an overnight stay even though I was in for a day surgery and left during the afternoon then they send me a invoice in the mail 2months later asking for $144 for Nose packing used during surgery...how dumb do you have to be to not include that in the estimate, every nose surgery has dressing and packing, I even looked up the brand of nose packing and it was only $30 to buy online. I will not be recommending this place to my social media follows and friends at all

I was recently in the "Coolart" wing of the Bays. Wow. Nice modern clean room. The staff were excellent. I had 4 nurses look after me during my stay. Lovely friendly knowledgeable staff. The check in/out staff were efficient and friendly. Well done.

I found myself unexpectedly in high care before Christmas, and in hospital for Christmas itself, during this time the staff were excellent, polite, and accommodating, when I was transferred to a ward room I found it to be clean and spacious and the same level of care continued.

Waited 7 hours to be admitted from the emergency department. Crazy that still happens in a new "world class" hospital. The food is all round terrible, even from the cafe, they desperately need a proper, half decent, food court. However one thing I can't complain about is the staff. They were amazing.

Have been suicidal lately and called ahead of time. Was told that Ballarat was advised as that is our region but as that’s an extra half an hour away we insisted and he said that’s fine I’ll let triage know your coming. When we got there. He said there’s absolutely nothing they can do and that I’d have to go to Ballarat. If they had said that in the phone call we wouldn’t have driven and hour for nothing. The man we spoke to was very stern and if my mother wasn’t there I probably would’ve cried as he spoke very definite and kind of rude. Would not recommend going here if you are suicidal....

Thank you to Dr Prakash and all the amazing midwives in the birth suites and women's ward for bringing my beautiful baby girl into this world safely and for the exceptional care we received whilst in hospital.

Mother waited 4 hours for service while while bleeding on the floor in emergency.

Another time I went in with a child in an emergency, there was no staff at the desk for 20 minutes and a long line started to form as no one was being served.

Great grandma went in during life threatening emergency, took many hours to get any attention.

Apathy and lethargy is the definition of that emergency room.

Everyone past that was fine like doctors ect.
Been at ed for 5 hours with my little bub and still havent been seen. Great job. He is really sick. But ya know..blood nose fixed in 3 minutes is much more important

Called Dr Monique Mason at the clinic in a severe  mental state and all i can say is I'm shocked of my treatment by receptionist Kelly. 
I was not copping and in a hysterical time when she stated she couldnt hear me and hung up on me. I called back and no answer. Had to leave a message begging for help. 

Went to my GP. He called asking to speak to the Dr regarding my state. Kelly was rude and was even telling my GP what i needed. I think my gp who looks after me would know what i would need more than a receptionist who does not know me or is a qualified Dr. 

My GP is now finding me somewhere else to go. Some where more supportive to those with mental health issues and are asking for help. 

This behavior is disgusting!!
Fantastic place for people in need of support through the tougher times in life. Times that you can't deal with on your own. Great nurses,good food 👍😀
Helpful, considerate and respectful

MORE Staff are needed. Feels like there trying to make money not help people at times. Also they do somethings in an odd way that is counter productive to the persons individual needs. If they had MORE staff I am sure this and other things here would change. I don't want to use the word Neglect but I don't know a better word to describe how some of the patients feel.
McKellar Centre is amazing!  Ultrasounds are quick and easy. Rehabilitation and physiotherapy team are great, and the Prosthetists are amazing.
Friendly staff, car parking facility and fast service
Absolutely beautiful place, staff are great and so friendly, care is better than best
It's an excellent facility.  I will write more when I have more time

I put in a bad review on my last admission  staying in unit one. This admission I was in unit four, nice room attentive staff. All nurses cared for me on a regular basis and seemed genuinely concerned for my wellbeing. Thankyou from the bottom of my heart.

I could only assume the unit manager makes all the difference.

Have been trying to chase up my submitted  referral to Dr Astma Tomar twice now, with no regards what’s so ever. Could have seen another by now, especially in the case that this is so vital in regards to mental health. Not good enough. Would recommend to try ANYWHERE else.

1 star is a bit too much for the level of service I've received; I've submitted my referral to the clinic for Dr. Taylor on the 31st of January 2019. I've been chasing them by emails and phones until they have contacted my wife (which is a breach of privacy) on the 6th of March 2019. I had to call back cause my wife actually wasn't aware  of the whole situation when they have called her. when I called they have informed me that the first appointment is in July!!!!  that's the lowest level of clinical service that I've ever seen. I think if anyone is concerned about himself or his privacy he shouldn't go there.

Avoid Dr Joel King. Treated me with contempt and a condescending, presumptuous attitude. Felt more like he was the headmaster/principal and I'm the helpless student.

He never bothered to listen to me, always jumping to conclusions. Became impatient when I forgot what he said, only after once and rushed me to exit his room even though I needed him to repeat what he told me as it concerned important medication info. He knew I had memory problems, but still chose his pride above all else.

Never, ever again.

Whilst volunteering for a clinical trial I had three months of my time wasted and although eligible, I was never screened as the clinical staff were so inept that I was asked the same question 3 times on 3 separate occasions by two different staff. Perhaps taking notes and reading them may serve you well. I put my treatment on hold whilst waiting for this trial, to my absolute detriment. As one gets older it becomes so obvious when people 'have a job' or 'have a vocation'.

Horrible place.  Staff miserable sad atmosphere. Dad is now in nursing home much nicer friendly environment. At least now he gets a shower. They sent him to nursing home with a female patients clothing items and with none of his medication. Can't believe this is the level of care for our elderly.
Pleasent experience with staff and my Grandma seemed to be happy with the conditions. Very clean.

Totally disgusting hospital, that places no emphasis on patient care. I don't understand how this facility is allowed to operate at such a low standard!!!! If you have experienced the sub standard treatment from this facility, you need to lodge a complaint, it's the only way they will ever be held accountable, and forced to raise the standard of care.
My friend was in this mornington center they cared for her beautifully.  She is now home and going on leaps and bounds. Her name is Liane  from drouin .

Do not send your elderly relatives here! My dad does not always get  put on the toilet (depending on staff) as he is told to ‘go in his nappy instead!’ and is often left sitting in faeces and urine for long amounts of time afterwards. His cholostomy bag has now exploded THREE times because it was not being checked and this last time he was left sitting in his exploded poo for over half an hour and it was only cleaned up after my sister went looking for staff as his buzzer is ignored. The food is definitely not anything to write home about and is completely wrong more often than not. The usual physio staff are great but my dad has had a fill in one a few times now who just flat out refuses to give him physio! No reason. And no one can tell us a reason as it has been asked. No wonder my dad begs to come home every night - if this is how he’s treated while his relatives are there I don’t even want to think what might go on when we’re not there!!!!!!
