I recently spent 2 nights at the Northern in the cardiology ward. I can say that from the moment I entered the Emergency ward, being admitted and then discharged from Unit D the care was amazing. All members of staff from Ward assistants to the medical team were brilliant. While I was at Northern a number of nursing students were on rounds in the ward. The support ,guidance  and "bedside  manner training" they received from the nurses was encouraging. Keep it up Northern.

I don't know about anybody else but they were really great with me. I went there after a car accident with severe back pain. They did everything that they could for me. Their staff was very kind and thoughtful.  I really appreciated it.

Worse hospital ever! Have given them the benefit of the doubt 3x now. We were initially in for a cardiac procedure- 3 different nurses asked if we were here for a different procedure. Took several people to complete our administration form as staff kept getting called away. Despite questioning the doses nurses were giving, we were still given 4x higher dose for blood pressure medication than required. Have had two follow up appointments since the initial procedure here and they overbook resulting in ridiculous waiting times for a 5 min appointment! We have a 4 hour drive one-way to get here and our initial cardiac problem has not been resolved. Will have to find a new hospital as this cannot go on.

Very poorly treated pain management for severe trauma injury.  Did not listen to me, the patient, left me in pain for long periods.  Hospital should be audited for quality and safety, as other aspects were lacking as well (IV hygiene).

Over 7 hrs, mom still waiting for a bed. Absolutely appalling. She is a weak old lady but apperently staff cant do anything because they dont have enough beds. Third world coutires provide better care than this for their patients. Staff is very caring, hence the one star. But management needs to act fast to keep up with the current demand.

I have only been here less than 24 hours into at least a very long stay to be re habilitated. Already the food is far superior to a stay in a Private Hospital where I spent 21 long days.

The care also is superior with attitude I had mostly NOT experienced since my accident. They really do care, most of them. 

Centre though old is very clean with modern equipment.  So far so good. Keep up the good work.

Second day, even more caring nurses helping. 

Night staff are men mostly,  ultra careful with quick response to the call button. I must mention night nurses Christopher, Grace, Tracey, Julian and Debbie who are outstanding in their overall approach  putting the patient first at every turn.... Well done to all.

Regarding night staff as days move along.. One staff member needs to give attention to interpersonal relations with grim uninviting presence, poor body language, almost refusal to assist in and out of bed. Frightening when one is dependant entirely on help.  A bad experience amongst mostly good ones.

Again as the days pass I find a small percentage of nurses just don't measure up to the basic needs a patient expects.  Call bell can go unanswered for anything up to half an hour... NOT GOOD ENOUGH. Under staffing is evident causing lag in responding to call button. 

Janette,  as Isabella stated you are a good nurse BUT your unpleasant and sometimes rude body language leaves much to be desired. You need to lift your attitude towards all.

My father in law is in West ward waiting on a transition to a nursing home. I cannot fault the staff here. My father in law is clean, shaved and has his hair combed. The meals are served in a way that he can eat them and he is eating everything that he is given. Any questions I have asked are answered in a friendly manner and despite the fact that the nurses are run off their feet, they always take time to talk to us. There are posts here complaining about the staff. The ratios in nursing facilities are very low and yet the nurses and staff deal with some of the most high needs patients in any hospital setting. Before anyone criticizes the staff, remember that there is only 3 or 4 of them working in the whole ward and trying to be all things to all people. I think they do a bloody amazing job all things considered.  

The facility itself is quite old, but it is clean and does not have the smell you often find in nursing facilities. The residents seem happy enough and the staff are neatly presented. 

The food is typical hospital food, but my father in law needs his food served in a particular way (pureed) and it seems nutritious. His breakfast today was porridge, fruit and orange juice. They have morning and afternoon tea along with their main meals. 

The residents are treated with respect. My father in law certainly has no complaints.

With the exception of one night nurse, my mother was well treated by all the staff.  The food was well below standard, but that’s probably similar to other places that use the cook-chill system.  Something should be done about the ants that often crawled around, and even made their way to the patient table.

Honestly, the aged care psych unit is absolutely the saddest setting I have ever seen. I cannot describe it without disrespecting the patients, so I won't. The Medical Doctors and Psychiatrists are amazing, it's the attitude of the nurses that broke my heart.
I will be picking up my father in 1 hour and 8 minutes after he has been here 48 - if you have a family member here; there are other options.
Good people. Nice company. Only here 3 days, so far doing ok. Started physio today -5 new bed moves.

name: The Royal Victorian Eye and Ear Hospital - Emergency Department

reviews.text: Assigned as urgent and priority patient. Waited for 6 hours,  After 6 hours, we inquired when our turn would come. The medical receptionist assured us that we would be 'next'. Another 5-6 patients passed before us, patients who had waited for a much shorter timeframe. So much for 'urgent' and 'priority'. We ended up leaving without seeing a doctor, because we were so exhausted. The medical receptionist just suggested we come back the next day. Thank you, Madam.

Absurdly protracted wait times in Emergency. Arrived with an 84-year-old patient at 2.45am on a Tuesday. On a previous occasion we had experienced a sweltering and tortuous 7.5-hour wait in this Emergency department before seeing a doctor. On today's occasion, there were four other patients waiting in Emergency on our arrival, and clearly they had been waiting for quite some time. An elderly woman complained that she had been there for six hours without being seen by a doctor. The poor lady was clearly in distress. Even assuming there was only one doctor on board, one would think it possible to process at least two patients in an hour, not zero patients in six hours!  There would have to be serious inefficiencies in play.  It doesn't help that the triage staff are indifferent and don't demonstrate any compassion to patients. The Octogenarian and I abandoned Emergency at 4.20am without being seen by a doctor; the prospect of a painful wait exceeding 6 hours was too much for the patient. One wonders whether the hospital bothers to log and report how many patients abandon the wait - which means potentially serious conditions simply not being addressed.

Could not have been happier with my 24 hours at this hospital for my ear operation. The staff were courteous, highly professional and efficient. I was told the surgeon didn't like to keep patients waiting - a bonus for patients and no doubt the surgeon's bank balance.

My post operation care was exemplary and the food better than expected. We are so blessed in this country to have care like this covered by Medicare, not to mention highly skilled doctors and nurses who are leaders in their field worldwide.

That said. I am sorry people going to emergency at the E and E do not have a better experience but surely the long waits are because of inadequate government  funding rather than the hospital itself? Seems all Victorian hospitals are understaffed in emergency - let's hope the government can address that, as it really is unacceptable to wait so long.

Grateful we have a place like this in Australia. Exceptional staff. I came in at just before 8am and no line for the nurse in the reception. 2 hours and 50 mins later got my ear treated, not too bad!

Good advice, definitely come early because later they'll be long lines. Was up to like 15 people an hour later. Come early, bring a book, sit back and relax and before you know it you'll be walking out feeling so much better

I had a fantastic patient experience at the Eye & Ear Hospital this afternoon. The staff at the front desk were efficient and the Senior Nurse that assessed me was very caring and thorough in her examination. I was most impressed by Dr Tasfia Saief as she was extremely thorough in her examination and treatment of my ailment. She was also very knowledgeable and explained everything in such a succinct manner. I left the hospital with a sense of gratitude. The medical staff that work in this hospital are wonderful people.

By far the worst  psychiatric hospital l I have stayed at, from seeing mice running into the kitchen at night, to having ants in the bathroom even the toilet paper. I was in a wheelchair, I checked in to this clinic to accept my illness, I was told by the intake at the hospital that it was wheelchair friendly, and it wasn’t at all. The nurse in charge said to me, “ why don’t you get up and walk” I clearly couldn’t. Then the Unit nurse manager wanted me to walk 20 steps into a linked hospital building that was not wheelchair friendly, again that was impossible for me. This created an unsafe environment for me, when the staff would argue rather reach a solution and the unit manager didn’t even have the manners and professionalism to address my concerns to me personally it was clear leaving was my only option. On top on that, I had a psychiatrist That did not speak very good English and handed out way too much sleepers and Valium. The Food was disgusting and I had been at Victoria Clinic for two weeks and had not seen one psychologist. The staff pushed for me to walk far to quick without professional  physiotherapy advice that knew about my condition. Nurses did a psychologist role was, not giving you sound advice or therapy, this lead me Leaving the hospital with wounds inflicted by stress from hospital staff and Management. The physical aspect of the Victoria Clinic was falling apart and very old and run down. The wifi would always drop out and TVs would not work or have all the channels. I pay a lot of money for private health insurance a month, Victoria Clinic wasn’t worth one penny. Don’t be fooled. Beware of fake low grade private clinics.

Surely it can't be a co-incidence that every psychiatric hospital in Melbourne has mostly terrible reviews. They took great care of my daughter,  but obviously they have a lot of very stressed and disturbed people- I saw one woman viciously demand a medication that she was not due to have at the time. I'm not calling anyone a liar. I would just like to ask people to use their discretion when reading some of the one star reviews.
It does not surprise me that most Mental Health Hospitals have bad reviews, think about it..

If you weren't crazy when you came here then the nurses will drive you crazy by the time you leave. There are 1 or 2 who are good at their jobs but the rest are so woefully inept its surprising they are allowed to work at all.

The nurses treat you like a burden instead of treating you like someone who is trying to get help for medical issues. They are rude and treat you like children. It's like they don't get any Mental Health training at all.

Don't send the elderly there. 
A qualified doctor a geriatrician..who specialises in the elderly..
This elderly person. Independent from home walked into rehab from a private hospital where this same geriatrician treated the elderly patient .
.after a few days at rehab  family were all expressing concerns of the patient rapidly deteriorating.. Issues ranging From constipation..blood in vomit. Stopped eating. walking. Not able to feed himself.. And now incontinent ..He went from independant to full nursing care..We were constantly told by the doctor its the medications and he looks comfortable.. He looks comfortable ..that was always the statement.
Despite swollen feet where shoes wouldn't fit a sign of lyrics ..still the dose was increased..
2 days before discharge family were informed patient needs a nursing home and has to go home as his private insurance has run out...private insurance States no one gets kicked out from care.. By then it was too late ..I suppose the Dr had kpi..
Again family expressed rapid deterioration of the patient..1 day prior  to discharge.
The patient was sent to monash emergency ...
There he was found to be dehydrated..constipated.. Needed a speech review..and investigations were finally done...he was Diagnosed with a stroke which confirmed what family had been saying ....the patient died of septisemia 3 days later...
 all people are entitled to medical care...
This elderly person was independent before rehab.
He only went to rehab because he was home alone. And that same Dr recommended it..
Monash staff listened and investigated.
How can a stroke and septicemia be classified as he looks comfortable.. 
The outcome may not have changed . but at least send anyone deteriorating into hospital...
But the room and food looked great...

Lovely room with sun in the afternoon.  Food very nice.  Staff so caring. All in all will enjoy my rehab here.

August 16. I am home now,  great to be able to regain independence. I was told Vic rehab would get in touch soon after discharge (19 July) for out patient rehab
Didn't  happen so rang DONVALE Rehab who accepted me for as long as need be. 

A disappointment Victorian Rehab.  did not follow up as anticipated.
Great Pain management  course and great  lstaff very helpful

I had no idea what to expect when it was recommended that I come to  this Centre after heart bypass surgery.  I was pleasantly surprised by the modern facility, relaxed atmosphere and above all the rehab doctor and nurses caring for me.  Knowing medical assistance is at hand and at the same time given opportunity for rest and exercise I believe my recovery has been given a boost by being here.   All staff have been friendly and thorough. I am pleased the opportunity to stay here was available to me.

A great place.   All staff; doctor, nurses, physios and allied health were very friendly, efficient and encouraging. The accommodation is comfortable and attractive, meals good and easily changed if necessary.  Very important that staff ensured that it was as quiet at night as possible. Recommended if you have a choice of where to go for rehab.

Was good being there to help me get both my boys to settle and sleep in their own room still a struggle but I can manage more it takes 4-6wks to regulate our new routines that have been set in place so if I stick to what I've learnt we should be good. The staff are great helping understand my boys needs as they are different ages, and to be patient with my 2year old and his tantrums, honestly don't see why there is negative reviews as you get what you put in you don't just go and the staff magically help your kid. Put in the effort and listen to information that's given and stick with it when you go home, not there for babysitting or the food don't like it get someone in to support you and order food if you don't like what's given.  I liked my experience wish I didn't have to come home.

We took our soon to be 1 year old there in March 2018, as I was struggling with his sleep and I was about to go back to work from maternity leave. I was a pretty tired mum to a baby that kept waking up at night several times, cried loudly when we put him in bed and wanted to be breastfed in the middle of the night. It’s been almost a year since we were at Tweddle day and night for a week. It wasn’t an easy week but my son has slept through the night for more than 11 hours straight since then, with a 1-2 hours nap after lunch time at 23 months. His mood changed, no more tired baby and grumpy tired mum :) 

The girls at Tweddle are fantastic, helpful, knowledgeable and will give you tips that last a lifetime. What a life changing experience for me an my husband to have taken our little one there! I hope I haven’t forgotten what you girls taught me because I’m about to have another baby soon. I also recommend to bring your own lunch and dinner as the food is not good. But hey people don’t go there for food but for help with sleeping routines and behavioral issues.

I was referred to Tweddle from my MCHN for issues with my four month old catnapping during the daytime. 

Following an extensive phone consultation with Susan, I was approved for an in-home visit (Tweddle is bulk-billed so additional benefit for the hip pocket).  

Due to flexibility with my schedule, I was able to pick up a last minute cancellation and had Christine come out to our home.  

We went through a standard settling process and she offered suggestions throughout the process - always very emotionally intelligent and not intrusive at all.  After struggling through the settling process, Christine offered to assist and I said yes - she had our baby asleep in no time!  

Once settled, we went into another room to discuss the exercise - she shared her observations with us about our baby (eg. she noticed that if she couldn't see our faces, she became more agitated and therefore suggested we don't try and settle by placing her over our shoulder, and showed us a few alternative positions).  Being an in-home visit, we also benefitted greatly as her observations about the sleep environment have greatly contributed to our baby now self-settling (eg. positioning of the bassinet, darkness of the room, introduction of a white noise machine).  

Christine went on to talk through any of our concerns and gave us suggestions on how to overcome these, as well as talking through with us the theory behind Tweddle's approach. She was realistic and also gave us some "plan B" strategies for the transition period which helped as these changes don't occur overnight.  

Since her visit, the transformation has been overwhelming.  Baby now happily goes down for her naps during the daytime, sleeps overnight and is self-settling.  Further, if she is woken up during any of her sleeps, we now have the confidence in how to resettle her.  

Tweddle's approach aligned well with our approach to parenting, and not using the controlled crying method meant that we both felt comfortable with our new approach to baby's sleep.  We had a follow up call a few days later to check in, and had a follow up visit scheduled in a few weeks later, which we ended up declining as our baby took to the new routine and approach so well.  The team at Tweddle were incredibly supportive and available during the course of the process.  

We can't thank Tweddle enough for their help and support, and would recommend them highly for any parent with sleep issues.

Were fantastic with my family. I laugh now, when I look back and realise as a first time mum I had no idea. I thought I did. Totally recommend it and don't be scared to ask for help, cause one day you will hopefully be like me and be able to look back and laugh.
Wonderful supportive staff. Glad there is a program like this to help when things get on top of us.
Excellent well and truly looked after by all the staff thank you all

At approx 0800 hours on 26/03/19 I attended at the Geelong ED in immense pain mainly from a migraine headache from hell. I reported this to the triage nurse, also the fact that my blood pressure was over 180/120 and consistently so. There was also the possibility this related to a work place injury where last week I was assaulted and copped a knee to the ribs causing at least bruised ribs and a blow to the head. I reported this to the male nurse. The nurse displayed no empathy, no compassion and blew me off to the next window where the same level of service continued, merely ticking the boxes until I was told to wait in the waiting room. Now I am not sure if the person reading this has ever suffered from a migraine but I can tell you that the noise in the waiting room especially with the construction was going on was like torture. I approached after approx an hour of waiting the blonde haired nurse at triage, asking if there was somewhere quieter I could wait. She said no, nil compassion, nil empathy and like all the other staff at the ED window that morning blew me off. I also asked approx how long and was told I was next. I managed to wait another 45 minutes before it became to much, the pain unbearable and then approached the admin staff to inform them I was going. She wanted me to wait in line to speak to the triage nurse. I said no, I am leaving. I walked in severe pain to St John of God ED where I received prompt service, compassion, a great level of care and was through getting treatment within a very short time. I have had pleasant experiences at Geelong Hospital before but unfortunately some terrible ones too and yesterday was a disgrace. I am pretty sure none of those staff adhered to your organisations values yesterday. And just for the record I did not expect preferential treatment, merely a quieter place I could sit and wait. Knowing quite well the lay out of your ED there were plenty of places, but obviously too hard for the blonde female triage nurse.

This is for the ACCESS team not the hospital. 
I called today, all I mentioned was my name and tried to tell them what I was calling for. I was cut off and redirected to an unmanned line. That line said to leave my number and they’ll call back asap. That was 2:30pm. It’s now 11:25pm. I’m still waiting. And still in crisis which I haven’t had help with thanks to these people over the past month. I’m getting worse and worse. I thought that they were mental health professionals. They are not. Get rid of ACCESS. They clearly don’t know how to treat patients with an acute mental illness and is highly stigmatised and judgemental. Let the frontline people you speak to be psychiatrists or psychologists.
Most disgusting place please if you need operation do not go here always mistakes that wreck your life.  They do not know how to operate

Tonight, l feared an elderly family member was missing and l rang the Hospital. Both the lady who initially answered, and Katrina in Emergency ( Outpatients?)treated my concerns with the utmost respect and empathy. Also, when l found him later and rang back to thank them, Liz was very polite and helpful too. Thank- you all.

The staff were uniformly excellent from my pre-op nurse, anesthetic nurse to recovery. In recovery I was well attended with kindness and warmth. Observing how other patients were treated I am not unique, all the other patients were well looked after. Once recovered I was offered a sandwich and a coffee, both good and very welcome.

Wonderful caring staff, exceptional facilities, prompt processing, can not thank them enough for taking great care of my daughter today.
Dr Lisa Wun is fabulous, thank you

My son Max had surgery at your hospital and I now wouldn't go anywhere else. The care he received was way above and beyond both what I was expecting and the care we have ever received in any other hospital. ALL the staff are exceptional in their jobs!! It definitely made an otherwise traumatic experience more than bearable!! Thank you from the bottom of my heart VPSC!!
Good surgery! Feels great to be fresh!
Efficient and friendly

name: Victorian Institute of Forensic Mental Health
Victorian Institute of Forensic Mental Health Prison Health Service

reviews.text: Comprehensive and professional services including surgery and testing. World class equipment and up to date knowledge based on best practices

My GP referred me here. 

They put some eye drops in my eyes and I thought it was just regular drops. It burt then he told me it was to dialate my pupils when I asked.

I got out. Things were blurry and very bright. I thought I was gonna get run over by a car when I crossed the road. I found my car and I am still stuck in it after 2 hours because I can't see well enough to drive so I might as well just write my first review on google. 

Price was almost a double of what I was told when I booked the appointment.

I can't say that is how you do informed consent.
Discriminating receptionists.  Girls working at the front are not nice people.

My mother (83 yrs old) was informed that She will be operated on such & such day. Once there, she was prepared for the operation and only then informed about cost... $3000+. During consultations (3 & 6 weeks before) She was NEVER informed about about the cost - She was led to believe that it will be covered by medicare. 
Not very honest or professional  !!! Beware of them...
Long time client of this facility and recent consultations and operations performed professionally with care/advice and great outcome, thank you.
Long wait times and overcrowded

I wish to publicly express my appreciation for the treatment and care I received as a result of a total hip replacement I had carried out at the Wangaratta Private Hospital.
All medical practitioners and nursing staff acted with competence and compassion.  At all times I felt confident that my recovery was in good hands and all actions were carried out in my best interest.
The facilities were impeccably clean and well maintained and meals were adequate.
The entire process from pre-admission administration through to discharge was handled without any complications and I am grateful that an establishment of such high quality exists in Wangaratta.

Caring, professional staff who have a great mentoring and support approach when handing over at shift time. All staff took the time to personslly get to know me as a patient and to make sure I felt safe, confident and happy with my care.  I was encouraged to ask questions and discuss my treatment. All up a great team right across the board.

When dealing with critically ill patience, the place lacks interest for saving lives. Depending on who is on duty depends on quality of care.  Terribly understaffed.  

I will never forget the lack of attention to care when the 'nurse' arrived with a little tray of morphine just after the drs stopped the life support on my father. Their response was: "Oh you are too late." There was not attention to patient care. The nurses and doctor/specialist didn't look particularly interested in the situation; more interested in finishing up and moving on!!!!  Although rather very keen to find out if there was any chance for organ donation?!   Seriously?     TERRIBLE! 

Too much hospital politics. People around you can hear you and understand you!  

Need more respect for your patience and quality patient care!!!  This hospital has gone downhill!! APPAULING

Excellent, professional friendly care. From admission to surgery and discharge, all was handled in the best way possible.
Thank you to ALL

This place is an absolute disgrace!

My mother in law passed away sooner than we expected.  There was no discussion about arrangements. We spoke to them at 12.19am after they informed us she had died at 12.01 am with no empathy, and telling us we have four hours to remove her body!  However after expressing disbelief at their statement, they extended it to 6 hours, which would be 6.01am on a Saturday.  If this was done, they had pre arranged agreements with Heritage and Heritage funerals for them to take the body.

There seemed to be no consideration in a palliative care facility that people die, unless of course you take into account the opportunity to profit from death and grief. 

Her entire care regime was based around anti psychotic medication and sedation despite the fact that she was not aggressive, agitated or otherwise difficult to manage.  With her cancer it made her comfortable to stand then to sit and to repeat this process.  This was considered agitation and the registrar believed this would lead to violent and aggressive behaviour.   She was diagnosed only a week to the day before with pancreatic and liver cancer.  I was sitting with her two days before she died when one of the nurses said she was going to give her something to calm her down.  I said she is calm! This was an absolute manipulation to enforce a predetermined medication regime upon her.  

If you have any consideration for your loved ones going through end of life care, this is not the place for you.
Incredibly patient and caring staff and environment.  It is as good as palliative care can be for both the patient and the family.

The Oncology Rehab group with Peter and Amy and their team is wonderful. I felt so happy doing this rehab class, twice a week.The overwhelming care and empathy  that i felt was very special. It was just what i needed, I just wish it was for more than 7 weeks. Thank you Peter, Amy and team xo

An exceptionally healthy work culture of positivity and respect at Wantirna Health. Staff are very friendly and helpful, and genuinely care about the patients, who receive exceptional health care from Eastern Health staff. Well done, Eastern Health.

I cannot speak highly enough of the wonderful care my mother received in the Palliative Care ward. Every member of staff was caring, compassionate and helpful. We are so grateful that Mum had the opportunity to be cared for in this facility with such a committed friendly staff at the end of her life. Thank you all.

First ever stay in a hospital and it exceeded expectations.  Amazing hard working and attentive staff on Boyd ward could not have been better.  Beautiful quiet  comfortable room and private bathroom. The body conforming  mattress greatly appreciated over my 5 night stay spent sleeping on my back. Catering was also excellent with staff available to discuss daily menus and adjust to personal meal preference.  Great place to recover quickly.  Surgeon, anaesthetist and supporting staff were all first class and took time to explain procedures and choices.  Surgeon took time to visit daily with updates during recovery.

A very well run hospital.  Had bypass surgery, was up the next day and on day 3 was encouraged to wear out their carpet.   Surgeon must be the best most experienced in the country and it shows in the amazing short recovery.  Calm efficient and caring,  all the nursing staff are well trained professionals.   I witnessed the way they managed a patient with Alzheimer's and at all times they were calm and respectful.  I consider myself extremely lucky to have been treated here.  Thank you.

I was disappointed that the standard of care here fell well short of acceptable in all of the areas I can think of. Rough treatment, arguing staff, nurse calls going unanswered, comfort neglected (when I couldn't move to adjust myself), lack of friendliness (except for one member of the night staff). My 2 day stay was simply horrible. For a private hospital, this is the worst I have ever seen - and I paid for it. Really hope I never have to return.
I was in for day surgery. All the nurses looked after me really well. Took their time and didnt rush me out. Great service!

In for two nights after surgery.  Very pleased with the standard of care. Had a spacious private room with natural light and very clean bathroom. Lead nurses (Belinda and Loretta) were very conscientious and caring. Everyone was friendly and keen to ensure I was comfortable and had whatever I needed. Couldn’t fault it.

We booked our 7-year-old son in for a tonsillectomy and adenoidectomy on 10/04/2019, we were already running late for our morning admission time due to traffic, so we notified the staff at the hospital who reassured us that it was not a problem. Our experience with every member of staff from that point on was extremely friendly and positive. We were all made to feel comfortable from the moment we walked in, to the moment our son was discharged, even the staff in Hudson's coffee were friendly. Our anaesthetist Dr Anthony Burn was amazing with our son, he explained the process in a calm, positive and friendly manner which put not only our son at ease, but also us.  Our son was already happy to know that Mr Buchanan was his surgeon of choice, due to his friendly nature, but together with Dr Burn, we were all quietly confident that he was in good hands. 
We were privately funded and to be honest, we were a bit sceptical based on the negative reviews that we had read about the hospital. The fact that our preferred surgeon Mr Buchanan only operated out of 2 hospitals and that it was in our son’s best interest to have this surgery sooner rather than later, helped make our decision to take a leap of faith, and we are so very grateful that we did. 
Thank you to every staff member that helped make our son Parker’s overnight stay such a positive and friendly experience, without your patience, friendliness and calming professionalism, our son would’ve been afraid to have the much-needed surgery.

B and T Gunn
very nice people, quite satisfied with the facilities over there.

I read some reviews and got scared of adimoting my son for his operation. But at the end took him there and staff were really nice and helpful. Specially the anestheologist was awesome. He was so friendly and nice. Jus gone thing I would like to recommend the hospital to do with patience to provide a prior communication to patient what can be expected, like when to arrive at the hospital, does patience need to do anything extra, whether to eat or not prior to the operation, how long will the whole procedure take, etc. I had to ask for information but there are people may not ask which ll put them in trouble to organise things. Need to be little bit more systematic. Thank you.

I can't speak more highly of the staff at this hospital as I went into breast surgery there. The nurses were so caring especially Jess and the lovely woman that looked after me from the MIA radiology dept. It means alot to be cared for like this and I thank them very much.

Extremely disappointing. 

The very first point of contact was horrible. We were met with a rude receptionist that didn’t even bother to greet us. The nurses also made us feel extremely uncomfortable during the duration of our stay. 

The overall experience left us bitter towards the hospital, so we don’t recommend coming here.

I am giving 3 stars because doctors and the specialist team saved my wife’s life, so a big thank you to all of them from the bottom of my heart. However I am not too happy about the emergency triage management where there is limited staff and for some strange reason the triage nurses behind the screen love giving out painkillers and paracetamol when the patient like my wife who probably was few hours away from septic shock. I am grateful to the hospital for saving my wife but they need to improve things with emergency triage cause waiting 5 hours in a critical condition even though person is still standing shouldn’t be used as marker for a person who might die in few hours.

Best hospital, I admitted to the hospital with very serious condition on 3 March 2019. Dr of mercy hospital cured me well. Nurses are well trained and responsible. Food provided in the hospital Is well maintained and served. Hospital is neat and clean. So this is the best hospital in hopper crossing.

Amazing to find such a good public hospital and it's all down to the great staff! They are friendly and really care about getting you a great outcome. As it is public they are very busy so sometimes there is a wait but other than that I'm very grateful to have this hospital as my local

My aunty was bought in through ambulance for huge amounts of bleeding.
Waited for hours in the waiting area
When finally let through waited another 2 hours for the doctor to come in to just yell at her and asking if she would like to have her leg amputated because "people like her who don't treat a bleed properly cause people like him to look like the bad guy to amputate it" 
And without supplying any pain medication or anything he just told us to get out and leave 
Everyone else we had a lovely experience with besides this one doctor..

Can understand why rating is so low.. went in emergency with 10 month old baby... after initial triage.. waited around 2-3 hours... nothing moves... not even patient even ahead of us to lost the patience and left the place... people at counter or triage nurse also not available most of the time... and not courteous enough to keep communicating .... you get a feel... “we dont give a damn... if you have no options keep waiting “

I brought my wife in last night with an illness. The care she was given was absolutely 1st class. The staff were brilliant in the way they cared for her while being thorough with their investigations. Thank you to all the staff. You all do a brilliant and important job for our community.
Thank you Lauren for looking after my Dad!! You r fabulous just as he is !! Carol Collins But he's difficult just as I am I'm grateful Cx
The friendliest and most helpful staff of any hospital I’ve ever been to.  We were seen to quickly as well, although it was New Years Day so there wasn’t very many people in front of us.

left my daughters open draining wound with the same dressing for 48 hours  causing it to become infected then proceeded to write a discharge letter that blames her for the infection..have received nothing but incompetence from this hospital anytime have been there will never  go there or take anyone there again.
Not once did we get to speak with a senior experienced doctor only those fresh out of med school , none of them knew what the other had said or done it was a total shambles no communication lousy infection control, lousy wound care its a wonder people arent dropping like flies from sepsis .....
Good for getting fits
The most amazing, beautiful, kind, compassionate and understanding nurses, doctors, orderlies and even cleaning and catering staff! The modern facilities are always clean and well looked after.

Been the best hospital and emergency ive been to always helped me n my gf when we needed help n looked arfter us with so much care i would give more then 5 stars if i could cause they desrve more then 5 stars

My daughter was taken into the Bush hospital in helliton today after a vicious domestic  violence incident. (We are making arrangements to drive the 9+hrs to be with her) in the meantime we are relying on the hospital staff to look after her  
I rang the hospital after not hearing from my daughter in 20 min. We were all extremely anxious and panicking, thinking the worst. I rang the emergency dept. After x3 attempts the phone was eventually answered. A nurse in ED was beyond rude told me that my daughter wasn't texting me (parent) or her twin because.. quote " maybe she doesn't want to talk too you! Did you think of that " is this how the Hamilton district hospital treats family members of domestic violence survivors? The nurse who said the above was names SHIVORNE. I only rang and bothered You, because our last text said she was curled up with her arms holding her head because she's in so much pain, (Panadol) wasnt helping and No one was telling her anything 
* SHAME ON THE HAMILTON HOSPITAL ED STAFF ON THE NIGHT OF 13TH MARCH 2019 * 
As her family we were concerned  your treatment was beyond disgusting and made the whole situation worse.
Grate friendly staff going above and beyond to help
The staff are even more beautiful than the hospital building itself. By far the best hospital experience I've had in a very long time.
The most amazing, beautiful, kind, compassionate and understanding nurses, doctors, orderlies and even cleaning and catering staff! The modern facilities are always clean and well looked after.

Been the best hospital and emergency ive been to always helped me n my gf when we needed help n looked arfter us with so much care i would give more then 5 stars if i could cause they desrve more then 5 stars

My daughter was taken into the Bush hospital in helliton today after a vicious domestic  violence incident. (We are making arrangements to drive the 9+hrs to be with her) in the meantime we are relying on the hospital staff to look after her

Friendly and efficient staff all around. From front desk to nurses to doctors.

Well taken care of by all staff, Doctor Thai Quach was friendly informative and made me feel at ease. Anesthetiser Tim  Fryer was very comforting, reassuring and professional, very happy with the whole procedure and staff.

Very professional and friendly staff. The procedure was very fast. The Doctor spoke to me right away after the procedure as well. The anaesthetist was also very friendly and did the cannula painlessly, also cheaper than others in the area!

Really rate this hospital highly, I have been to emergency twice as well as my mother once and each time their care and attention to detail has been spot on. Friendly and caring staff. The staff are professional and compassionate - true care givers. They work endless hours and deserve the utmost respect.I grumbled because I had to wait 14 hours to get admitted for surgery but considering it is a public hospital that is pretty good.I would actually say Footscray could even compete with some private with the standards it has
Long waiting times for emergency. I have no idea how hospitals are run but I think they try their best. But had to wait 2 hours before a doctor even  did a check! Get more staff!

After around 10 visits to see around 8 different wars and doctors I can say that standards are really mixed between individual doctors and wards. I found consistency between the nursing and admin staff which is a very high standard. 

I wouldn’t give this Hospital a blanket recommendation but it can be good, but just be aware that things do vary at every professional health care provider.

Was called in as my nan was dying on Christmas eve. Went out to move my car to see I was moments away from a Fine! 
What hospital parking fines people in these situations?? Really dissapointed they are preying on the weak.
Nicest people I’ve ever met in my life, from Claudia at the front desk to the gorgeous recovery nurses and all the surgeons and anaesthetists. Wonderful, clean and lovely hospital.
Great experience. Staff very friendly and caring.From Rose @ surgical admissions to all the nurses and PAs and doctors did everything  to keep me relaxed and comfortable.  Thanks for your great care.

It's not a bad Hospital. Its just that some of staff can be a little too much. & not just the western general but all Hospital food is quite wrotten. But this is all good if you have family or friends bringing in food for you to eat.
I am sorry for your poor customer treatment. The hospital as private need more improvement.

My friend was transferred to Williamstown hospital and suffered Pressure Injuries on his feet and heel.  Not only the nurse did not attend to these PI, he was forced to stand on his feet to walk.  I found used sugar prickers, used sugar testing strips on his meal table and on the floor. I also found soiled nappy left openly in the general bin in the shared shower/toilet. Despite the doctor diagnosed him dementia, he was asked to sign form on the same day, without answered the question what happened if he refused to sign. Every nurse used the same phrase "This is my first day working in this hospital, I am still not familiar with the EMR computer". The "Call for help buzzer" was not attended to for more than 30 minutes. I was asked not to come until visiting hours but I knew my friends and other patients family members were visiting their sick family member at the Williamstown hospital from 8am to 10pm every day for months. My friend will not survive under their care but he has no family members to speak up for him. The nurse in charge and many others did not wear name tag to be stand out for any situation.

My nearly 4 year old son literally stopped walking, he couldn't bear weight on his legs so I took him to Williamstown emergency as we were nearby. He had an ultrasound and the doctor said there was fluid in his hip and it would resolve with nurofen and rest but to come back in 3 days if he wasn't walking and/or had a fever or vomiting. 3 days later he still wasn't walking and had developed a fever so we went back. A different doctor said there was no mention of fluid in his hip in the notes, that he had tonsilitis and suggested he was faking not being able to walk. He was unbelievably blase about my son, aggresive and rude. A nurse in emergency said I should stop pushing him in a pram and force him to walk and insinuated I was making up the fact he couldn't walk and that he was spoiled and manipulating me! She was incredibly rude and snide. I took him straight to the Royal Children's and whilst a junior doctor had no idea what was wrong, the Consultant pediatrician took one look at him not bearing weight and diagnosed him with viral myositis, an inflammatory reaction post-virus sometimes seen in young boys around Spring-time. Long story short, if you are a parent, NEVER waste time at this hospital with its rude and incompetent staff. Their attitude and treatment of me was extremely distressing.

If i could do zero stars i would, 
We were referred to this hospital.
The doctor was useless and did nothing.
Triage and admin staff very friendly.
But the doctor did nothing for me.

Came at 10:50pm with my partner who had a dislocated shoulder and the website says the hospital closes at 11:30. We show up at emergency and are turned away by security saying the hospital closes at 11pm. I have never had a positive experience at this terrible hospital. Definitely go anywhere else
Great Hospital ,friendly staff ,amazing Nurses ,good Doctors and has a country feel about it, highly recommend it.

Great hospital, friendly staff too. Ive been in for surgery, emergency department and radiology cant complain about any staff member was a pleasure to go there. Clean and tidy cleaning staff do a great job.

GRWAT hosiptal care I have been 2 tines for different reasons and my care was OK I didn't like how doctors didn't comuacate WOTH each other I had to call them while in hospital so I could continue my meds
